Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint because several accounts listed on my credit report involve unverified or inaccurate information. Despite sending certified mail to request validation of these debts, I have not received a proper response. These actions violate my rights under federal laws, including 15 U.S.C. 1681b, 15 U.S.C. 6802, and 12 U.S.C. 6802, which regulate the proper handling of consumer information and debt collection practices. Below are the accounts and specific issues : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$2200.00} Issue : On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified debt validation request ( USPS Tracking # XXXX ), which was delivered between XX/XX/XXXX. I have not received a response. The collection agency has failed to prove ownership of the debt or provide supporting documentation, violating my rights under the FDCPA and FCRA. XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : Balance : {$1200.00} Issue : I do not recognize this debt nor the collection agency managing it. Despite sending a certified validation request, I have received no response. This lack of response and continued reporting violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b regarding permissible purposes for sharing consumer information. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) XXXX : {$260.00} Issue : I do not recognize this account, which has been inaccurately marked under " fraud. '' I sent a certified debt validation request on XX/XX/XXXX, but the collection agency has not provided any documentation or proof of this debt. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Balance : {$1000.00} Issue : This account has been reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX without proper validation. Despite a certified mail request sent on XX/XX/XXXX, no response or documentation has been provided. This violates 12 U.S.C. 6802, which governs the sharing of consumer financial information without proper consent or verification. XXXX XXXX : Balance : {$2300.00} Issue : The original creditor is reporting this debt as charged off. However, I have no knowledge of this account. My certified mail request for validation has not been answered. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$0.00} ( Charged Off ) Issue : This account has been sold to another lender, yet I have received no information about the new creditor. This creates an incomplete and unverifiable record on my credit report, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681b. Violations of Federal Laws Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Collection agencies are continuing to report and pursue debts without validating their claims, in violation of my rights under the FDCPA. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Information has been shared with collection agencies without proper validation or permissible purpose. Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) 12 U.S.C. 6802 : My financial information has been shared without my knowledge or consent, violating federal privacy protections. On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified mail request for validation to the collection agency handling this account. The XXXX tracking number for this request is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and it was confirmed delivered between XX/XX/XXXX. To date, I have not received a response or documentation validating this debt. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), this failure to validate violates my consumer rights. I respectfully request that this account be removed immediately from my credit report. 



On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified mail request for validation to the collection agency, tracked via USPS # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. This request was confirmed delivered between XX/XX/XXXX, but I have not received a response. 

Under the FCRA and FDCPA, failure to validate a debt is grounds for removal. I respectfully request that this account be deleted from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute 2 collections account reported by Portfolio Recovery on my XXXX credit report. These accounts have been reviewed and deleted by XXXX due to inaccurate reporting and lack of validation. Despite the deletion by XXXX, XXXX continues to report these accounts, which is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Specifically, the information appears to be inaccurate or unverifiable. The continued reporting of these accounts creates inconsistencies between the credit bureaus, unfairly affecting my credit profile. I have attached documentation supporting my claim, including Proof from my XXXX credit report showing the account 's deletions confirming the accounts were removed. I request that the CFPB investigate this matter promptly and ensure that XXXX removes these accounts from my credit report, reflecting accurate and consistent information.

Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative: There was a fraudulent charge on my credit card. The charges were reversed, but Regions Bank had to cancel my existing credit card and issue a new credit card. When they issued the new card, they canceled autopay without telling me about it. After the first late fee was assessed, I challenged the late fee on the grounds that they had canceled autopay without telling me. They reversed the late fee. I checked the account online to confirm autopay was active. It said it was. Yet, again, the next month autopay did not go through. I was charged another late fee. They would not remove this fee. I called to tell them that autopay was enabled. They said the online system was incorrect. They said you can not set up autopay online even though there is an option to set up autopay online. They said I would have to mail in a form to set up autopay. I mailed that form in XXXX. It is the end of XXXX and XXXX has still not gone through. I was charged another late fee despite having mailed an autopay authorization two months ago. Again, they will not remove this late fee.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative: Failure to Disclose Notice of Sale and GAP Insurance Credits by Flagship Credit Acceptance I am writing to formally notify the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding the refusal of Flagship Credit Acceptance to provide essential disclosures related to the repossession and subsequent sale of my vehicle. Despite my repeated requests, Flagship Credit Acceptance has failed to disclose the following critical information : 1. **Notice of Sale** : The lender has not provided the required notice detailing the sale of the repossessed vehicle, including the sale price, as mandated by applicable state laws. 2. **GAP Insurance Credits** : I have requested information regarding any amounts credited from my Guaranteed Asset Protection ( GAP ) insurance that were applied towards the sale price of the vehicle and the remaining loan balance. This information is crucial for understanding my financial obligations following the repossession. Under California law, lenders are obligated to provide a detailed accounting of the sale of repossessed vehicles, including the sale price and any credits from GAP insurance [ [ 3 ] ] The lack of transparency in this matter not only violates my rights as a consumer but also undermines the regulatory framework designed to protect borrowers from unfair practices. I urge the CFPB to investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that Flagship Credit Acceptance complies with its legal obligations. The failure to disclose this information is detrimental to my financial well-being and may constitute a violation of the Consumer Financial Protection Act.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of this year 2024 I was told by my mortgage company XXXX XXXX that my home value increase property taxes of {$810.00} will be added to my mortgage, and payment will increase from {$1300.00} to {$1400.00} across the loan of XXXX remaining. I told them at that time I'd pay the taxes owed so my mortgage won't change. I was then told to wait to pay it, and someone will call me to set up the payment. No one called back after a week past. During this time I was in a car accident and after XXXX weeks past, I received a letter stating that my mortgage company has changed to XXXX XXXX. I was going through doctor visits, procedures, and was in very bad condition to pursue the process of the new mortgage company, and to find out if the issue was resolved. I then saw the amount never changed and {$1400.00} was my new expected mortgage payment to XXXX XXXX. This increase will add an additional {$45000.00} to my mortgage. They added it without my knowledge that they were selling my loan. Now my new mortgage company is looking to charge me this illegally set mortgage payment. I need action to be done to correct this and put back my mortgage where it should be at {$1300.00}.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I made a purchase from a company called XXXX XXXX for a non conforming item with my PayPal account. I returned the item and waited for the company to issue the credit. The company did not provide the full credit so I filed a dispute with Paypal. 

I filed a dispute and was issued credit for the item. Later Paypal charged my account an additional {$130.00} and put a restriction on my account. Mind you, I pay my bills monthly with them. I called to ask why this happened they tell me I would have to contact PayPal credit. Why is the consumer saddled with determining who it is you're dealing with? They do this to frustrate the consumer and try to steal your money! I am on the phone right now with PayPal credit and I am recording the call. She can't make heads or tail of what it is PayPal is doing. She's asking me what is Paypal doing? How am I supposed to know? If XXXX is an agent of Paypal, why am I saddled with trying to decipher what Paypal is doing? 
Paypal credit said they never gave me a credit twice but just once. They do not know what Paypal is saying, or doing. They only issued the credit once and not twice as the letter from Paypal is stating. 
This is so frustrating.

Paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Against Bank of America for Breach of Trust, Contract, and Fraudulent Practices To the Attorney General Offices of Florida : I am submitting this formal complaint to address Bank of Americas fraudulent practices, breach of trust, and deliberate mismanagement of my mortgage loan. These actions have resulted in significant financial loss, mental distress, and long-term harm to my familys stability. My mortgage, originally with a remaining balance of {$17000.00}, was improperly handled in ways that reveal a pattern of predatory intent under the guise of industry standards.

Key Issues in My Complaint : 1. Unauthorized Placement in Forbearance : In early XXXX, anticipating financial strain from my military duties during the COVID-19 pandemic, I requested a refinance for my home loan. Instead, Bank of America placed my loan into forbearance without my consent or proper explanation. My efforts to reverse this unauthorized action were met with absolute refusals, with representatives stating that the decision was irreversible. When I continued to question this action, I was repeatedly dismissed and told that it was industry standard. 

2. Mishandling of Loan Transfers : While the forbearance issue remained unresolved, Bank of America transferred my loan to XXXXXXXX and later to XXXX XXXX. XXXX has since ceased operations, leaving me unable to access vital documentation of payments made under their servicing. Bank of America failed to ensure that I had a complete record of my loan history before this transfer, severely compromising my ability to manage my mortgage. 

3. Financial and Emotional Harm : This ordeal has caused profound financial damage and stress. Due to the unauthorized forbearance, the extra payments I had made during my active military service were rendered useless. Navigating the confusing and deliberately obstructive responses from Bank of America has exacerbated the challenges of providing for my family post-COVID. The systemic failures and dismissive responses have eroded my financial security and caused immeasurable mental anguish. 

Historical Misconduct by Bank of America XXXX Bank of America has a documented history of predatory and fraudulent practices targeting homeowners, evidenced by penalties and legal actions : XXXX DOJ Settlement : The bank agreed to a {$16.00} XXXX settlement with the U.S. Department of Justice for mortgage fraud, including misrepresenting loan quality and selling defective loans to consumers and investors. 
COVID-19 Forbearance Issues : Numerous consumer complaints reveal that Bank of America improperly placed mortgages into forbearance without borrower consent during the pandemic, further harming financially vulnerable customers.

Ongoing Allegations : Despite past penalties, Bank of America continues to face widespread allegations of mismanagement, deceptive practices, and failure to communicate effectively with borrowers. 
These actions demonstrate a systemic pattern of exploitation, perpetuated despite previous accountability measures. 

Requested Resolutions : To address the extensive harm caused, I request the following actions : Restoration of Loan Terms : Reverse the unauthorized forbearance and restore my loan to its original terms, reflecting the accurate remaining balance of {$17000.00}. 
Comprehensive Documentation : Provide all payment records, loan activity, and detailed explanations of adjustments made during Bank of Americas servicing and subsequent transfers.

Integration of Deferred Balances : Consolidate any deferred amounts into a transparent, structured payment plan, ensuring future payment discrepancies are avoided.

Independent Audit and Accountability : Conduct a third-party review of my mortgage account for violations of consumer protection laws, including the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) and the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ). 
Substantial Financial Compensation : Monetary Damages : Restitution for financial losses, lost payments, and inflated fees caused by Bank of Americas unauthorized actions.

Punitive Damages : Compensation that reflects the gravity of their repeated misconduct and failure to address systemic issues.

Interest and Legal Fees : Reimbursement for accrued interest and costs incurred in resolving this matter.

Emotional Distress Compensation : Recognition of the severe mental and emotional harm inflicted on me and my family due to these practices. 
Closing Statement : As a veteran who has proudly served my country, I expect institutions entrusted with financial stewardship to operate with integrity. Instead, Bank of America has engaged in practices that exploit its customers, leveraging systemic vulnerabilities under the guise of standard practice.

I respectfully urge the Attorney Generals office to thoroughly investigate these practices and hold Bank of America accountable for their actions. My case represents one of many instances where the institution has harmed homeowners through deceptive means. The resolution of this complaint will not only provide justice for my family but also safeguard countless others from enduring similar harm.

In short : I was close to paying off my loan, but Bank of America placed me on forebearance and sold my loan to another company because it was an : " Industry Standard ''. Not sure what that means, but the outcome as a homeowner has only proved negative. 

I have tried to resolve the problem by myself, as I consult with an escalation expert from Bank of America, with them telling : There's nothing we can do, it is not our problem anymore, go talk with your new servicer, by whom is owned by XXXX XXXX as an investment property, but uses servicing from XXXX XXXX, whom are not recognized within the mortgage industry.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Sub-issue: None
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year>, I received a fraudulent call pretending to be from Affirm, asking for my account PIN. I immediately reported this to Affirm, and my account was placed on hold to prevent any fraudulent activity. 

On XX/XX/year>, I attempted to make a purchase using Affirm but was declined because Affirm could not confirm my identity. I contacted Affirm daily through chat and phone from XX/XX/year>, to XX/XX/year>, to resolve this issue and reactivate my account. Each time, I was informed that my case would be escalated and resolved within XXXX business days. However, the issue remains unresolved, and my account is still frozen. 

On XX/XX/year>, I was informed by Affirm that my Shop Pay account information does not match my Affirm account due to my Shop Pay account being associated with my previous name and email. To address this issue, I : Contacted XXXX XXXX daily from XX/XX/year>, to XX/XX/year>, to request the deletion of the outdated account. 
Used Shop Pays account deletion process multiple times, but the outdated account still exists. 
Created a new XXXX XXXX account under my updated legal name and contact details. 
Provided Affirm with proof of identity as requested to reflect my updated name. 
Affirm successfully updated my legal name on the account after verifying my identity, but they will not allow me to verify my identity to unfreeze my account. This inconsistency has prevented me from resolving the hold and using my account. 

Additionally, the loan number in this complaint is for a successful loan from before these issues began. Declinations do not come with loan numbers, so I used this loan number to help Affirm locate my account and resolve the issue. 

Despite my repeated efforts with both companies, including multiple verification attempts, my Affirm account remains frozen, and XXXX XXXX has not confirmed the deletion of the outdated account. These issues continue to prevent me from making purchases or using XXXX XXXX Installments effectively.

Sub-issue: Other problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a Capital One Venture XXXX  credit card based on their advertised robust travel services, which they provide through the Capital One XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/year>, I booked a XXXX XXXX ticket for {$110.00} through this portal for travel on XX/XX/year>. I later rescheduled the ticket to XX/XX/year> through the same platform. Capital One XXXX did not inform me of penalties or fees tied to cancellations or rescheduling. 

Following this, I decided to cancel the ticket through Capital One XXXX today ( XXXX, 2024 ), as I was assured by the platform interface that XXXX would provide an airline credit worth the ticket price to my account for future use. However, when I tried to utilize this airline credit, Capital One XXXX informed me of a {$99.00} penalty being imposed on my account, allegedly on behalf of XXXX, because of the cancellation. This penalty was not communicated to me when I rescheduled or canceled the ticket. 

I reached out to Capital One XXXX via customer hotline to resolve the issue, pointing out their lack of transparency, but they refused to take responsibility, instead directing me to contact XXXX XXXX. XXXX, in turn, stated that since the ticket was booked through a third-party agency, any concerns should be addressed with Capital One XXXX XXXX 

I was shocked by this response and felt trapped in a situation where neither party was willing to provide clarity or resolution. Upon further research, I discovered that many customers have encountered similar problems with Capital One XXXX. It seems that customers are lured into opening credit cards like the Venture XXXX, which has a {$390.00} annual fee, with promises of robust travel support, only to face poor service and hidden penalties when utilizing these advertised benefits. 

This lack of transparency, combined with the failure to disclose material terms about penalties, feels deceptive and exploitative. If I had been informed about the {$99.00} penalty upfront, I would not have proceeded with the rescheduling or cancellation. 

I am requesting that the {$99.00} penalty be removed from my account, as it was never disclosed during the transaction. Additionally, I hope that the CFPB can look into Capital One XXXX 's practices and advertisements for systemic issues that might be harming customers in similar ways. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
We were a victim of identity theft and had to close out our bank accounts and open new ones. We had to make arrangements to have our only income to be direct deposited into the new accounts which took time. 
Evidently when we scheduled a payment, the checking account number was missing XXXX digit so the check was returned internally because I called my bank and they told me that the check was not ever presented to them for payment. 
I called the payment into XXXX mortgage servicing to make the payment for the mortgage and I asked them to fix the account number XXXX months in a row not once did they tell me that I had to fix it on my end. Now because payments were returned XXXX months in a row they now expect us to submit certified bank checks for payment. Our payments were never returned for insufficient funds and before the identity theft we were always on time paying the mortgage. I can have my bank prove that we had the money in the bank enough to cover each payment if we need to. 
This is very unfair to us being XXXX XXXX we cant get to the bank to get a certified check to pay the mortgage. Not to mention the cost of the certified check. 
Now we are behind XXXX and XXXX because XXXX wont allow us to pay traditionally. The money for XXXX is sitting in our bank account because they stress not allowing us to pay it.

Told you not to respond to a lawsuit they filed against you
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX the Law Offices of Hayt, Hayt & Landau P.L. Represented by Attorney XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> TO : Complaint - Court false documents. 



Subject : Complaint Against Hayt, Hayt & Landau P.L., Represented by Attorney XXXX XXXX I am filing this formal complaint against the Law Offices of Hayt, Hayt & Landau P.L., represented by Attorney XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX, for unethical practices, including filing false documents in court and violating privacy protection laws. 

Summary of Complaint : 1. Filing False Affidavits : In a sworn affidavit submitted to the court, Hayt, Hayt & Landau claimed I was served court case documents at a location that i had intended to built a home but never built or lived on. The address cited in the affidavit is vacant land with no structure and has never been inhabited. I do not reside there nor have I ever received any service at that location. 

The affidavit also alleges that a neighbora " white male between XXXX, '' unknown to meconfirmed my identity. This raises serious concerns regarding the falsification of information, as I have no association with any neighbor at the described location, and it appears my private details were improperly disclosed. 

XXXX. Violation of Privacy Protection Laws : The affidavit indicates that my personal information was discussed with a purported " neighbor '' without my consent. This constitutes a violation of federal and state privacy laws, such as the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), which prohibits the disclosure of personal information to third parties. 

3. Misrepresentation and Lack of Transparency : At the time of this complaint, I have not been provided any direct information about the case despite multiple inquiries. I only became aware of this matter through calls from attorneys marketing their services and details obtained from the court clerk. 

XXXX. Evidence of Absence : In XX/XX/year>, I left out of the country for a family emergency and traveled via XXXX XXXX. This can be easily verified and serves as proof that I was not in the location they claim to have served me. 


Applicable Laws Violated : 1. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Section 807 ( 10 ) : Prohibits the use of false or deceptive means to collect a debt.

Section 805 ( b ) : Prohibits the communication of personal information to third parties without consent.

2. Federal Rules of Civil Procedure ( Rule 4 ) : Requires service of process to be completed at the correct address and prohibits the submission of false affidavits of service. 


XXXX. State Laws on False Affidavits and Privacy Violations : Georgia law ( O.C.G.A. XXXX ) : Criminalizes filing false statements or documents in court. 


Impact : Filing false documents and violating privacy laws denies me the rights to a fair trial, undermine the sanctity of the court and consumer protection rights. Attorneys and law firms must be held to the highest standards of legal ethics, ensuring accuracy and compliance with applicable laws.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am nearing the end of my XXXX XXXXXXXX bankruptcy and was advised by my lawyer that I do a full accounting of how the payments were applied to my account by my mortgage servicer ( Fay Servicing ), so 3 months ago I requested a full ledger of all my payments & escrow payments ( since XXXX ) and how they have been applied. 
The first time I requested it they sent me a partial ledger where the running balance columns were missing. I have since requested a full ledger, with all of the columns visible, three times. These requests were spaced out over several weeks ; they said they were going to send them each time but they never did. 
The last phone call request I made was a few weeks ago and the representative hung up on me so I called them back and recorded the call which I will attach to this request. 
During this period the total amount due, as printed on the monthly statements Fay Servicing has mailed to me has fluctuated by almost {$200000.00} : XXXX {$73000.00} XXXX {$86000.00} XXXX {$6400.00} XXXX {$200000.00} Since these numbers are supposed to come from the underlying account ledger, its clear that they are making adjustments. Whats not clear is What they are adjusting Why they are making adjustments Why they have gone to great lengths to avoid providing me with the complete ledger During the bankruptcy, they also tried to foreclose even though they were receiving the full payment of {$3500.00} ( according to my payment plan ). 
This payment was supposed to be applied as {$2400.00} toward the principal and interest and the balance was supposed to be applied to escrow on my current taxes in accordance with my mortgage agreement, but they stopped paying my property taxes and then tried to use my resulting property tax delinquency in support of their foreclosure. 
The judge ruled in my favor but it cost me {$34000.00} in lawyer fees to fight it and obtain this ruling.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem extending the lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally express my dissatisfaction with Ally Financials handling of my lease extension request, which has resulted in unexpected daily fees and significant inconvenience. The sequence of events demonstrates poor communication and a lack of transparency, leading to what I believe are unfair charges.

Background I requested a 30-day lease extension to address repairs for a recalled part on my vehicle. Based on my interactions with Ally representatives, I believed that the lease extension had been approved.

However, I was surprised to receive a call from Ally weeks later, asking for the vehicles return. This was the first indication I had that my extension request had been denied.

Without any notification or explanation of the denial, I was subsequently charged daily extension fees, which I had not agreed to and were applied without my knowledge or consent.

Issues Lack of Notification on Lease Extension Denial I was not informed that my request for a 30-day lease extension was denied. This lapse in communication led me to believe that the extension was in place, causing confusion and financial repercussions when additional fees were charged.

Unfair and Unexpected Fees After learning of the denied extension, I was charged daily extension fees retroactively. These fees are unreasonable given that I acted in good faith, believing the extension had been approved.

Poor Customer Communication Allys failure to clearly communicate the status of my request left me blindsided by the charges and disrupted my ability to plan accordingly. This reflects a lack of transparency and customer care.

Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, after much research on our best options for a new CC, my husband and I opened a Chase Freedom Unlimited credit card which was supposed to include a {$250.00} sign up bonus after spending {$500.00} in the first 3 months. We have spent well over {$500.00} and have never seen the expected {$250.00} bonus - not in the form of a statement credit, and not in the form of points added to our balance on the card. 

Our first purchase was made on XX/XX/XXXX, and now that we are past the 90 days mark since that initial transaction occurred, I reached out to Chase on their " secure message '' feature on the website to inquire when we should expect the funds. I was told that we were never to receive them, that the only sign up perk on this card was 1.5 % additional earnings on all spends up to $ XXXX in the first 12 months. 

I replied back and advised that this was meant to be IN ADDITION to the {$250.00} sign up bonus when we applied... when we signed up we were promised the same bonus that is currently being extended - screen shots attached for reference. 

I replied again advising this is incorrect and that the whole reason we chose the Chase Freedom card was because they were extending an offer for both {$250.00} AND the 1.5 % additional earnings .... They replied again today accusing me of trying to get a " richer offer '' and saying that the only offer extended to me is the 1.5 % additional earnings offer. 
I have looked into this online and found MULTIPLE members complaining of the same experience with Chase when signing up for a new card and then not receiving the bonus that was originally offered on the promotion at the time they applied for their credit card through Chase. I let Chase bank know in my most recent message response that I would be contacting the CFPB to help spread awareness so that future members do not find themselves in this same position.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Sub-issue: None
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against Three Sticks Lending for their unfair lending practices and refusal to revoke a pending payment. Below are the details of my experience : Company Name : Three Sticks Lending Loan Amount : {$1000.00} APR : XXXX XXXX  ( Significantly higher than the legal limit in XXXX  ) State : XXXX XXXX : I took out a loan with this tribal lending company, but upon reviewing the terms, I discovered that the APR is far higher than what is legally allowed in my state ( XXXX  ). When I raised this issue, the company argued that tribal sovereignty exempted them from my state 's interest rate laws. I informed them that various court cases have ruled against tribal lenders for charging exorbitant rates. They softened, said they could " help me '' but not as low as I asked. They insisted that they could not lower the APR to XXXX XXXX the legal limit for XXXX. 

Pending Payment Dispute : On XX/XX/year>, I authorized an early payment of {$280.00} for this loan. However, later I attempted to revoke this pending payment as I felt I was being misled by the company 's policies and it was required to change my APR.

I was told that I could not revoke the pending payment, and that the payment had to clear before they could make any changes to the loan terms or APR.

I requested that they cancel the pending payment. Initially, I was informed by multiple employees that they could not revoke a pending payment. When asking what sort of system did not allow for cancelling pending payments, they would not give me a lucid reason. Multiple people said " the computer won't let it '' or " the system won't allow it. '' They would not tell me what sort of software prevented them from cancelling the pending payment, and Eventually, someone helped me remove ACH access. However, I later found out that revoking a pending payment is not only possible but legally required under certain conditions. 

I was transferred to a supervisor, who continued to insist that it was " not possible '' to revoke a payment while it was pending, and that I had " authorized it '' despite my insistence and legal understanding of the matter ; and the insistence that I was revoking said authorization, since the payment was still pending. This supervisor, named XXXX told me that they could post a refund form, but protested to me asking if it would " probably '' go through. I am concerned they will make no attempt to refund me either, once the payment goes through. Near the end of the phone call, she began making ad hominem attacks about how it was " on me '' that I had a loan, and that I was " looking for loopholes '' and " expecting them to drop everything to fix it. '' She told me that the kind of system they were using to make the payments was " not relevant '' when I asked her, which makes it clear to me that they could revoke the pending payment. A woman later said it was " the rules '' and that she couldn't cancel my pending payment. 

It says this on the loan agreement ; " if your scheduled payment has already been submitted to your financial institution at the time of revocation, it may be necessary for us to wait until that payment posts before we can refund you that payment amount. However, when possible, at the time of revocation, we will void any pending payments. You understand that revoking your authorization does not relieve you of the responsibility of timely paying all amounts due in full that are owed by you under the Agreement. '' It seems to me that they made no good faith attempt to stop the payment, insisting it was impossible.

As of the Electronic Fund Transfer Act ; " Regulation E ( 12 CFR 1005.10 ( b ) ) : ( b ) ( 2 ) : If a scheduled preauthorized transfer has already been submitted for processing, the financial institution is not required to stop the transfer, but it must make reasonable efforts to do so
. '' The APR charged by the company is predatory and violates state laws. I do not believe they operate in good faith, and I believe they were dishonest to me.

I believe the company has misled me regarding their ability to revoke a pending payment, potentially violating legal requirements for consumers to have the ability to revoke authorization for a pending payment. The company 's refusal to change the APR or revoke a pending payment is a violation of consumer rights and possibly indicative of poor business practices or lack of knowledge on how to use their payment system.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX ; XXXX, I pre-applied, was approved then lifted my credit freezes and applied and was approved for a Capital One Unsecured Quicksilver Cash Back, No Annual Fee Credit Card with the PROMOTIONAL {$200.00} bonus for spending {$500.00} in the first 3 months. Capital One immediately mailed out the Quicksilver Credit Card with a FRAUD " Restriction '' placed on the card unbeknownst to me. Once I finally received the card, I attempted to activate the card online but was immediately forwarded to Capital One 's Fraud Dept, supposedly for verification of my identity and address. The Fraud Dept attempted to send a code to your cellphone listed when I applied for you to accept to complete activation, however this process did not work obviously, Capital One has " RESTRICTED '' the card any account attached to it. SO I can not activate the card. 

Next, Capital One 's Fraud dept emailed me a link to upload the following documents/items to prove my identity and prove my address : XXXX. ) The Front and Back of my Drivers License, which MIUST match the address you used to apply for your Capital One card, I submitted that easily and that documentation was accepted **This documentation should have been enough to complete Identity and address but Capital would not activate the card. ** XXXX. ) Upload a Utility bill OR If you don't have utility bills in your name ( which I don't ), you can upload an internet bill. Both bills must show your name, address you used to apply for your Capital One Card, FULL account number and billing must be within the past 10 days. 
**I am a prepaid customer ( XXXX for 14 years ) and PREPAY does not receive a bill. However, XXXX Customer Service emailed confirmation of my cellphone and home internet account with name, address, account number and active status. CAPITAL ONE REJECTED THE DOCUMENTATION because it was not a bill** XXXX. ) Upload my ENTIRE Bank Statement including ALL pages with my account activity OR The Bank Summary page with Name, Address, Account Numbers of ALL your accounts + to supplement the Bank Summary I need to submit a voided check, Deposit slip or a Withdrawal slip from my checkbook register, provided you have a checking account. 
** For privacy purposes, I chose to submit my Bank Summary Page with all of the aforementioned necessary information. I have a checking account but do not have checks as I use my debit card or cash, hence no check to void and no Deposit/Withdrawal slips. I did however do business with a check cashing institution that drafted a check for payment and that check cleared my bank account. I submitted that cleared check front and back to supplement my Account Summary. Capital One Fraud Dept. rejected my submission because my Account Summary shows the last 4 of my account numbers for SECURITY PUROSES and the Fraud Dept simply refused to accept the cleared check as evidence of my address. After speaking with another Fraud Agent, I was advised to have the bank submit on their letterhead all the information confirming my account with my name, address, full account number and if my account was active. I uploaded that documentation from the XXXXXXXX XXXX Branch Manager with return phone number, fax number and email on XXXXXXXX XXXX letterhead as instructed. My submission was again rejected by Capital One 's Fraud dept. ** I went thru this Identification process with various Capital One Fraud Dept reps all whom rejected my documentation for various reasons from XX/XX/XXXX until today XX/XX/XXXX. When I asked to speak to a manager, I asked why the card was deemed FRAUD and why was it " RESTRICTED ''. The Fraud Dept reps and Managers told me " We can not say to disclose why. ' I the asked if they could mail me the reason why and again I was denied the courtesy of a reason via mail. 

Due to Capital One placing a FRAUD " RESTRICTION '' on the Quicksilver Credit Card and account, I can no longer access the CreditWise Credit Monitoring that I have had an account with for 11 years ( since 2013 ) due to an information breach in 2012. So now I am effectively " Restricted : from activating the credit card that I qualified for and I am locked out of a credit monitoring service of which I had an account of 11 years and Capital One verified my identity 11 years ago when I was offered the Credit Monitoring Account. 

Lastly, on XX/XX/XXXX. I received an alert from XXXX notifying me of a new credit card account on my credit file. I login and Capital One has the audacity to report the " Restricted '' Quicksilver Credit Card and " RESTRICTED '' Capital One Account that I have no access to use as an ACTIVE credit card account. That act by Capital One is FRAUDULENT and ILLEGAL!! Needless to say, my credit score took a hit and dropped some points due to this " NEW CREDIT CARD '' reported by Capital One in my credit file. Immediately filed a DISPUTE with XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I immediately called Capital One 's Fraud Dept the next day to file an internal complaint about this abuse of my documentation, my identity and my credit file on today, XX/XX/XXXX. This process and the constant gaslighting, moving the goal post, changing the rules and rejecting the documents that Capital One themselves asked for is FINANCIAL ABUSE and DISCRIMINATION as I a few of my friends whom recommended me to apply with Capital One have applied for Capital One cards in the past XXXX weeks and NEVER went thru the process of what I went through to activate their cards. Then for Capital One to commit FRAUD themselves on my XXXX Credit Report File is the accuser victimizing the victim. Sounds a lot like AI is running Capital One due to the inflexibility, inhumanity and fraudulent activities! 

As a note, I asked Capital One Fraud Department Managers and Reps to file my internal complaints about he process and locking me out of my CreditWise Credit Monitoring Account on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and on XX/XX/XXXX adding to the complaint of the fraudulent reporting of a " RESTRICTED '' Capital One credit card and account on my XXXX Credit File.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered my identity had been stolen. My credit reports showed that a car loan for {$42000.00} was opened with Credit Acceptance Corp on XX/XX/XXXX. The XXXX  purchased a XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX in XXXX XXXX using my social security number. I have never authorized anyone to use my social security number to buy a XXXX XXXX. I have never been to XXXX XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed a police report with the XXXX XXXX Police Department ( case # XXXX ) and a report with the Federal Trade Commission. I froze all my accounts and put fraud alerts on all accounts. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called Credit Acceptance Corp ( car loan company ) to inform them about the identity theft and dispute the loan. Per their request, I emailed them several documents, including the FTC report, my signature on a piece of paper, my signed social security card, and my driver 's license. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received documents from XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( dealership ) which included a copy of my driver 's license ( please see attached file called XXXX XXXX ). I have no idea how the XXXX  got my driver 's license. I never gave anyone my driver 's license nor authorized anyone to use my driver 's license. The documents were strange because there was variation in names, addresses, and dates. I subsequently filed reports with the DMV, post office, and FBI. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call from Credit Acceptance Corp, who stated that they had " concluded their investigation '' and found me " fully responsible for the loan. '' I have several witnesses to my whereabouts on XX/XX/XXXX who are happy to provide witness affidavits. However, Credit Acceptance Corp does not accept witness statements. The XXXX  tried to set up various accounts and get loans in other places but were unsuccessful.

Consumer complaint narrative: My account with XXXX AND XXXX XXXX XXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported in to be removed. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. XXXX AND XXXX XXXX XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative: As evidence of their incompetence I would point out that they state I owed a minimum payment of {$190.00} on XX/XX/year> on their own response letter to CFPB. Using WFs own response stating that I owed {$190.00} on XX/XX/year> and paid {$260.00} on XX/XX/XXXX after having to track them down to find payment information they failed to provide or digital notifications they promised, I would still have overpaid them by {$70.00} on XX/XX/XXXX which more than covers any {$29.00} fee and would have brought the account current ( and overpaid by {$41.00} assuming the fee remained ). Their own document then contradicts itself on the following line stating that {$260.00} was past due between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX while it earlier stated a minimum payment of {$190.00} was all that was due XX/XX/XXXX. Incompetence and deceptive practices has been my experience from Wells Fargo on each attempt to resolve this issue. Their own documentation provided to thwart my attempt to correct and resolve this is riddled with errors. Even if I granted that XXXX received the XX/XX/year> payment XXXX  days late due to their failure to communicate and agreed to the assessed {$29.00} late fee, their own records as provided state that the XX/XX/XXXX minimum payment due was {$190.00} and that the payment they received on XX/XX/XXXX was for {$260.00}. My expectation remains the removal of all late fees and correctly adjusting my account to reflect good standing and accurate payment history throughout. As a gesture of good faith, I will not seek a refund of {$70.00} ( or {$41.00} assuming the {$29.00} fee ) as a result of the stated overpayment on the document they provided.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/year> I filed a dispute with Capitol One regarding a transaction from XX/XX/XXXX. 
Merchant : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Amount : {$1400.00} Date : XX/XX/year> At the time I filed the dispute, the agent did not verify the email address on file or advise we needed to check online statements or documents. The process was not clearly explained and the agent did not take the steps ensure we would receive the necessary information regarding our dispute. After not hearing anything regarding our dispute for some time, I searched on the account online and eventually found a document stating the merchant contested our dispute and we needed to submit additional documentation. The document was difficult to locate, and there were absolutely no alerts indicating there were new documents we needed to review. When I found this document, I called capital one immediately to explain the situation. The one representative sent me an email link to submit the documents however, a document was posted XX/XX/XXXX stating the dispute was closed and capital one was unwilling to reconsider the dispute because we did not submit documents any timely manner. I feel this is unethical and unfair as we were not properly notified of the additional documentation. There was zero attempt to call us by phone, they did not attempt to mail us a letter. I later learned capital one has an incorrect email on file however I'm not entirely sure what the email is as the representative would not share the email with me and would only verify that it is not my father 's email. We have since updated it however I feel due to the lack of proper notification and the fact that the customer service representative who took the initial dispute, did not verify accuracy of information they have on file, Capitol One should have accepted the additional documentation provided for fair consideration. Representatives have told me they would escalate my concerns and reach back out to advise and this has not happened. I feel we have been treated very unfairly as well as very poorly.

XX/XX/XXXX Contacted XXXX XXXX to cancel service and return equipment. I called their customer service line and it was answered by an overseas agent that could barley understand me. I asked several times for a Manager or Supervisor that could help me, but she refused. She took my cancellation order and told me to return my equipment to The XXXX XXXX for return credit. XXXX received my equipment a week later. 

Then in XX/XX/XXXX I received a billing statement from XXXX for {$210.00} for XXXX monthly billing. I again called XXXX Customer Service to no avail. 

I filled an online complaint with XXXX # XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. No reply from XXXX. I started to receive harassing phone calls from XXXX and no one would listen to my side, just said I had to pay or else ... I contacted my bank, XXXX  XXXX XXXX and filled a charge dispute as XXXX took out the payment on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  dispute # XXXX. XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX sent me an email letter stating that they have investigated this dispute and communicated with XXXX and that XXXX has decided to remove the charge and resolve the issue. I was given a credit for the charge in my account. 

Then a month later, I again started getting calls from XXXX saying I owe them money. I again tried to explain what has taken place, but no one wanted to listen. I filled another claim online with XXXX and on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, they updated my claim to " Resolved '' To me this meant they agreed with me, XXXX XXXX XXXX and their own company that the charges were not founded and should be reversed and removed from my account. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I receive a collection letter from I.C. Systems Inc stating that I owe XXXX {$210.00} ... Here we go again... 

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX  XXXX I called IC Systems Inc to dispute this claim and provide the documentation. I called XXXX and the first time I was disconnected before I could reach a person. I called right back and reached " XXXX '' I started to explain that I wanted to dispute this claim and why and that I had proof of a resolution. She kept interrupting me, stating that this is a factual case and XXXX has the right and that this is not for equipment but for service and I said I understood that but I had no service, so how can I be charged, she then interrupted me again and said this is due to early cancellation of the agreement, I tried to explain that this is not the case and she hung up on me and refused to take my dispute. I am filing a complaint with the CFPB

I have not made any significant PayPal transactions in years, so I first verified that there was no corresponding fraudulent activity on my PayPal account. I keep my credit reports frozen but still checked to see if any accounts had been opened with my information recently, but there have not been. Then, XXXX XXXX responded with a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, claiming to include documentation about my account. Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
Please be advised that this is my XXXX XXXX WRITTEN REQUEST AND FINAL WARNING that I fully intend to pursue litigation in accordance with the FCRA to enforce my right and seek relief and recover all monetary damages that I may be entitled to under Section 616 and Section 617 regarding your continued willful and negligent noncompliance. 
Despite my previous XXXX written requests, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. You stated in your responses to my XXXX dispute letters that you have verified that the items listed below are accurate, but you failed to send me copies of the documents that you used to verify these accounts as per my request. The fact that you have ignored my request to send me copies of that of the documents that you used to verify the disputed accounts like you said you did. Your failure to delete the disputed accounts that you can not verify after XXXX written requests is also evidence of your Willful disregard of Federal Law. 
When we go through the discovery process you will be required to produce these documents along with an affidavit swearing under oath that these are the true and correct documents that you used to verify the disputed accounts. The fact that you do not have any of the said documents in your files is proof that you did not properly verify the accounts within 30 days as required by law and Court will order you to delete them.

You say that you have reinvestigated these accounts but you have admitted that all you have done is parroted information given to you by other sources and shifted the burden back to me to contact the original creditor to verify these accounts which is clearly in violation in violation of 1681 { a } { 4 }. 

I also asked you to give me the name of the person in your company who verified the accuracy of these accounts but you ignored this request as well which is another violation of Federal Law and evidence of your willful disregard of the law.

Please be advised that under Section 611 { 5 } { A } of the FCRA-you are required to .PROMPTLY DELETE ALL INFORMATION WHICH CAN NOT BE VERIFIED. I request that you do this immediately.

The law is very clear as to the Civil liability and remedy available to me { Section 616 & amp ; 617 } if you fail to comply with Federal Law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. 
I DEMAND THAT YOU DELETE ALL OF THE ACCOUNTS LISTED BELOW IMMEDIATELY. PLEASE PROVIDE ME WITH A COPY OF AN UPDATED AND CORRECTED CREDIT REPORT SHOWING THAT THESE HAVE BEEN DELETED. 

Accounts that I didnt authorize and had no knowledge of or reporting accurately, police report and FTC report is on file, Please DELETE THEM Account Name XXXX XXXX XXXX___________________ Date open________________________________________ Account Number__XXXX_____________________________ Reason for dispute__IDENTITY THEFT_________________________________ Account Amount____ $ XXXX______________________ Account Name__XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX___________________________ Date open_________________________________________ Account Number___XXXX________________________________ Reason for dispute___IDENTITY THEFT________________________________ Account Amount___ XXXX XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I overpaid Mohela {$180.00} on my student loans before the loans were forgiven. On XX/XX/XXXX, I requested verbally that Mohela refund my account balance, and Mohela customer service told me that they could not do that because the Dept. of Ed. " handles overpayments. '' This isn't accurate. I followed up by requesting the refund from Mohela in writing on XX/XX/XXXX. Mohela responded in writing : " Dear [ NAME REDACTED ], Thank you for contacting MOHELA. Please accept our sincere apologies. We regret that you had a less than satisfactory experience during your interaction with us. We value your feedback, as we understand how important it is to offer exceptional service. Regarding your request ( s ), Our records indicate, an escalated request to refund the credit balance has been submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. Due to the time frame involved ; we have sent your request to be expedited. Once this has been processed, we will send you an updated response. Please allow up to 15 business days for processing. We thank you for your patience. Refunds from the Treasury may up to 90 business days. '' I requested an update from Mohela via email on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that my case was too complex to handle in writing and that I would need to call Mohela to discuss the matter. 

I filed an additional complaint with Mohela on XX/XX/XXXX requesting an update in writing. 

I called Mohela on XX/XX/XXXX for an update and spoke with a customer service agent named XXXX, who told me I had a XXXX balance and asked me " where I was getting my information. '' When I provided the dollar amount, he told me that he " was able to find the information '' and that they would " submit a ticket to escalate the issue, '' which takes " 5-7 business days. '' I called on XX/XX/XXXX and was on hold for a total of two hours after speaking with two customer service representatives who " could not see my account info '' and " couldn't help me. '' When I was transferred to " someone who could help, '' those representatives did not pick up the phone. 

It's been 136 days since I requested a refund in writing. Mohela has acknowledged that a refund should be processed, and they refuse to initiate a refund of the funds they owe me or provide an update.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been involved in a XXXX-year lawsuit with my insurance company over a breach of contract after they refused to cover the costs associated with replacing my cast iron pipes. After years of litigation, we were finally set to go to trial, but fortunately, we settled out of court on XXXX, XXXX 

Since then, Ive submitted all the required documentation to process my claim, including information about the settlement payment, which was made on XX/XX/2024. However, as of today, XX/XX/XXXX, Ive been making multiple calls to Mr.Cooper Loss Draft Depart to inquire about the status of my payment and to ensure there are no further delays. Ive also asked about any additional documentation they might need to avoid further complications. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed that I needed to submit an estimate from the insurance adjuster, which I did. The estimate was for {$13000.00}. However, XXXX, the supervisor I spoke to, told me that they couldnt accept the estimate because my settlement amount is {$120000.00}. I explained that the payment we received was a result of the insurance company breaching their contract in bad faith. Despite this, XXXX insisted that I resubmit a line-item breakdown of the contractors bid, even though the original submission included the total amount. 

I also spoke with XXXX XXXX, who apologized for the delays and assured me that she would try to expedite my check. She understood the urgency of the situation, especially since my family and I have been suffering health issues due to the damage from the cast iron pipes. XXXX later informed me that she had managed to secure a XXXX  % release of the payment. However, I was then told in the evening that my second mortgage lender had endorsed the check incorrectly, and as a result, they would likely send it back to me for a re-endorsement. 

At this point, I am unable to make any progress on repairing my home without receiving these funds. The ongoing delays and confusion are causing significant hardship, and its becoming increasingly difficult to convey to others that I can not move forward without this payment.

Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative:
Fay servicing has escrowed this account. They have been either late or failed to make payments on the Property Insurance and taxes repeatedly over the last few years. 

Further, they have refused to remove escrow from the loan despite not making these payments. 

Recently, this resulted in a lapse on my homeowners insurance subjecting my family and I to substantial liability. If we had lost our home during that time to a disaster, we would have been on the hook for a mortgage and homeless. 

I had to buy a separate policy out of my own pocket to cover the house. Despite this, I continue to have to make escrow payments on an account where the escrow money is not being paid out.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a new store specific credit card with Big Lots, serviced by Comenity Bank in XXXX of XXXX and my first payment was due XX/XX/XXXX. I tried to use the Comenity/Big Lots website/webpage to access my account and was unable to register or access my account. I called the customer service number on my card and the department was closed ( it was after XXXX XXXX XXXX ). I called when customer service was open on XX/XX/XXXX to explain that I was unable to access the site online and requested assistance with the website and my log in ; I made a telephone payment with the customer service agent and then waited on hold to be transferred to a department who could apparently help with the online access. I sat on hold until the line disconnected. In addition, I asked this agent what time of day my payment needed to be made on my due date as often there are cut off times ; I was advised that I can make my payment anytime before the due date ends ( I assume is XXXX XXXX  ), I asked her a second time to confirm, and she confirmed no specific cut off time for payments. 
My 2nd payment was due in XXXX and I ran into the exact same issue of an an inability to access the account via the Comenity/Big Lots website on the day my payment was due which is absolutely frustrating. I then called the customer service number again and asked for help accessing my account ; I was asked by the XXXX agent how I was accessing the site and I advised I was using my XXXX  XXXX with both a safari browser and brave browser. She stated that the site does not work with XXXX products well nor the Brave browser. I advised this was my only point of access ( no computer ) and she said she could not advise how else to fix the issue. I also made a payment with this CS rep for XXXX and asked for a refund of late fees based on these access issues and was advised they could only refund {$15.00}, which they did. 
Now comes my XXXX payment, which I again attempted to use the NEW Big Lots app that I was able to download form the XXXX XXXX. The Big Lots/Comenity card now was accessible via this application. I again tried to register, tried to access my password for an account already created and nothing would work, the app would not send me any verification emails or PW reset emails. 
It appears that Comenity intentionally makes the ability to access payment mechanisms for the credit cards they service difficult and nearly impossible in order to drive profit from late fees.

The mortgage servicer, Servicemac, who is sub-servicing my loan on behalf of Guaranteed Rate, double paid my property taxes that were due by XXXX ( despite my numerous calls to them, explaining and proving that all taxes due by XXXX have already been paid ). Now due to the duplicated payment of property taxes which was the servicer 's fault, they are stating that I have escrow shortage and want to increase my monthly payment by {$700.00}, while my escrow account should have never had escrow shortage. They have mismanaged the funds in my escrow account, and are creating a big payment shock to me which is putting me at risk of defaulting on the mortgage. 

Additionally, they have not been paying me the required 2 % interest on the escrow balance as it's required by CFPB and state of California. I asked them about it, and they said that they don't pay any interest on the escrow balance. This is another violation. 

Lastly, I requested my escrow account to be removed due to their mismanagement of my funds and not paying the required interest. At first, they approved it, but then they rejected the request due to their duplicated property tax payment and the escrow shortage that they created.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX XXXX, have disputed XXXX different charges involving XXXX XXXX XXXX, a cloth diaper company. All three of these orders were for pre-ordered items, with an original turnaround time of XXXX months. In the emails, she announced the additional added XXXX days of turnaround time when she supposedly had manufacturing issues. She continued to cite health and mental health concerns in her continued updates, but insists the products are almost on the way. She previously announced she was going to sell the business to a new owner. The new owner, on XX/XX/XXXX, stated she had received an email from XXXX informing her that she would no longer be selling the business, but provided no explanation. The would-be new owner, XXXX XXXX , announced that she would be stepping away from the business due to all of the confusion. Since then, the XXXX XXXXXXXX website has been shut down and no emails or XXXX messages or posts have been replied to. XXXX husband, XXXX XXXX, appeared in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and informed everyone that he had no idea of the state of affairs occurring in the business and was going to attempt to make it right, yet there have been no refunds, no communication from XXXX, the website is still closed, and XXXX has only made XXXX or XXXX posts stating that he is working on it. He stated he had to " make enough money to pay us all back '' and he " couldn't get a loan that large ''. Sierras manufacturer has publicly stated there have been no new orders from XXXX since XXXX of 2023. This means XXXX has been taking money for preorders that were never even put into production. We created a XXXXXXXX XXXX  for everyone who has never received any of their orders, dating all the way back to XXXX of last year to now. So far, there is a total of over XXXX orders and nearly {$40000.00} that is supposedly missing. No one has received their products, money, or an answer from XXXX. All of us are filing chargebacks on the merchandise that was never created, assuming she was going to attempt to file bankruptcy to avoid paying back all of her customers. We waited for so long due to the continuous updates that the items were coming soon, along with sympathy for her medical and mental health conditions, but it is clear we were all taken advantage of. Since no order were placed since last summer, she has been scamming people and acquiring payments for items she never even intended to order for over a year. She intentionally waited for the XXXX day dispute time frame to be over so people could not dispute to get their money back. 

I called Wells Fargo and explained this to them, that I never received any products, that she scammed everyone out of tens of XXXX of dollars, and that she intentionally waited until the dispute time frame was expired. They immediately denied my disputes without even reading the information I had sent them to their dispute email. I'm in the process of closing down my Wells Fargo accounts because of their handling of this situation. It's completely unfair that she was able to scam hundreds of people out of almost {$40000.00} and some banks won't do anything about it. Many of us have started an investigation with her husband, XXXX XXXX 's, military superior. This business was also illegally run out of a military base with no license and without the knowledge of the military. 

Even though it's been a longer time frame, they should not be able to get away with scamming moms out of so much money with no repercussions. I have XXXX disputes, XXXX with credit cards and XXXX with a debit card for nearly {$300.00}. With XXXX coming and the economy in the state that it is, I really need that to feed my kids and provide them with some kind of holiday. Please help me achieve justice against this felony act. It's completely unfair that even though it has been a more extended amount of time, Wells Fargo refuses to even read my dispute and my information for a product that I never received and was never even created in the first place, after being with them for nearly XXXX  years. This is morally wrong.

I am writing in response to a letter sent from your company regarding a debt you claim I owe. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( b ), I am formally requesting a validation of this debt. I do not recognize this debt, and I am requesting documentation to confirm its validity.

Please provide me with the following information : The original creditors name and address : To understand where the debt originated.

Verification of the debt amount : A breakdown of the amount you claim I owe, including any fees or interest. 
Proof of my liability : Documentation showing that I am indeed responsible for this debt, and that it has not been paid or otherwise settled. 
Your agency 's authority to collect this debt : A copy of the purchasers agreement between your agency and the original creditor authorizing you to collect the debt. 
Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the debt, and cease all collection activities until you have provided adequate verification of the debt. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving the requested information at your earliest convenience. If you can not provide the requested validation, please delete the account from your records and notify any applicable credit bureaus to remove it from my credit reports.

I am writing to formally address my ongoing dispute with AllianceOne Receivables Management Inc. regarding an alleged debt of {$3300.00} that they claim I owe. Despite my repeated requests for debt validation, I have yet to receive any documentation to substantiate this claim. 

On XX/XX/year>, I sent a debt validation letter to AllianceOne, clearly outlining my request for proof of the alleged debt. As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, I understand that I am entitled to this documentation, and it is unacceptable that they have not responded with any supporting evidence. 

The lack of communication and failure to provide the requested validation not only raises serious concerns about the legitimacy of this debt but also reflects poorly on the company 's business practices. I believe that they are attempting to collect a debt without the necessary legal backing, which is both unethical and frustrating. 

As of today, I am not inclined to pay this amount until I receive the proper documentation that confirms I owe this debt. I request your assistance in resolving this matter and urge you to hold AllianceOne accountable for their lack of responsiveness and transparency.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Describe what happened : On XX/XX/year>, I took out a personal loan with SoFi Bank, N.A., as outlined in the attached Truth in Lending Act Disclosure and Loan Agreement. As part of the loan, SoFi was responsible for disbursing {$11000.00} to pay off a specified credit card account. However, due to an error, the funds were directed to an incorrect account, identified as a XXXX XXXX credit card instead of the intended XXXX XXXX credit card. 

Timeline of events : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  : I signed the loan agreement with SoFi, which included specific instructions to allocate {$11000.00} to the XXXX XXXX credit card account. Instead, SoFi 's records incorrectly identified this account as a XXXX XXXX credit card. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX : Upon reviewing the documentation and recognizing the error, I contacted SoFis customer service immediately to rectify the issue. I informed them that the funds needed to be directed to the correct XXXX XXXX credit card account instead of the XXXX XXXX account. 

XXXXResponse from SoFi : I was told by SoFi representatives that no corrective action could be taken until two weeks had passed. Despite my immediate efforts to clarify the situation, SoFi failed to address the matter promptly. 

XXXXSubsequent Follow-Up : Over the next several weeks and months, I followed up with SoFi to resolve the issue and confirm the funds were correctly redirected to the XXXX XXXX credit card account. However, no corrective action was taken, and to date, the intended recipient, the XXXX XXXX credit card issuer, has not received the funds. 

Actions I took : XXXXContacted SoFis customer service the following business day to report the error and request immediate action to resolve it. 

XXXXFollowed up with SoFi multiple times in the weeks following to demand clarification and a resolution. 

XXXXVerified with the XXXX XXXX credit card issuer that the payment was not received. 

Impact of SoFis actions : SoFi 's delay and lack of resolution have caused significant financial inconvenience and potential damage to my credit standing. Despite my proactive efforts to address the issue immediately after it was identified, SoFi has not fulfilled their contractual obligation to disburse the funds correctly or within a reasonable timeframe. 

I am seeking CFPB 's assistance in holding SoFi accountable for their failure to resolve this issue promptly and in ensuring that the funds are disbursed to the correct account.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
NCB MANAGEMENT SERVICE XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX NOTICE OF DISPUTE ; DEMAND FOR VALIDATION AND PROOF OF CLAIM To Whom it May Concern Your company is illegally trying to collect and is furnishing false items that violates my consumer rights and FDCPA and FCRA. Be advised that your claim is disputed. Debt validation has to be provided in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC {$1600.00} and as amended by adding the following new Title 8 US {$800.00} et seq., and the Fair Credit Billing Act, 15 USC. {$1600.00} et seq. All of which work in conjunction with each other, including the Truth In Lending Act ( TILA ) 15 USC 1601 et seq. It is not now, nor has it ever been, my intention to avoid paying any alleged obligation that is lawfully owed by the Claimant. In order to make arrangements to pay an obligation which may be lawfully owed, please document and verify the " debt '' by complying, in good faith, with this request for validation and return it to me, within thirty ( 30 ) days of receipt of this letter.

This is was NOT a request for " verification '' or proof of Claimant mailing address or copies of bank statements you could find, but a request for VALIDATION and PROOF OF CLAIM made pursuant to the above named Titles and Sections. I respectfully request that your offices provide Claimant with competent evidence as per the attached " Declaration and Proof of Claim '' that I have any legal obligation to pay you the unsubstantiated alleged debt. Furthermore you shall cease all verbal communication. No phone calls to the Claimant. At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major Credit Bureaus, such as, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX prior to validation and proof of claim of the disputed debt, this action might constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact ; if any negative mark is found on any of Claimant credit reports by your company or the company that you represent I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : - Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act - Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Defamation of Character - Violation of United States Code TITLE 18 PART 1 CHAPTER 63 1341 ( Mail Fraud ) This debt is considered to be invalid and all collection of this alleged account be stopped until I receive proper validation and your offices provide Claimant with proof of claim of the disputed debt. Your offices have 30 days to produce the required documentation in accordance with FTC guidelines. During this validation period and proof of claim, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of Claimant credit reports, said action will be considered a " dishonor '' and cause the self-executing contract portion of this notice to be implemented. This includes any listing any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond to this validation and proof of claim request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from Claimant credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to Claimant immediately. Title 8 USC {$800.00}. Validation of debts [ 15 USC 1692g ] ( b ) If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or any copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : VERIFICATION. Confirmation of correctness, truth, or authenticity, by affidavit, oath, or deposition. RULING 1002 - Requirement of the original An original writing, recording, or photograph is required in order to prove its content unless these rules or a federal statute provides otherwise. Counter Claim with Self-executing Contract If Respondent, such as by commission, omission, and otherwise : ( a ) Fails to provide VALIDATION and PROOF OF CLAIM
