Consumer complaint narrative:
I have filed an FTC identity theft report ( XXXX ) I am writing yet again to dispute the sharing of my personal information in regards to acct # XXXX with XXXX XXXX XXXX, a collection agency, which violates both your stated Privacy Policy and the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ). Based on Capital Ones  policy, XXXX does not qualify as an affiliate, business partner, marketing partner, or service provider, nor does it fit any of the specified contexts under which Capital One is authorized to share customer information. 
Capital One NA sold my personal information including my social security number to XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did not give Capital One NA consent to share my personal information with non-affiliates, which XXXX XXXX XXXX or any of XXXX parent companies or subsidiaries. I have tried to dispute this on my credit report since I have never done business with XXXX and do not understand why they have my personal information. This is when I learned that Capital One has sold my information to XXXX and now XXXX states they have the right to collect on this previously charged off acct. Capital One did not have my consent to provide XXXX any of my information so this is considered fraud! FTC identity theft report ( XXXX ) Capital Ones Privacy Policy explicitly outlines the contexts in which customer information may be shared, including : Affiliates : XXXX is not part of the Capital One family of companies. 
Business or Marketing Partners : XXXX does not provide products, services, or marketing efforts for XXXX XXXX customers. 
Service Providers : There is no indication that XXXX performs any business operations on your behalf. 
Other Third Parties : I did not provide consent or authorization for my information to be shared with XXXX 
Credit Bureaus and Government Entities : XXXX does not fall into these categories. 
The Privacy Act of 1974 is meant to protect personal information from being shared without proper authorization. By sharing my data with XXXXa company I have no relationship withCapital One appears to have violated both its own Privacy Policy and federal law. 
I request a full investigation into this matter and a written explanation detailing : The specific provision in your Privacy Policy or the Privacy Act that authorizes the sharing of my information with XXXX 
Any records of my consent or authorization for this disclosure. 
I expect this account to be deleted from my report Immediately in 4 business days as stated in FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) in regard to identity theft! 
I have attached proof of identity.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX/COMENITY/ULTA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX OH XXXX Subject XXXX Debt Validation Request Dear XXXX/COMENITY/ULTA, I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding the alleged debt referenced in your letter. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I am requesting validation of this debt.

Specifically, I request the following documentation : 1. Proof of Debt : Copies of all records showing the amount of the debt, how it was calculated, and the original contract or agreement signed by me.

2. Assignment of Debt : Copies of all contracts or assignments that demonstrate your legal right to collect this debt, including any chain of assignment from the original creditor to your company.

3. Original Creditor Information : The name, address, and contact information of the original creditor, along with details about the account and any outstanding balance at the time of the assignment or sale.

4. Payment History : A detailed, itemized statement showing any payments made, fees added, and the balance still owed.

5. Statute of Limitations Verification : Documentation confirming the date of last payment and whether the debt is within the statute of limitations.

Until I receive the requested documentation, I dispute the validity of this debt. I also request that all collection efforts, including reporting to credit bureaus, be halted until this matter is resolved.

Please note that future communication regarding this matter should be in writing and sent to the address listed on file. Additionally, I request that you do not contact me by phone.

Thank you for your cooperation. I look forward to receiving the requested information within 30 days of your receipt of this letter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I purchased outdoor equipment from XXXX using my Bank of America AAA XXXX credit card. 

In XXXX Bank of America sold the AAA account to XXXX XXXX. Which today is the new account holder of the AAA XXXX credit card Overtime one of the products began to fail and through my complaints regading the product to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX offered me a refund for the failing product in the amount of {$1900.00}. I confirmed with XXXX that I no longer had an account with the bank used to purchase the equipment in XXXX. They informed me that the bank would provide a refund to the new card. XXXX also provided me proof of the transaction back to Bank of America by providing the XXXX number for the refund transaction. 

Since XX/XX/XXXX I have made repeated attempts to contact Bank of America and XXXX to rectify the situation and have the refund sent directly to me to no avail. My last attempt in communicating with Bank of America was on XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX from XXXX to XXXX. During my communication with Bank of America I was repeatedly informed that they could not speak to me or offer me any additional information because I did not have an active account with the bank. I spoke to new/open accounts department, fraud department , a manager in fraud department, and lastly a customer services/ accounts Servies representative . Not one of the representatives was able to track or utilize the ARN number provided by XXXX 

Furthermore, XXXX requested I get written confirmation from either Bank of America or XXXX XXXX  that the funds were not refunded to me. I made that attempt with Bank of America who would not provide me with any status due to the fact I do not have an account. XXXX referenced me to my most recent credit card statement which confirms no refunds in the amount of {$1900.00} since XXXX, XXXX, XXXX. 

Additionally, on Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX XXXX informed me that nothing could be done on their end to recover the refunded dollars. I have repeatedly requested XXXX XXXX Bank of America, void the transaction, and issue me a check for the refund. However, XXXX has informed me this can not be done. 

To rectify the situation XXXX has offered to provide me with store credit which is something I am currently not planning to initiate because I would prefer to have the funds given to me that were refunded to Bank of America. 

I am uploading a word document which includes my entire email transaction with XXXX that includes, order number, dates, refunds, and ARN number transaction with Bank of America.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Request for Intervention and Issuance of Form 1099-C by LVNV Funding LLC Dear CFPB, I am writing to lodge a formal complaint against LVNV Funding LLC for their ongoing failure to provide a 1099-C for a charged-off debt and for not adhering to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Account Details : Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Charge-Off Amount : {$6300.00} Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Last Activity : XX/XX/XXXX Current Status : Collection/Charge-off Background : Despite my diligent efforts to resolve this matter lawfully, LVNV Funding has consistently failed to provide the necessary documentation or proof of debt as requested. This includes their inability to supply a 1099-C form for the charged-off debt, which is essential for proper financial documentation and tax reporting. The absence of this form not only complicates my financial obligations but also raises concerns about their adherence to legal and ethical debt collection and reporting standards. 

Issues Encountered : Failure to Provide 1099-C : LVNV Funding has not issued a 1099-C for the charged-off debt, complicating my ability to accurately file taxes and manage my financial responsibilities. 

Inaccurate Reporting : The account continues to be reported on my credit files without proper validation and with significant discrepancies in payment history and monthly reporting. 

Lack of Compliance with FDCPA : Repeated requests for debt validation have been ignored or inadequately responded to, in direct violation of the FDCPA. 

Potential Fraudulent Reporting : The persistence of LVNV Funding in not providing necessary documentation upon request suggests a disregard for legal obligations, potentially qualifying as a fraudulent activity under federal law. 

Conclusion : This complaint serves as a formal request for the CFPB 's immediate intervention to ensure that my consumer rights are not continuously infringed upon. Failure to address these concerns satisfactorily will compel me to seek further legal advice and possibly initiate legal action for damages incurred due to these violations, including slander, defamation, mental anguish, and stress. 

I am prepared to take all necessary steps to defend my rights and ensure compliance with federal regulations, and I urge the CFPB to assist in resolving this matter expediently. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint because several accounts listed on my credit report involve unverified or inaccurate information. Despite sending certified mail to request validation of these debts, I have not received a proper response. These actions violate my rights under federal laws, including 15 U.S.C. 1681b, 15 U.S.C. 6802, and 12 U.S.C. 6802, which regulate the proper handling of consumer information and debt collection practices.

Below are the accounts and specific issues : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$2200.00} Issue : On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified debt validation request ( USPS XXXX # XXXX ), which was delivered between XX/XX/XXXX. I have not received a response. The collection agency has failed to prove ownership of the debt or provide supporting documentation, violating my rights under the FDCPA and FCRA. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : Balance : {$1200.00} Issue : I do not recognize this debt nor the collection agency managing it. Despite sending a certified validation request, I have received no response. This lack of response and continued reporting violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b regarding permissible purposes for sharing consumer information. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : Balance : {$260.00} Issue : I do not recognize this account, and it has been inaccurately marked under " fraud. '' I sent a certified debt validation request on XX/XX/XXXX, but the collection agency has not provided any documentation or proof of this debt. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Balance : {$1000.00} Issue : This account has been reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX without proper validation. Despite a certified mail request sent on XX/XX/XXXX, no response or documentation has been provided. This violates 12 U.S.C. 6802, which governs the sharing of consumer financial information without proper consent or verification. 
XXXX XXXX : Balance : {$2300.00} Issue : The original creditor is reporting this debt as charged off. However, I have no knowledge of this account. My certified mail request for validation has not been answered. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$0.00} ( Charged Off ) Issue : This account has been sold to another lender, yet I have received no information about the new creditor. This creates an incomplete and unverifiable record on my credit report, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681b. 
Violations of Federal Laws Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Collection agencies are continuing to report and pursue debts without validating their claims, in violation of my rights under the FDCPA.

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Information has been shared with collection agencies without proper validation or permissible purpose.

Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) 12 U.S.C. 6802 : My financial information has been shared without my knowledge or consent, violating federal privacy protections. 











On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified mail request for validation to the collection agency, tracked via USPS # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. This request was confirmed delivered between XX/XX/XXXX, but I have not received a response. 

Under the FCRA and FDCPA, failure to validate a debt is grounds for removal. I respectfully request that this account be deleted from my credit report.

As of today, XX/XX/year>, more than 30 days have passed, and i have not received any response from Helvey & Associates , INC . This lack of response violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which requires the company to complete its investigation and respond to disputes within 30 days. 


What have i done so far : 1. Sent my dispute on XX/XX/year> via email. 
2. confirmed email was sent on XX/XX/year>. 
3. waited for the 30 day investigation period to elapse.

What i would like to happen : I am requesting that Helvey & Associates, INC either : 1. provide verification of this debt, including all documentation supporting its validity, or 2. Remove the collection account from my credit report immediately if they can not validate it.

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to request validation of the debt that you claim I owe, as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Please provide me with the following information : The amount of the debt you are attempting to collect. The name of the original creditor to whom the debt was owed. A detailed statement or verification of the debt, including a copy of the original agreement or contract that I signed, outlining the terms and conditions. Proof of your authorization to collect on behalf of the original creditor. A breakdown of any additional fees or interest that have been added to the debt since its origination. Please note that under the FDCPA, you are required to provide this validation before continuing any collection activities. If you are unable to provide the requested documentation, I expect this matter to be resolved accordingly, including the removal of any negative entries related to this debt from my credit report. I kindly request that all communication regarding this matter be made in writing. You are prohibited from taking any further collection actions until this validation request is satisfied. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within the 30-day period, as required by law. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Fraudulent inquiries XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the presence of fraudulent accounts and inquiries on my credit report. My personal information has been used without my authorization, and the following items on my credit report are fraudulent : These accounts were not opened by me nor were they authorized. I am a victim of identity theft and am actively working to resolve this matter. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act, I respectfully request the immediate removal of these fraudulent accounts from my credit file.

Under Section 605B of the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to block fraudulent information from appearing on a consumers credit report within four business days of receiving the appropriate documentation. Furthermore, under the Identity Theft and Assumption Deterrence Act, victims of identity theft are protected from being held responsible for accounts opened fraudulently in their report

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received services at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and was on a payment plan to cover my balance. During my initial visit, I informed the XXXX that I am a XXXX XXXX managing expenses on my own. Despite this, the office placed me on a payment plan that has now led to financial distress, which I believe could have been handled more responsibly. 

According to the office 's portal, my total bill was {$2600.00}. My insurance covered {$1700.00}, leaving me responsible for {$900.00}. I made six monthly payments of {$120.00}, plus a {$100.00} down payment, totaling {$820.00}. Despite this, I was told that {$700.00} of my balance has been sent to collections. 

The portal inaccurately shows that I have only paid {$170.00} toward my account, even though I have receipts confirming the payments. This discrepancy has not been adequately explained, and the office has not clarified how my payments were applied. 

When I contacted the XXXX  office to address these concerns, I was informed that accounts are sent to collections after 90 days of non-payment. However, my last payment of {$120.00} was processed on XX/XX/2024, which contradicts this policy. 

The representative I spoke with seemed uncertain and deflected my questions about the payment discrepancy. Instead of addressing my concerns, they focused on defending the decision to send the debt to collections. After I sent an email demanding written confirmation of the debt, I received a call back hours later. 

During the call, the representative suddenly cited a contract that I allegedly signed in XX/XX/2024. This contract was only sent to me after I pressed the issue, raising concerns about whether the terms are accurate or retroactively altered. Additionally, I never received a copy of this contract at the time I signed it, and I could not find it in my email records from XXXX. 

Lastly, I discovered the notice of the collections referral in my spam folder, meaning I was not adequately informed or given a fair opportunity to resolve the balance before it was sent to collections. 

I believe I have been unfairly treated due to billing errors, poor communication, delayed sharing of documentation, and deflective behavior from the representative, which has caused unnecessary financial and emotional stress. 
I believe I should have been provided with a copy of the contract at the time of signing or immediately after the treatment. The fact that it was only shared with me after I pressed the issue raises concerns about transparency and accountability

Sub-issue: Changes in terms mid-deal or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative: The dealership told me the cash price of the car was going to be significantly lower than the cash price for the car was on the contract. I did question the dealership about why everything seemed so high I was told that it was higher because of the extra warranties and because I was financing the sales tax. I was told that in a few months interest rates would be dropping and I could refinance the car. The cash price of the vehicle is significantly higher than what the car books for. No reputable bank would loan money on a car for more than it is worth. I tried to contact the bank and told them my concerns about the loan and contract as soon as I realized what happened. I wanted to see a copy of the credit application the dealership sent them to verify the information they were given. I wanted to make sure the dealership didn't say I was purchasing a car with a more luxury trim or with a bigger engine to justify more money than the car was worth. The bank told me they didn't have my credit application. I asked them how they were able to approve a loan without a credit application. Then I asked to speak with a supervisor and I asked again for a copy of the credit application they received when they agreed to loan money to me. Again I was refused and told that it wasn't in my file yet, but the loan already was. They told me it could take 45 days to have that information ( coincidentally after the first payment is due ) I asked them again how they were able to approve loans without credit applications on file. The supervisor had no answer for this. I believe Fifth Third Bank and the dealership conspired to enter me into a predatory auto loan that I would not be able to refinance with another bank.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a dispute to Equifax regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, including late payments, charge-offs, and unauthorized hard inquiries. Under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), Equifax was required to complete their investigation and respond to my dispute within 30 days, by XX/XX/year>. Equifax failed to respond within this timeframe, only providing a response through this portal on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXXwell beyond the legally mandated deadline.

As stipulated in FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ), if a credit bureau can not verify disputed information within the 30-day timeframe, they are required to delete the information. XXXX retention of these items constitutes a direct violation of the FCRA. 

The accounts and inquiries that Equifax failed to verify within the required timeframe include : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Hard Inquiries by XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax also failed to provide the required method of verification under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 7 ), such as creditor contact information or supporting documentation. Additionally, Equifax ignored my explicit request for responses to be sent via certified mail, further demonstrating procedural negligence. 

XXXX failure to meet the 30-day deadline legally mandates the deletion of all disputed items from my credit report. Their non-compliance has caused me significant harm, including : A XXXXpoint drop in my credit score. 
Increased loan costs of $ XXXX due to higher interest rates. 
Denial of credit opportunities, forcing me into financial hardship. 
I request that the CFPB enforce FCRA compliance by requiring Equifax to : Immediately delete all disputed items from my credit report as required by law. 
Investigate XXXX systemic non-compliance with FCRA. 
Impose penalties for their willful and negligent violations. 
XXXX failure to respond within the legally mandated timeframe invalidates any claims of verification. I seek immediate resolution of this matter to prevent further harm.

Consumer complaint narrative: I received an email from this company on XX/XX/year> stating a payment was coming due. I had never heard of this company before. I looked them up online and used my email to reset the password for the portal. I was able to gain access and then found out someone stole my identity to take out a loan. They had all of my information, but the banking information provided was not my banking information meaning whoever stole my identity used their personal bank account to receive the funds. I contacted this company and told them my identity was stolen and asked why they didn't verify the bank account they sent the funds to, because if they did they would have caught that the account was not owned by me. They said they dont care and the person who stole my identity had my social security number and thats all they care about. I said I wanted my personal information removed from their site and the debt to be settled they said I had to send in my police report which was actually the XXXX report since it is a online crime the police department dmsaid that is whete the teport needed to be filed as well as my bank statements. I complied and sent this information to them.. i have received no response from the company. They seem to be protecting a criminal and not wanting to rectify their poor business dealings of giving a loan to a criminal. I want my information removed from their site and the debt removed from my name!

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative: I am an elder XXXX XXXX  who was XXXX  and financially exploited by an online group of XXXX  scammers from the XXXX. I had an excellent credit score ( over 850 ), a very high credit limit on my TD Bank , N.A . Target credit card and had never been late on my payments. At the time I was scammed, I had a XXXX balance on the card, but In the space of just a few days as I was being scammed, the card was maxed out with over XXXX USD in charges. I was under strong coercion by the scammers who were contacting me constantly. This resulted in a number of charges during XXXX XXXX XXXX, and the large purchase. At no time did the card issuer or their fraud department contact me or freeze my card, or try to warn me about what was going on. XXXX XXXX XXXX and credit card company insiders, both informed me, that card issuers often notice a big change in spending habits as a possible sign of fraud. But TD Bank NA took no action to help me while I was being scammed, abused, and exploited. As typical for most XXXX  scam victims, at that time, I did not realize I was being scammed as it was quite early in the long con process. A warning from TD Bank may have been of great help. Later, I did wake up, but now, I am being sued by the collector and TD Bank N.A.. who have shown no compassion so far, for what has happened to me. In cases of ID Theft or if someone stole your card or number it is one thing, but apparently when you've been scammed or extorted it is another. It is an embarrassing thing to admit or to recognize when you have been scammed and very difficult to catch early on. Please do not do anything for anybody unless you have met them in person or you know for very sure it is a real relationship. If you have met in person and met their family is a good sign, but IF there is a huge age difference and they come from a third world country with poverty, please be on special alert. Don't fall for the crocodile tears or the many sad stories! Be wary of people from any dating, social media apps, or chat apps or websites who befriend you, and start XXXX  you.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I recently obtained a mortgage with PenFed end of XX/XX/year>. In XXXX we thought we had set up auto pay to start with the XXXX payment. In XXXX I received an alert saying I was 30 days late from XXXX XXXX. We called in to find out why payment did not pull and were told we did not set up autopay. At this time my husband requested this be looked into and we made the payments to bring account current. He did not receive a call back so I then called in. I let the person know we have not received any statements. It has been confirmed the address in the loan system was set up wrong. The closing paperwork did have a correct mailing address that we were using. In addition we were told that PenFed did try to call but did NOT leave voicemail messages so we had no idea that there was an issue. The number that they call from does not indicate PenFed so we had no idea they were calling or it would have alerted me to an issue. In addition they indicated they did not have my contact number which I find strange since I can see it on the final application paperwork. Customer Service is now saying on XXXX we made a 1 time payment and then setup auto pay and then deleted autopay at the same time which does not seem correct or was an system error. If we had received any statements I would have known my payment was missed and made it prior to the 30 day late which has now impacted my credit greatly. We had also prior to the XXXX payment had the address updated but it was only updated in the retail side. We were not told until recently that you have to contact each department to update information. Customer service spoke with collections who has indicated that they will not change the reporting. Based on the fact that the company had information to reach me and provide a monthly statement I feel like PenFed contributed to my payment being late. I pulled up my final loan paperwork and show the mailing address was not the physical address and my phone number was on final loan application. PenFed would have received this paperwork from the escrow company prior to my loan funding. I am trying to work with customer service to get this resolved but have now been told 4 times that they will not fix this. I feel this is poor customer service and that they did not meet the requirement to send me my mortgage statement monthly. I also feel them indicating that they tried contacting us by calling but never leaving a message is not satisfactory.

Sub-issue: Changes in loan terms during or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX loan application was processed with EMM Loans LLC XXXX I spoke to XXXX XXXX. He advised rate was XXXX with XXXX points. Did tell me hed lock either the next day in the morning or the day after as he was expecting rates to drop. I asked him 2x if theres a risk of an increase, he said absolutely no. Loan process continued. Original loan disclosure has rate at XXXX with no fees to buy the rate. 

Multiple people from EMM Loans reached out asking for information, at times 3x for the same information.

It was disclosed from day 1 that I would be closing from Florida while my husband would physically be in Texas, where the property is located. 

Loan was scheduled to close on XX/XX/XXXX. On evening of XX/XX/XXXX after becoming increasingly alarmed that I could not get a hold of XXXX, I reached out to VP XXXX XXXX via text. He responded that it was after hours on a Friday and hed look into it on Monday or over weekend. Later sent text that we were closing on XX/XX/XXXX as scheduled. 

On Monday XX/XX/XXXX, received a call from yet another person, XXXX XXXX. He indicated that I would not be able to close remote and would need to give my husband POA to close on my behalf. I refused, he then suggested that my husband give me POA to close in Florida. I indicated Id check with my husband and he was going to confirm that could be done and work on getting POA drafted. Did not hear back. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received the 3 day notice of disclosure. There I learned that I would have to buy down the rate to get 5.5 % and that my loan rate was never locked. The lock document says XX/XX/XXXX. 

I asked for a call. XXXX told me that there wasnt anything he could do with current interest rates to change them and that he did not know what XXXX had done. He indicated hed call me back, he did not. I did not sign the 3 day notice. 

I reached out to XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to cancel the loan. In a subsequent call with the title company, they advised that it would have been perfectly fine for me to close remote via Zoom and my husband would sign physically in Texas. Indicated it was a common practice. 

I have a financial loss as a result of the inappropriate handling on my loan by the team at EMM Loans. I paid a credit check, an appraisal, inspections and {$3900.00} in escrow to the seller. I am also at risk of the seller coming after me for additional monies, per my realtor, as the house has sat off the market for just over 6 weeks.

On XX/XX/XXXX FROM THE XXXX XXXX XXXX a XXXX based company and representatives of said company settled upon a HELOC LOAN with XXXX XXXX XXXX. We assumed the company was acting in good faith but after further investigation of the mortgage we found that the companies involved acted in bad faith. Falsification of submitted documents, signatures, recordings in the courts, double bookkeeping entries, and the transfer of the asset. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, U.S. BANK XXXX XXXX XXXX ( not in its official capacity solely as trustee for XXXX XXXX XXXX, are apart of this fraudulent transfer of the asset. We noticed a discrepancies once were we contacted by XXXX XXXX XXXX that claimed payments were missed ( default ) and that immediate payment was needed or they would accelerate to foreclosure proceedings. XX/XX/XXXX was the referenced date in which a payment was made and accepted by XXXX XXXX XXXX. The payment included the 3 months of payments plus interest. XXXX XXXX  had direct access to the account to retrieve funds do to the account made payable was set up through autopay at XXXX XXXX  located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, Pa XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX claimed the same issue XXXX of XXXX in which payment was made again to XXXX XXXX XXXX and accepted. That is when we started to research the issue with payments and the account. We reached out to XXXX XXXX  to investigate the allegations made by XXXX XXXX XXXX that we were not making payments as scheduled from autopay out of the account held by XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX  informed us of the transaction history and found that XXXX XXXX DID INDEED receive payment electronically from the autopay set up on the account. There was no return funds from XXXX XXXX XXXX back to the account only payments sent. XXXX XXXX XXXX claimed that on the first of every month they would retrieve the payment, and then they would return the payment on the XXXX of every month. XXXX XXXX XXXX when asked claimed that they never received the payments and they returned what the did receive during that transaction. But after investigating the transaction with XXXX XXXX  we concluded that something was not right. XXXX XXXX  launched an investigation into the account which caused a domino affect into the hardships now faced by our family. 26 USC 860D : For purposes of this title, the terms real estate mortgage investment conduit and REMIC mean any entity ( 1 ) to which an election to be treated as a REMIC applies for the taxable year and all prior taxable years, ( 4 ) as of the close of the 3rd month beginning after the startup day and at all times thereafter, substantially all of the assets of which consist of qualified mortgages and permitted investments, ( B ) Inadvertent terminations If ( i ) an entity ceases to be a REMIC, 26 USC 856 : A corporation, trust, or association shall not be considered a real estate investment trust for any taxable year unless ( 1 ) it files with its return for the taxable year an election to be a real estate investment trust or has made such election for a previous taxable year, and such election has not been terminated or revoked under subsection ( g ) ; What must the REMIC do to foreclose on your property?

26 USC 856 ( e ) SPECIAL RULES FOR FORECLOSURE PROPERTY ( 1 ) FORECLOSURE PROPERTY DEFINED For purposes of this part, the term foreclosure property means any real property ( including interests in real property ), and any personal property incident to such real property, acquired by the real estate investment trust as the result of such trust having bid in such property at foreclosure, or having otherwise reduced such property to ownership or possession by agreement or process of law, after there was default ( or default was imminent ) on a lease of such property or on an indebtedness which such property secured. Such term does not include property acquired by the real estate investment trust as a result of indebtedness arising from the sale or other disposition of property of the trust described in section 1221 ( a ) ( 1 ) which was not originally acquired as foreclosure property.

26 USC 856 ( 5 ) TAXPAYER MUST MAKE ELECTION Property shall be treated as foreclosure property for purposes of this part only if the real estate investment trust so elects ( in the manner provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary ) on or before the due date ( including any extensions of time ) for filing its return of tax under this chapter for the taxable year in which such trust acquires such property. A real estate investment trust may revoke any such election for a taxable year by filing the revocation ( in the manner provided by the Secretary ) on or before the due date ( including any extension of time ) for filing its return of tax under this chapter for the taxable year. If a trust revokes an election for any property, no election may be made by the trust under this paragraph with respect to the property for any subsequent taxable year.

The servicer or attorney is liable for the tax, or whoever did not transfer it in time. Keep in mind that if the REMIC takes the defaulted note and transfers it after the 3 month deadline the whole REMIC loses it's tax status.

How does a REMIC acquire property?

Formation and Initial Transfer of Assets : When a REMIC is initially formed, it acquires a pool of mortgages or mortgage-backed assets from a transferor, typically using a trust agreement. This transfer is often part of the REMICs creation, where the transferor places qualifying mortgages or mortgage-related assets into the REMIC structure .

Form 1066, U.S. Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit ( REMIC ) Income Tax Return, is then used by the REMIC to report its income and tax elections but is not required to formally acquire the property.

Foreclosure and Election for Foreclosure Property : When the REMIC acquires property through foreclosure or similar means ( if a borrower defaults on a mortgage within the REMIC ), it can make an election to treat the property as foreclosure property. This is done on Form 1066 by attaching a statement to the form for the tax year in which the REMIC acquires the property.

This election classifies the foreclosed property as foreclosure property, which is important for favorable tax treatment, as it avoids having the income from the property treated as prohibited income for REMIC purposes.

Reporting Requirements : While Form 1066 is the primary reporting form, theres no form specifically required to acquire property into the REMIC. Instead, the acquisition is documented through legal agreements and records with the trust administrator, often filed in county records for foreclosures.

Schedule Q ( Form 1066 ) is also used by the REMIC to report information to residual interest holders, including details about the income and property held by the REMIC.

Form 1066 Statement : This statement is an attachment to Form 1066, U.S. Real Estate Mortgage Investment Conduit ( REMIC ) Income Tax Return.

It includes details about the property that the REMIC acquired through foreclosure and an explicit election under IRC 856 ( e ) to treat the property as foreclosure property.

Purpose : This election allows the REMIC to classify the property as foreclosure property for tax purposes, meaning it can avoid taxes on income that would otherwise be considered non-qualifying income.

Form 1099-A : Form 1099-A is issued by a lender when there is an acquisition or abandonment of secured property, typically by a financial institution to report the acquisition or abandonment of property to both the IRS and the borrower .

Purpose : For the REMIC, Form 1099-A is relevant only if the REMIC must report the acquisition or abandonment of a secured property ( typically when the borrower defaults and the REMIC acquires the property ). The REMIC might use Form 1099-A to document the foreclosure for reporting purposes.

Key Detail : Form 1099-A is sent to the IRS and the borrower, while the election statement attached to Form 1066 is only for the IRS to claim the foreclosure property status.

Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Attempted to collect wrong amount
Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an entry on my credit report that appears to be both inaccurate and illegitimate. The entry in question pertains to LVNV Funding LLC, listed as a creditor on my XXXX credit report. 



Upon conducting thorough research via the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), I confirmed that LVNV Funding LLC is not licensed to collect debts in the state of Virginia, where I reside. This is a direct violation of Virginia Code 6.2-1602, which prohibits any company from engaging in debt collection activities within the state without proper licensing. Collecting debts without a valid license is considered unlawful and invalidates the companys ability to enforce collection in Virginia courts.

Furthermore, the presence of this entry violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, which requires that all information included in credit reports be accurate, complete, and verifiable. Since LVNV Funding LLC lacks the legal credentials to operate in Virginia, this entry can not be considered valid or verifiable. 



In light of this information, I am requesting that XXXX investigate this matter immediately and remove the inaccurate entry from my credit report. The presence of this entry is causing undue harm to my credit profile and financial well-being.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against National Debt Relief regarding their handling of a recent transaction and their refusal to honor my request for a refund. I believe their actions violate my consumer rights. Below, I outline the details of the situation : XXXX. Date of Contact and Request : On XX/XX/year>, I contacted National Debt Relief to request the cancellation of a scheduled payment of {$XXXX} set to be deducted from my account on XX/XX/year>. I was informed that it was too late to stop the transaction, which I understood. 
XXXX. Subsequent Request for Refund : I explicitly instructed National Debt Relief that once the XX/XX/XXXX payment cleared, they were not to use the funds for any settlements and that the money should be refunded to me. Despite my clear request, they disregarded my instructions and informed me the money would be used for a settlement without my consent. 
XXXX. XXXX of Events : The {$XXXX} payment was taken from my bank account on XX/XX/year>. 
National Debt Relief informed me the funds would clear on XX/XX/year>. 
I repeatedly reiterated my request for a refund, but they refused to comply, stating the funds had already been applied to a settlement.

4. Violation of My Rights : I believe National Debt Reliefs refusal to refund my money violates my rights as a consumer. I have the right to control how my money is used, especially after making a clear request. Their unwillingness to respect my instructions has caused unnecessary stress and financial difficulty.

5. Nature of the Company : National Debt Relief is a debt consolidation company that works on behalf of clients to settle debts. However, in this instance, they have failed to act in my best interest or honor my explicit requests.

Resolution Sought : I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure that National Debt Relief issues a full refund of the funds in question. Additionally, I ask that steps be taken to ensure this company adheres to proper consumer protection practices in the future.

Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter. I am happy to provide any further details or documentation needed for your investigation.

I previously requested debt validation from the collection agency handling this account, but they failed to provide the required validation. According to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 809 ( a ), a collection agency must provide verification of the debt upon request. Consumer complaint narrative:
The loan was paid in full on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a confirmation email that the loan was paid in full. 
My account online showed the account as paid in full. 

XXXX week later BestEgg attempted to withdraw money from my account. I contacted them and was told it was an error and would stop after that attempt. 

This fund withdrawl request was repeated XXXX additional times after that. Upon checking my closed account on XX/XX/XXXX, it displayed an outstanding payment of {$XXXX} with a payoff amount of {$XXXX}. This was highly suspicious and prompted my call to BestEgg. 

They were not very helpful, initially the agent would not admit that payments were being taken. After carefully trying to explain the situation he FINALLY looked into my account and told me that it was closed and he couldn't explain why money was continuing to be taken out. 

The side effect of this action has been the inability to use my own checking account for the means it was intended for! 
I can not keep money in that account for fear BestEgg will attempt to steal it! 
I can not pay my other liabilities through autopay, and benefit from the savings doing so, and often other liabilities are paid late as a direct result of not using autopay. 

This action by BestEgg has indirectly caused me additional financial burdens, has highly inconvenienced my day to day activities and has reduced the amount of expendable income available to sustain my family. 

I was previously enrolled in a debt settlement program with XXXX XXXX, which, as an indirect result of XXXX  's actions, has been terminated due to autopayments not being available and there being no method of making a manual payment to XXXX XXXX. This has had, and XXXX continue to have, dire consequences against my current and future credit scores. 

I would like to request an investigation into XXXX  's lending practices and an audit on any accounts active or closed, to ensure fair lending practices are being adhered to. 

I fear that other customers that aren't as knowledgeable or attentive XXXX have paid far more than they should have and/or XXXX have had XXXX XXXX reductions as a result of these deceptive lending practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Morgage company refuses to review loan mod package or send to the investor they deny the package constantly and offer unaffordable excessive suprime repayment plans!!! 

Here is their latest communication : Your loan is not impounded/escrowed for SN Servicing to pay the Property Taxes or Homeowners Insurance as thats your responsibility. Unfortunately the property taxes were delinquent/unpaid to the point where the investors decided in order to protect their interest in the property and avoid the possibility of a tax foreclosure and there be legal fees & costs that would have to be paid as well as the delinquent taxes the investors made the decision to advance and pay the delinquent XXXX and XXXX County Taxes to XXXX XXXX County in the amount of {$34000.00}, which was paid in XX/XX/year>. The tax advance needs to be repaid. 



The XX/XX/year> through XX/XX/year> mortgage payments are currently due. Your monthly Principal & Interest payment is {$5700.00} so just in payments youre looking at {$57000.00} through XX/XX/year>. If you combine the {$34000.00} XXXX XXXX it bring just for payments and tax advance to {$92000.00}, but thats not even full reinstatement, since theres legal fees & costs, NSF charges and late charges. The investors had previously offered a 6 Month Repayment Plan, but it was declined. The investors are not offering anything else other than a 6 Month Repayment Plan. If youre interested Ill order a reinstatement quote, which will be e-mailed to you so youll have the default amount needing to be cured. 

Here is my response- XXXX we are asking that you send this to the investor and asking that you send a denial letter for the requested loan modification which you keep stating it was denied but have never given a reason why? What is the reason for the denial when it can not be income. The income was sufficient. We feel you have NO VALID reasons once again. We have tried every possible way to work with SN servicing and have exhausted all resources besides superior court complaints and imminent bankruptcy XXXX. 



I received your inconsiderate email stating that the investors paid delinquent property taxes on my behalf and are demanding repayment on top of arrears. I understand the importance of paying property taxes but we were in a California relief program that they denied us due to lack of funds. All the while saying that we were approved. They also made contact with SN and sent a form and you failed to communicate! You could have moved the paid taxes to the back of the loan. You cant harm the homeowner who is already delinquent with a demand to pay XXXX. I was not informed about the tax payments until after you made payment and was not given a chance to pay them myself!!! Why? Seems like you enjoy working against homeowners at SN servicing. This is why your company has so many lawsuits against you. 



According to your email, the total amount owed is {$92000.00}, which includes the tax advance and accrued interest. I understand that this amount is due, but I CAN NOT afford to over the short six month payment timeline!! 

It is unacceptable, unreasonable, excessive and extreme. 



To propose a repayment plan, I offer the following : - For the next 6 months, I will pay {$7700.00} per month, which will cover the arrears and a portion of the accrued interest. - After 6 months, I will resume making my regular monthly payments of {$5700.00}. To calculate the total number of months needed to pay off the arrears, I have divided the total amount owed by my monthly payment : {$92000.00} ( total amount ) {$7700.00} ( monthly payment for 6 months ) = 12 months ( approximately ) However, since I will be paying {$7700.00} for only 6 months, the total number of months needed to pay off the arrears will be longer!!! You as the servicer are nit offering true loss mitigation if you are listening to what a homeowner can afford. 



To estimate this, I have calculated : {$92000.00} ( total amount ) - {$46000.00} ( total payments for 6 months ) = {$46000.00} ( remaining balance ) {$46000.00} ( remaining balance ) {$5700.00} ( regular monthly payment ) = 8 months ( approximately )! 



Therefore, it will take me approximately 14 months ( 6 months at {$7700.00} + 8 months at {$5700.00} ) to pay off the arrears. 



Please confirm if this repayment plan is acceptable to the investors. If not, I request that you provide a detailed breakdown of the reinstatement quote, including all fees and charges, so I can understand the total amount and negotiate a feasible repayment plan through immediate XXXX  XXXX workout. 



I look forward to the response of the investor and not your made up responses and unofficial notes. 



Reply all to ALL government agencies and counsel. I agree to all recipients on this thread to receive the communication. Each email address is authorized by XXXX XXXX. M My advisory group wrote this- XXXX XXXX , We intend to come up with a solution for XXXX XXXX to resume her mortgage payments and save her home, and we need your cooperation. We are here to make arrangements for this to work out for the homeowner using every means possible. She knew her responsibility and obligations when she acquired this mortgage loan but did not expect her financials to be affected when the COVID-19 financials caught her off guard, and she was just recently approved for a loan modification 2 years ago. Having said that, it's unnecessary to remind her of obligations on the mortgage, nor are you in a position to suggest a motion in a Bankruptcy court since you are not an attorney. Please refrain from suggesting that since you are unaware of her financial distress. When she began falling behind on the mortgage payments, she also began falling behind on the property taxes. Still, she took the initiative to apply to the state program that assists homeowners affected by COVID-19 financial distress to have their property taxes resolved. Unfortunately, we found out later that she was qualified, but the state and the government ran out of funds. Naturally, as stated on the loan documents she received when she acquired this loan, the investor paid the property taxes since they are also the loan owners, as you understand. XXXX XXXX has agreed to a reasonable payment plan but with you adding the taxes to the plan it makes it unaffordable. You suggested a payment of over XXXX, which falls in a subprime lending category. This does not sound as if you are seeking to help the homeowner. XXXX mentioned several times the offer for a repayment plan and why she qualifies for it. We are greatly thankfull for the opportunity but its a monthly payment that the homeowner wont be able to keep up. 

We are requesting that the investor give her the chance to revise her income and expenses for a loan modification or a repayment plan where she can affordably catch up over 5 years or more. If that's not an option for her, according to what you have mentioned in the past, we need an actual denial with reasons why on a letter so XXXX XXXX can reach out to other options. 









XXXX XXXX Senior Case Specialist XXXX XXXX XXXX

My deceased son has an outstanding loan with Amerihome mortgage company. On XX/XX/XXXX I sent the death certificate of borrower. XX/XX/XXXX faxed court assigned administrative papers from probate. XX/XX/XXXX faxed administrative papers again because they did not have. XXXXspoke to research person who would call me and we could proceed with payoff amount. No call. I called XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX said they had papers but they needed ID. TOLD TO FAX MY drivers license. After received it could take up to 5 days to process. Contract for sale of house was on XXXX XXXXthus not enough time. 

This timeline leaves out the hours I spent daily going up the chain of authority to get answers..on XX/XX/XXXX, I spent 6 hours, talking, questioning, trying to get the process moving faster to meet deadline of XXXX. Could not get payoff! Then they needed my drivers license. After I faxed it it would take another few days to process before getting payoff. they said they had to have drivers license for federal reasons. Administrative paper was state. When I asked to talk to someone over an XXXX persons head, he sent me to XXXX. I did not hear his name at first and asked his name. He repeated XXXX, how may I help you. Then, he could not hear me, but I could hear him. I hung up. There was no call back. Nice prank! 

It was an exhausting experience. Each call, I might talk with anywhere from 4-8 people. Each time they did not have info, send me again, oh yes I have it but now you need this, and me just asking for payoff so we could continue on timed signing on sale of house. For some reason, they did not want to get their money. 

Twice I asked for someone above the executive mediator and the XXXX person. Told we would get a call back and never received one. NO ONE CARES IN THIS COMPANY! The person handling the closing tried also the first time. That is why I got involved. She said usually when you ask for payoff, they give it. Done within 30 minutes and one phone call. THEY WANT THEIR MONEY! 

I could never put down on paper how terrible this experience has been!

Consumer complaint narrative:
While traveling on a trip to see my kids at their colleges in XXXX of XXXX, the pet sitter we used from XXXX XXXX XXXX stole my new unused Athleta card from my mail. I NEVER used this card and the card was stolen from my home in its original envelope from XXXX. Because that was all that was stolen I did not know it was gone from my files. The thief contacted XXXX to change my contact information, therefore notification of the fraudulent use of my card was not known to me until XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately called XXXX XXXX XXXX to report the theft. I spoke to XXXX XXXX in XXXX Collections who transferred me to XXXX in XXXX XXXX XXXX. he stated my card had been used to charge {$3400.00}. I asked XXXX to close my XXXX XXXX account and to block any further use of it to avoid any further problems with XXXX. XXXX went through each of the charges and asked me to say whether or not each charge was mine and I stated I did not make any of the charges as I had never used the card. I asked to be mailed a statement as I had never seen nor expected a statement as I never had used the card. He stated that the investigation team would investigate and get back to me by XX/XX/XXXX until the investigation is closed that it would be resolved. On XX/XX/XXXX I received notice that the case was resolved. I thought at that time that the issue was done. XXXX had stated that Barclays would contact the credit rating companies to correct the report. 
This case resulted in my excellent credit rating downgrade due to negative hit from past due bill since the credit card company did not suspend the charge while investigation was ongoing. I had filed an identity theft report with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) to report the incident and protect myself from identity theft should something arise in the future. The reference number is : XXXX. 
I contacted Barclays on XX/XX/XXXX and spoke to an agent named XXXX after I was contacted by XXXX XXXX a collection agency, stating that my account was sold to them for collections. XXXX at Barclays stated that there were a few charges they needed me to confirm that I hadnt charged and were fraudulent which I did. I asked XXXX to send me written motivation of the status of the investigation and for a reason the account was sold to XXXX XXXX before the investigation was complete. I have not received anything from XXXX telling me about their investigation. There is no way there is any substantiation that these charges are mine. Prior to this issue I have had an excellent credit rating. On XX/XX/XXXX I contacted Barclays again to find out the outcome of the additional investigation charges and spoke to agent XXXX  who initially had no information, but said I should contact another number which I saw was XXXX XXXX  I asked to speak with a supervisor and was told there were none available. I asked him to have a supervisor contact me and he said he would put in a follow up but would not explain how I would be contacted. Because I have received no info other than my case was concluded and written off by XXXX, I am concluding that my case was never investigated before being sent to collection. Because if it was investigated they would find that the charges were not made by me. Id like to note that my research shows that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau took action against XXXX XXXX XXXX and ordered them to pay {$24.00} million dollars for violations of the law in collecting on unsubstantiated debt. I am appalled that there was no follow up or investigation done. 
Barclays has not worked with me in good faith now nor has been helpful at all during the process since I reported the card stolen in XXXX of XXXX. None of these charges are mine and I am concerned that my credit will not be corrected.

Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Previous Case # XXXX On XX/XX/year>, I contacted Discover to report the death of my father and requested the closure of his account. In order to speak with a representative, I used my account information to get in touch, but I explicitly informed them that I was requesting the closure of my fathers account, not mine. I provided my fathers personal information, including his name, but did not give his account number, as I did not have it readily available. 

Despite clearly explaining the situation, an error occurred when Discovers automated system mistakenly associated my account with the call. As a result, my account was closed rather than my fathers. According to Discovers response, the lack of an associated account number caused confusion, yet they fail to mention that it was their responsibility to ensure the accuracy of the information used to process this request. I clearly communicated the situation, and their system should have verified the details to prevent such a mistake. 

Although I resolved the issue initially and continued to make regular payments, I later discovered that my account was closed again without any notification, and I was sent to collections. I continued making payments as normal, unaware of the account closure or the collections action. 

In their response, Discover acknowledged the mistake, explaining that the lack of an associated account number caused the confusion. They also stated that the charge-off status was removed and the payment history updated. However, despite this, my account remains marked as " closed by credit grantor, '' which negatively impacts my credit. Furthermore, Discover did not reopen my account as requested, and I was not compensated for the inconvenience or financial impact caused by their repeated errors.

Since then, I have made over a dozen requests, both via email and certified mail, for documentation proving the validity of the debt. Despite my efforts, they have been unable to provide any legal documents demonstrating my agreement to the debts in question or any original contracts bearing my signature. 

I have attempted to settle for a lesser amount, as I believe this debt is not mine, but my offers have been met with refusal. Additionally, I proposed arbitration in hopes of resolving this matter amicably, yet I have not received any satisfactory response. 

It is deeply concerning that I have not received any proof or verification of this debt despite my repeated attempts to clarify the situation. I have maintained records of all correspondence, including letters and tracking numbers, as well as emails with timestamps. 

I would appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and any guidance you can provide on how to proceed. 

Thank you for your assistance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding False Advertising and Appeal of American Express Dispute Resolution Ref. XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau , I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX  and American Express concerning false advertising and an unjust resolution of my dispute regarding Reservation ID : XXXX. I respectfully request your intervention to address this matter and ensure fair treatment for consumers like myself. 
False Advertising by Booking.com On XX/XX/year> I booked a property through XXXX  ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The property was falsely advertised as a NON SMOKING ROOM. However, upon arrival, it was clear that these claims were entirely untrue. 
The unit was heavily impregnated with the odor of tobacco smoke, contradicting its advertised description. This issue rendered the property uninhabitable and significantly deviated from the promised conditions. I was misled into booking the unit based on these misrepresentations, which constitutes deceptive advertising. 
American Express 's Failure to Protect Consumers When I sought to dispute the charges with American Express, providing clear evidence of the false advertising and my efforts to resolve the matter directly with XXXX American Express refused my dispute. By doing so, they have effectively allowed their vendor to lure customers under false pretenses and escape accountability for deceptive practices. 
This situation highlights a failure to protect consumers from unfair business practices. As a credit card issuer, American Express has a responsibility to ensure that their vendors adhere to ethical and honest standards of conduct. Their refusal to support my legitimate claim undermines this responsibility and leaves consumers vulnerable to exploitation. 
Request for Intervention I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and intervene to : 1. Review XXXX  Practices : Ensure that properties listed on their platform meet their advertised descriptions and hold XXXX accountable for enabling false advertising. 
2. Address American Expresss Handling of Disputes : Require American Express to review their dispute resolution process and reverse their decision in this case, as it fails to protect consumers from deceptive business practices. 
3. Strengthen Consumer Protections : Advocate for stricter oversight of credit card issuers and platforms like XXXX to prevent future cases of false advertising and insufficient consumer recourse. 
Conclusion This situation is not only about my individual experience but also about holding companies accountable for ethical business practices and ensuring fair treatment for consumers. I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will take appropriate action to address this matter and protect others from facing similar injustices. 
Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your guidance and resolution. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX American Express dispute Ref. XXXX

Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a continuation of Complaint XXXX, where among other things I requested that the servicer permit a partial reinstatement of the loan. I have been told that because my loan is in foreclosure, I am ineligible for a partial reinstatement. Despite this, the current servicer invited me to apply for either a partial or full reinstatement in XXXX of 2024. I ask that the servicer be required to honor its obligation, or correct the error of placing my loan in foreclosure. 

It should be pointed out that some of the issues may be because the servicing of my loan was transferred. It is not clear if the new servicer has access to, or has reviewed all of the file, or the completed loss mitigation application. 

That said, the current servicer continues to ignore that the loan should never have been referred to foreclosure. This is because before it was referred and placed in foreclosure I already submitted a complete loss mitigation application. The completed loss mitigation application was submitted on XX/XX/year> and the loan was referred to foreclosure XXXX  days later on XX/XX/year> ( per the servicer 's records as noted in your prior response ). I have previously submitted copies of the completed loss mitigation application to the servicer. 

Sending my loan for foreclosure referral represents dual tracking under Regulation Z, and is not permitted which the CFPB summarizes as follows : " Servicers can not start a foreclosure proceeding if a borrower has already submitted a complete application for a loan modification or other alternative to foreclosure, and that application is still pending review. '' And this is exactly what happened here. 

In XXXX of 2024 I spoke with the servicer, and we went through a partial reinstatement analysis. I was initially told that the loan was eligible and that the partial reinstatement figure was {$37000.00}. As the call proceeded, however, she told me that the loan had just been referred to foreclosure and therefore it was no longer eligible. I was told that the ONLY reason my loan was ineligible for a partial reinstatement was because the loan had been referred to foreclosure. Because this is a mistake that the servicer should correct, once corrected the loan will be eligible for a partial reinstatement. 

Accordingly, I am not requesting a custom loss mitigation option, rather a partial reinstatement. A partial reinstatement is available from the investor regardless of default status as long as the loan is not in foreclosure. As noted above, the loan should not have been in foreclosure because a complete loss mitigation application had already been submitted. 

Finally, the servicer sent me a letter in XXXX of 2024 stating that I could apply for either a partial or full reinstatement. I told the servicer I again wanted a partial reinstatement. Despite being told I could request a partial reinstatement, I was only offered a full reinstatement. The servicer should be required to honor its offer.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX, I contacted Newrez to initiate a buyout assumption for the mortgage on a property I co-own with my friend. The goal was to transfer the loan into my name, removing my friend from liability. Throughout multiple calls and emails, I clearly explained our situation and was guided through the steps to complete the assumption. At no point was I informed that relationship status ( as non-relatives ) would make us ineligible. Based on Newrezs assurances, my wife and I made significant life decisions, including hiring movers costing {$1700.00} and relocating to the property, assuming we would keep the favorable interest rate of 3.2 %. However, a few days ago, over the phone, the loan officer handling our case asked if my friend and I were related. When I said no, he stated the assumption could not proceed because we are not relatives and expressed surprise that we had made it this far in the process, as our relationship status should have been addressed months ago. I was told the only way to remove my friend from the mortgage was to refinance, which would mean losing the current interest rate. This contradicts months of guidance from Newrez, who knew from the beginning that my friend and I were not related. Nowhere in their documents, communications, or website is it stated that assumptions are restricted to relatives. Their failure to disclose this policy upfront caused unnecessary stress and financial harm. Had we been informed earlier, we would not have moved or gone through this process. Additionally, I could find no legal requirement limiting buyout assumptions to relatives, suggesting this is an internal policy that should have been disclosed at the outset. This process has been unnecessarily stressful, and I believe Newrez should be held accountable for their negligence and misrepresentation.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Collection Account Request for Removal Due to Lack of Debt Validation To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the accuracy of a collection account listed on my credit report under the account # 11068. I previously requested debt validation from the collection agency handling this account, but they failed to provide the required validation. According to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 809 ( a ), a collection agency must provide verification of the debt upon request. Since the collection agency has not provided this validation, the collection account should not be reported on my credit file. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ), I am requesting that you reinvestigate this matter. The continued reporting of this collection account without proper validation is inaccurate and violates the FDCPA. Please remove this collection account from my credit report and provide written confirmation of this action. If the collection agency can not validate the debt, the account must be deleted from my credit file as required by law. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the 4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors- [ ] I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
- [ ]

Following this, I called Jefferson Capital to request additional documentation to substantiate the debt. However, I did not receive any further information or documents.

Sub-issue: Charged too much interest
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I purchased a ring from XXXX and was heavily pitched on a credit card so I could purchase the more expensive item worth around {$5000.00}. When the terms were explained, I was told I would not pay any interest for XXXX  months and then after those months I would be charged interest only on the existing balance similar to 0 % XXXX offers. I set up automatic payments so the balance would be paid off within the XXXX  months and forgot about the card. I was never late on any payments and I was paying what I thought was the appropriate amount to pay the full balance by the XXXX month. XXXX months later I receive a notification from my credit report that I was charged over {$1400.00} on the card. I go to check the card and see that I was charged " accrued '' interest because I had a small remaining balance at the end of the term. It turns out I miscalculated the dollar amount I should pay per payment and because of that I broke the terms of the promotion. Those terms were never properly explained to me by the salesperson. The only reason I paid this off in smaller amounts is because I thought I would not be charged interest. I would have paid the balance months ago or avoided the card altogether if I knew this could happen. I believe this is a misleading and predatory sales practice which tricked me into getting the card without knowing the full consequences. It is not fair I am paying more than ~ {$1400.00} for a mistaken ~ {$100.00} balance.

I received correspondence from this organization in an attempt to collect a debt. This company has themselves listed as the creditor with no account information listed. Please be advised this is not a refusal to pay a debt, but a notice pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) that your claim is disputed and validation is required.

No dunning notice was provided and I have no knowledge of this account or any knowledge of any contract with this institution. I request that you please verify the following information to assist identifying whether this debt is valid:1. Full original account number2. Date original account opened3. Any and all written agreement ( s ) between myself and the diversified consultants stating I agreed to pay alleged debt3. Consumer address at which original account was opened4. Date of first delinquency5. Itemized calculation of alleged debt 6. Original signed contract between myself and this creditor, not a copy.

7. A copy of all payments made with beginning and ending balances 8. original creditor.

9. If the company is unable to provide all of the above identifying account information I will have no recourse but to presume the debt invalid and/or fraudulent and request account DELETION from ANY and all credit reporting agencies without further discussion of payment in full or partial settlement.

10.Proof of service showing attempts to serve said debtor.

This is my attempt to verify the validity of this alleged debt and I appreciate your transparency and cooperation.

Please conduct all communication through written correspondence to the following email address ( s ) only : Name : XXXX XXXX Email Address ( XXXX ) : XXXX Absolutely no phone calls from the company in any manner other than permitted I will cease all communication ( invoking my legal right to request to cease communication ) with the presumption that the debt is invalid and that I own XXXX responsibility ( in part or whole ) for the repayment of said debt.

The company replaced XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  After picking the vehicle up I noticed something wrong immediately. When I turn the wheel it no longer returns to center. Took the truck back multiple times and kept being told nothing was wrong ( even though the truck drove better with all the old parts ). That said I took it to another shop on XXXX to have the same parts replaced. XXXX drives fine. I paid both repair shops with my Discover card. After submitting a dispute with Discover and providing all paperwork provide by both shops they denied my dispute because the initial shop provided paperwork saying my truck had a bent axle ( to date I have still never received a copy of this information from Discover ), which was never communicated to me verbally or in writing. If that was indeed the reason my truck wasnt driving right how was the second shop able to fix the issue by replacing the same exact parts ( upper and lower ball joints and drag link ) and never mentioned anything about a bent axle. I can provide copies of all paperwork from both companies. Like I stated above the initial repair shop did not inform me of anything wrong with an axle in multiple visits to the shop to rectify the issue.
