Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Email : XXXX XX/XX/year> Transworld Systems Inc. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX Subject : Notice of Dispute and Request for Debt Validation** Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as a formal Notice of Dispute regarding the alleged debt associated with the above-referenced account number. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting that you provide full validation of this debt.

Please be advised that I am not acknowledging or admitting responsibility for this alleged debt. As the purchaser of this alleged debt, Transworld Systems Inc. is subject to the terms of the original agreement with XXXX, including any arbitration clauses. If this matter can not be resolved amicably, I will initiate arbitration and seek all available remedies. 

To validate this debt, please provide the following : Proof of the original agreement : A copy of the signed contract or agreement between me and XXXX that shows I am obligated to pay this debt. 
Itemized account statement : A complete breakdown of the debt amount, including principal, interest, fees, and any other charges. 
Proof of assignment or ownership : Documentation showing that Transworld Systems Inc. has legal standing to collect this debt, including the chain of custody if the debt was sold or transferred. 
Verification of compliance : Documentation showing that this debt complies with all state and federal statutes, including statutes of limitations. 
Additionally, I request that you immediately cease any collection activities, including reporting this account to any consumer reporting agencies, until the debt has been fully validated in accordance with federal law. If you have already reported this alleged debt, please update any credit reporting agencies to reflect that the debt is under dispute. 

You have 15 days from the date of this letter to respond and confirm your compliance with my request. Failure to do so will leave me no choice but to proceed with arbitration, where I will seek all available remedies for violations of my rights under applicable laws. 

If you can not provide the requested documentation, you must cease collection efforts and remove any negative information you may have reported to the credit reporting agencies regarding this account. 

This letter is not an admission of liability and does not authorize any additional collection activity. All communication regarding this matter should be made in writing to the address listed above or via email at XXXX. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have repeatedly contacted Portfolio Recovery Associates to address significant issues with their reporting practices to the major credit reporting agencies. Portfolio Recovery Associates, as a debt buyer, has purchased very old debts that are far beyond the statute of limitations for collection. Despite this, they have deliberately misrepresented the dates these accounts were opened, falsely reporting them as recent. 

This calculated and deceptive tactic severely impacts my credit score. As bad debts age, they naturally lose their negative influence on credit scores, allowing individuals to recover financially. Portfolio Recovery Associates is fully aware of this and appears to manipulate reporting dates to unfairly damage my credit. This unethical strategy not only pressures consumers into paying debts they are no longer legally obligated to pay but also punishes them further by tarnishing their credit profiles. 

Adding to the injustice, these debts stem from the challenging XXXX years, a time when countless people faced unprecedented financial hardships. Instead of showing understanding or adhering to ethical collection practices, Portfolio Recovery Associates seems solely focused on exploiting this vulnerable period to unfairly extract money from consumers. 

This behavior is not only morally reprehensible but may also violate consumer protection laws. I demand that Portfolio Recovery Associates correct these inaccuracies immediately and cease engaging in practices that harm individuals who are already striving to rebuild their financial stability.

Equifax failed to respond within the 30-day timeframe mandated by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as the deadline of XX/XX/2024, was missed. I sent a follow-up letter on XX/XX/2024, and a final demand on XX/XX/2024, but Equifax did not provide any response until XX/XX/2024, via the CFPB portal XXXX This response was untimely and failed to meet FCRA requirements. 

Equifax retained unverifiable accounts and failed to provide direct verification or documentation as required by law. They also did not conduct a manual reinvestigation as explicitly requested and relied on automated systems like XXXX. Additionally, Equifax ignored my demand for certified mail communication and responded only through the CFPB portal. 

I am requesting immediate deletion of all unverifiable accounts and inquiries, written confirmation of these deletions, and assurance that these items will not reappear.

Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/2024 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX Dear XXXX XXXX, I am writing in response to your letter dated XX/XX/2024, regarding my dispute of the alleged debt of {$660.00}, which you are attempting to collect. This letter follows my previous correspondence dated XX/XX/2024, where I disputed the debt and requested verification in accordance with my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Specifically, I requested a copy of the signed contract associated with this debt, as well as a cease-and-desist from all collection activities, including reporting this matter to credit reporting agencies. 

Your response does not satisfy my request, and I believe you are in violation of the FDCPA. Let me address the issues in detail : Failure to Provide Verification You have failed to provide the proper verification of the alleged debt. In my initial request, I asked for a signed contract or agreement to substantiate the debt. Instead, you mailed me copies of monthly statements, which are not legally sufficient as they do not represent an agreement or contract between the parties involved. Under the FDCPA, it is an unfair and unconscionable practice to attempt to collect a debt that is not supported by a valid, signed agreement. 

Failure to Cease Collection Activity In addition, you have failed to comply with my request to cease and desist all collection activity, including the reporting of the alleged debt to consumer credit agencies. Reporting an allegedly disputed debt without proper verification and in violation of my rights is a deceptive and misleading practice under the FDCPA. Your continued reporting of this debt to credit bureaus, despite my dispute, constitutes a violation of the law. 

Furthermore, I am concerned that my personal information has been shared without my consent. This constitutes an additional violation of my rights under the FDCPA and applicable privacy laws. 

To summarize, I am requesting the following : Immediate cessation of all collection activity, including any further reporting of the alleged debt to any consumer credit reporting agency. 
Proper verification of the alleged debt, specifically a copy of the signed contract, as initially requested. 
Deletion of any and all credit reports related to this alleged debt. 
Failure to resolve these matters promptly will leave me no choice but to take further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney Generals office. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I expect your prompt and thorough response to my request. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year>, USAA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Follow-Up Dispute of Collection Account Request for Method of Verification to Whom It May Concern, I am following up on my previous dispute regarding the collection account listed on my credit report under the account # XXXX. In my initial dispute, I requested the removal of this account due to the collection agency 's failure to provide debt validation. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ) ( 6 ), I am entitled to know the method used to verify the accuracy of this collection account. Specifically, I am requesting : 1. The method used to verify the accuracy of this collection account. 2. The name and contact information of the person or entity that provided the verification. 3. Copies of any documents or records used in the reinvestigation process. As the collection agency did not provide validation, the continued presence of this account on my credit report is both inaccurate and non-compliant with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 809 ( a ). Please provide the requested information and update my credit report accordingly. If the information can not be verified, this collection account must be removed from my credit file as required by FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a response within the 30-day period allowed by law. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was working with someone who I thought was a condo owner in XXXX. I found this person in a private XXXX vacation group on XXXX. They provided me what looked like an authentic contract for the vacation week along with a contact phone and email. They sent me photos of the property. They asked for a deposit to hold the week ( for XXXX of XXXX ). All of this seemed fine until they asked me to send the funds through XXXX to a person with a different name. They said it was a relative because they didn't have XXXX and because I insisted on using a credit card so that I would be backed in case there was an issue, they offered this solution for XXXX as they accept credit cards. In the middle of the transaction, I started to suspect this was a scam and I called the credit card right away to let them know. The transaction on XXXX said 'still processing ' when I called. I told them that it was fraud but I thought the only method to handle was through dispute. They took my dispute info right away. I then got XXXX follow up calls where the representative asked me questions. I find out today that they dispute was not approved and I am on the hook for {$XXXX}. I did not get any service for this and the person I was working with since took themselves off of XXXX. I have been a customer of Citi for a long time so this is unacceptable. I did everything right. 

The date of the transaction was XX/XX/XXXX for {$XXXX}. I would like to complain that Citi is not handling this correctly as I was very prompt in reporting this.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX has violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq., by failing to provide proof of its legal right to collect on the alleged debt. XXXX has no valid Assignment Agreement or Debt Sale Agreement from the XXXX XXXX XXXX, the original debt holder. Without this documentation, XXXX can not establish a valid chain of ownership or prove its right to collect. The FDCPA requires debt collectors to verify debts upon request and provide clear ownership documentation. XXXX improperly claims that because this demand was made in a lawsuit, they dont have to supply the documentation to validate the debt, shifting the burden of proof contrary to the FDCPA. XXXX XXXX failure to produce verification renders its collection attempts unlawful and sanctionable under FDCPA guidelines.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Deceptive Business Practices, Misrepresentation, and Lack of Transparency in Home Purchase and Loan Process To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Lennar XXXX ( the builder ) and Lennar Mortgage ( the lending entity ) concerning the home purchase and loan process for the property located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX  XXXX ( Loan Number : XXXX ). Both companies are part of the Lennar Corporation, but I believe they have engaged in deceptive business practices related to the {$21000.00} rate buy-down credit, lack of transparency in the loan terms, and miscommunication between their departments. 

XXXX. Misrepresentation of {$21000.00} Rate Buy-Down Credit From the outset, Lennar XXXX ( through their sales representatives and loan officers ) misrepresented the {$21000.00} rate buy-down credit. This credit was initially presented as a straightforward incentive to reduce the interest rate on the loan. However, after signing the agreement and seeking clarification from the loan officer, I was informed that it was being treated as a promotional rate or bulk rate buy-down. These terms were never disclosed upfront and were explained with insufficient details, using terms such as off settlement, bulk buy-down, and XXXX, which are not industry-standard and remain unclear to the consumer. These terms were neither defined in plain language nor adequately explained in the documents provided. 

At the time of the agreement, I explicitly confirmed with the loan officer that the {$21000.00} credit would be applied toward the rate buy-down. This was a key part of my decision to proceed with the purchase. Yet, at closing, I learned that the credit was not applied as promised and instead, Lennar referred to it as a promotional rate, further complicating and confusing the matter. This misrepresentation violates the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ), both of which require clear and accurate disclosures of loan terms, including how any credits are applied. 

XXXX. Lack of Transparency and Potential Deceptive Practices Throughout the process, Lennar failed to provide transparency regarding the nature of the {$21000.00} credit and the rate buy-down. The lack of clarity surrounding the credits application raises serious concerns about potential deceptive practiceswhere a consumer is lured into an agreement under false pretenses, only to find that the terms change or are not applied as expected. 

The terminology used in communicationssuch as bulk rate buy-down, off settlement, NFC, promotional rate, and rate buy-downwas introduced inconsistently by various departments involved in this transaction. Each department seemed to use a different term, with XXXX word being added to each email without clear explanation or proper definition. These terms were never properly explained or clarified in plain language, leading to confusion about their meaning and impact on the loan terms. 

Sales department first introduced the term bulk rate buy-down. 
Loan department used off settlement. 
Legal team referred to it as a promotional rate. 
Each of these terms is neither clearly defined nor standard in the industry, making it difficult for an average consumer to understand. This inconsistent use of terminology, coupled with the failure to provide clear, plain-language explanations, exemplifies the lack of transparency that violates consumer protection laws such as XXXX, RESPA, and state-specific XXXX XXXX Acts. 

XXXX. Unreasonable Delay in Response and Lack of Resolution Despite numerous attempts to clarify these issues directly with Lennar, including written inquiries and formal complaints, I have received no satisfactory responses. After sending legal notices and escalating the issue to higher management, there has been no acknowledgment of the serious issues I raised, nor has there been an effort to resolve the matter. The lack of response from Lennar 's legal and corporate management teams indicates either a deliberate attempt to avoid resolution or a complete failure in their customer service process.

Furthermore, Lennars apology email, sent in response to my complaints, did not address the core issue of the misrepresentation of the {$21000.00} credit or the lack of clarity surrounding the loan terms. Instead, they simply apologized for the confusion without providing a substantive explanation or resolution. This apology, while seemingly conciliatory, is a clear admission of mishandling and confusion on their part. If no mistake had been made, there would have been no need for such an apology. The apology serves only as a deflection, rather than an actual resolution to the miscommunication and financial distress I have endured. 

This sidestepping of the original issue highlights Lennar 's failure to take responsibility for the misrepresentations and the severe financial and emotional strain they have caused. The lack of a legal or financial remedy in the apology shows that they are not addressing the real problem at handthe incorrect application of the {$21000.00} credit and the lack of clear, transparent communication surrounding the loan terms. 

XXXX. Impact on Financial and Emotional Well-Being As a result of these misrepresentations and the ongoing lack of transparency, my family has suffered emotional distress and confusion. The confusion surrounding the {$21000.00} credit, combined with the last-minute changes to the terms of the loan, forced me to make significant decisions under extreme pressure. This situation has caused undue financial strain, as well as emotional distress, as I was led to believe that I was receiving the agreed-upon terms and that the {$21000.00} credit would significantly reduce my loans interest rate. 

Furthermore, the continuous delays and lack of response have further exacerbated the anxiety and uncertainty regarding our familys home purchase. The constant back-and-forth without clear answers is unacceptable, especially given the financial implications. 

Applicable Legal Violations : Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : Lennar failed to fully disclose the terms and conditions of the loan, including the exact application of the {$21000.00} credit and the promotional rate. 
Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ) : The lack of clear documentation regarding the application of the {$21000.00} credit violates RESPAs requirements for transparency in settlement charges. 
California Consumer Protection Act : Lennar 's failure to disclose critical information regarding the rate buy-down process and potential bait-and-switch tactics may constitute deceptive business practices under state law. 
Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Deceptive Advertising : Lennar may have engaged in deceptive practices by advertising the {$21000.00} credit in a way that misled consumers about its actual application and terms. 
State-Specific Breach of Contract Laws : The failure to fulfill the contractual promise of a {$21000.00} credit, which was a central part of my decision to purchase the home, may constitute a breach of contract under California state law.

Breach of Contract and Promissory Estoppel : Lennar promised a {$21000.00} credit, which I relied upon in my decision to proceed with the purchase. The failure to deliver on this promise constitutes a breach of contract. Under the doctrine of promissory estoppel, I suffered harm from their failure to fulfill their promise. 
Additionally, Lennar 's last-minute suggestions to withdraw the application raise serious concerns about their lending practices. If a lender is legally obligated to act in good faith and it suggests withdrawal under duress, it casts doubt on their adherence to fair lending practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I made many payments to Self to assist with repairing my credit. They hold onto MY OWN money, & report it as a loan. After paying over {$300.00} to Self, being charged fees along the way, all to hold MY OWN MONEY, my family was forced to move and I became unable to pay. Self closed my account in XX/XX/XXXX. They continued to HOLD my OWN MONEY, ignoring the instant payout selection I had made. They closed my account in MAY, but CONTINUED CHARGING ME {$15.00} x 7+ MONTHS for interest and late fees ALL THE WHILE STILL HOLDING MY MONEY AND REPORTING NEGATIVE/LATE PAYMENTS TO MY CREDIT! If thats not absolute crazy enough, SELF took {$100.00} from MY MONEY that they were holding, and PAID the SECURE credit card I held with them. SECURE CARD means I, again, supplied that money, to use MY OWN MONEY as an allowance on a card. Yet they still took my own money, from the other account which held my own money, to PAY the SECURE card. This is absolutely UNREAL. NOW they claim I owe THEM, and have reported to credit a past due of {$180.00}. IN SUMMARY, I have paid Self, a total of {$370.00}. Upon account close, ZERO of my money was returned to me, as promised. Although the account was closed, and they were holding my funds, self continued charging me $ XXXX ongoing, while reporting negatively to my credit, again, while still holding my {$370.00}. They allowed the late and interest fees build up to exceed my paid in amount before sending me off to collections for this absolutely ABSURD. Let me be clear I paid {$370.00} to them, and got nothing but negative credit. ABSOLUTELY LUDICROUS. Due to Selfs unprofessional and predatory processes and blatant disregard for the importance of responsible credit reporting -- I DEMAND PROMPT REFUND for ALL I have paid into this QUESTIONABLE, ( this even legal? ) service. For {$

370.00}, they provided me with NOTHING BUT NEGATIVE CREDIT and a SWIFTLY DROPPING CREDIT SCORE. Ill be contacting the CFPB if I dont receive my demanded result, and QUICK. Desired Outcome/Settlement Desired Settlement : Other ( requires explanation ) R
efund my payments in full - total : {$370.00} in full to the card on file and remove account ( XXXX ) from my credit profiles IMMEDIATELY. 

I submitted this information to the XXXX, and have included that info here below.

I am writing to inform you that my identity may have been compromised, and I believe it is linked to an incident that occurred several years ago at the airport in XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I lost my purse and luggage at the airport. My purse contained my driver 's license, social security card, and several credit cards. Despite my efforts to locate the purse, it was never recovered. Since then, I have noticed suspicious activity on my credit report, including unauthorized accounts and inquiries. I am concerned that my personal information may have been stolen and used to commit identity theft. 

I am taking steps to protect my identity, such making this complaint and placing fraud alerts with the credit bureaus. I am continuing to monitor my own accounts and credit reports for any signs of fraudulent activity. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint Regarding Unresolved Loan Settlement and Accrued Interest I am writing to express my frustration and disappointment with the handling of my private student loan account. Despite my ongoing efforts to reach out and request a fair resolution, including settlement and potential forgiveness, no meaningful response has been provided by your company. This situation has become untenable, and I am seeking immediate action. 

Loan Details : - Original Loan Amount : {$11000.00} - Current Principal Balance : {$7900.00} - Past Due Amount : {$490.00} - Interest Rate : 13.75 % ( variable ) - Daily Interest Charge : {$2.00} - Last Payment Date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  - Monthly Installment : {$120.00} - Date of Loan Origination : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Issue Overview : Since the origination of this loan, I have made regular payments as required, and have accumulated a significant amount of paid interest. However, despite my efforts to work with your office regarding a settlement or potential forgivenessdue to my financial hardship and the mounting interest chargesthere has been no response or resolution from your side. 

To date, the interest alone has amounted to {$7800.00}, which, if added to the principal, significantly exceeds the original loan amount. Given the financial burden, I feel that it is unfair that I have been unable to receive any relief or closure, especially when I have been paying off this loan for years. The lack of communication from your office regarding a settlement, forgiveness, or any alternative plan is causing undue hardship, further impacting my credit and financial well-being.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Team, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Hyundai Motor Finance regarding the repossession and mishandling of my late mothers vehicle, a XXXX Hyundai XXXX, which occurred on XX/XX/XXXX. The series of events surrounding this repossession and subsequent actions by Hyundai Motor Finance have caused me significant distress and financial harm, and I am requesting your assistance in resolving these issues. 
Background and Details 1. Repossession Circumstances : Hyundai Motor Finance repossessed the vehicle without providing adequate confirmation to me, leaving me uncertain whether the car was taken by them or stolen, as the XXXX Hyundai XXXX is one of the most targeted models for theft due to its lack of a passive engine immobilizer. This vulnerability is a known manufacturing defect acknowledged by Hyundai in a class-action lawsuit settled for {$140.00} XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. Although my late mother is eligible to participate as a class member in this lawsuit settlement I have been barred from representing my mothers interest and I want that rectified immediately. 
2. Communication Barriers : Despite notifying Hyundai of my mothers passing and initiating estate proceedings with the Probate Court of XXXX XXXX, Georgia, in XX/XX/XXXX, Hyundai refused to communicate with me regarding the repossession, citing privacy concerns. This was inconsistent with their prior willingness to accept XXXX payments from my checking account. 
3. Car Retrieval Issues : After weeks of effort, I retrieved the car from the XXXX Auction in XXXX XXXX, Georgia, at the end of XX/XX/XXXX. I was charged {$170.00} by XXXX and additional fees by Hyundai that were never itemized despite my repeated requests for a written breakdown. 
4. Vehicle Condition and Concerns : Upon retrieving the car : o It was significantly dirtier than when it was repossessed.

o The odometer showed an increase of XXXX miles. 
o Items such as empty snack bags and tissues were left inside, suggesting unauthorized use. 
o My phone was no longer the only device synced to the car. 
o The driver-side door handle is now loose and insecure, likely damaged while in Hyundais possession. 
XXXX. Outstanding Title and Reimbursement Requests : Despite assurances that the car title would be delivered within XXXX business days, I have yet to receive it nearly a month later. Additionally, I am seeking reimbursement for unauthorized mileage, repairs to the cars door handle, and compensation for Hyundais failure to safeguard the vehicle while it was in their possession

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting a complaint regarding a debt collection agency that reported a debt to a credit bureau before providing me with the required debt validation notice. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g, the debt collector is required to send a validation notice to me within five days of their initial contact, detailing the amount owed and how to dispute the debt.

In my case, the debt was reported to the credit bureau before I received the necessary notification. While the debt collector did eventually validate the debt upon my request, the initial reporting to the credit bureau was done prematurely, violating the provisions of the FDCPA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NC, XXXX Date : XX/XX/year> To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Subject : Formal Report of Credit Card Fraud and Identity Theft I am writing to formally report a case of credit card fraud and identity theft that has caused me significant financial and emotional distress. I am seeking your assistance in investigating this matter and taking necessary actions to ensure that justice is served. Below are the details of the incident. 
1. Summary of the Incident : The first unauthorized transaction was made on XX/XX/year>, and posted on XX/XX/year>, approximately one week before I detected fraud. 

2. Timeline of Events : Initial Fraudulent Transaction : The first unauthorized transaction was made on XX/XX/year>, and posted on XX/XX/year>, approximately XXXX week before I detected fraud. 
Subsequent Transactions : Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/year>, a total of XXXX fraudulent transactions were made, amounting to approximately {$42000.00}. These transactions appeared in my account even after I raised an initial claim and canceled the card. 

Upon questioning why charges continued despite the cancellation, the bank informed me that these transactions had been kept " pending '' and were later approveddespite clear signs of fraud. I subsequently raised XXXX claim cases to contest these charges. 
Action Taken by Me : Upon detecting the fraud, I immediately : I. Locked the card on XX/XX/year>. 
II. Contacted the credit card issuer to report the fraudulent transactions and raised total of XXXX disputes. 
III. Canceled the compromised card and received a replacement, which I have not activated, awaiting resolution of the issue. 
Banks Response : Despite mentioning the fact that I was over XXXX miles away from the fraudulent transaction locations, the bank rejected my claim. Their rejection was based on the assertion that the physical card was present at the PoS, which contradicts the fact that I have the card in my possession. 
3. Concerns with the Bank 's Handling of the Case : The bank failed to flag or block the suspicious activity during the week when XXXX transactions were made, including multiple high-value purchases and transactions exceeding my credit limit ( {$11000.00} ). 
Transactions were approved despite being geographically implausible, such as purchases made hundreds of miles apart within hours. 
The bank has demanded additional proof, such as video footage from merchant locations, which I can not procure. 
4. Evidence Available Physical Card : have retained the physical card. 
XXXX XXXX : The card statement confirms my usage in North Carolina, over XXXX miles away from the fraudulent transaction sites during the fraud period. I can provide XXXXXXXX XXXX  data upon request to further corroborate this. 
A record of communication with the credit card company regarding my claims and their subsequent rejection. 
Claims Details- o Claim XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Credit card Statements-Available for verification summary of the charges : Total Charges- {$42000.00} Total Transaction- {$510.00} No of states-6 No of merchant-24 Date between- XXXX XXXX XXXX 

5. Impact on Me : The bank has held me liable for these fraudulent charges and is demanding payment, putting me at risk of financial and credit damage. I am deeply concerned about the potential misuse of my identity beyond this incident and fear further repercussions. 
Request for Assistance : I respectfully request your intervention in this matter to : Investigate the fraudulent transactions and determine how my card information was compromised. 
Hold the responsible parties accountable, including individuals or merchants involved in the fraud. 
Protect my financial and personal identity from further misuse. 
I am prepared to provide additional documentation or details to assist in your investigation. Please feel free to contact me at XXXX or XXXX for further communication. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust in your expertise and commitment to addressing financial crimes and protecting citizens from fraud. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a follow-up complaint regarding my unresolved issues with American Express National Bank ( American Express ) . My original complaint ( No. XXXX ) was closed, but the company failed to address or resolve my concerns. I am resubmitting this complaint because American Express continues to violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ), Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), and Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ). 

Background : On XX/XX/2024, I applied for the American Express Platinum Card, and my application was denied based on a XXXX score obtained from XXXX. I informed American Express that the information in my consumer report was false and unverifiable. Despite this, the company : Relied on False Data Without Verification ( 15 USC 1681 ) : American Express based their denial on inaccurate consumer report data and did not provide the legally required verification method under the FCRA. 

Dismissed My Request for Compensation Without Justification : My original complaint included an invoice for {$49000.00} in damages caused by their actions. American Express refused to address it, failing to acknowledge their responsibility for the harm caused by their non-compliance.

Intimidated Me Through Repeated Denials ( 15 USC 1692 ) : American Express d
enied my application three times, most recently on XXXX XXXX XXXX, without addressing the core issues or taking corrective action. This repeated denial, based on the same false data, constitutes harassment and intimidation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

Shifted Responsibility to the Credit Reporting Agency : Instead of verifying the accuracy of the data they used, American Express directed me to dispute the inaccuracies with XXXX, violating their obligations under the FCRA. 

The Companys Misleading Claims : In their response, American Express repeated their claim : We are committed to making sure all creditworthy customers have equal access to credit. However, denying me credit based on false and unverified data contradicts this statement. Their failure to correct their decision or take responsibility directly undermines their supposed commitment to fairness and compliance. 

Relief Requested : Immediate Reversal of the Credit Denial : American Express must reverse their decision based on false and unverified data.

Disclosure of Verification Methods : The company must provide the method used to verify the consumer report information and justify their reliance on inaccurate data.

Compensation for Damages : I request payment of the {$49000.00} invoiced for damages caused by their actions and continued non-compliance.

Full Investigation into American Expresss Practices : Given their ongoing violations, I urge the CFPB to investigate American Express for their failure to comply with FCRA, ECOA, TILA, and UCC.

Conclusion : American Expresss repeated denials, reliance on false data, and refusal to take accountability directly conflict with their claim of fairness and equal access to credit. Their actions demonstrate a continued disregard for consumer protection laws. I request the CFPBs assistance in holding American Express accountable and ensuring that my rights are upheld.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. 

Respectfully Submitted, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft ; ( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed ; ( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block.

( c ) Authority to decline or rescind.

( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions.

( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title.

( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block.

( d ) Exception for resellers.

( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller ; ( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer ; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft.

( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information.

( 3 ) Notice. In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale.

( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section 1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft.

( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint regarding a collection account reported on my credit report by Columbia Debt Recovery. Despite their efforts to collect, neither Columbia Debt Recovery nor XXXX, which continues to report this account, has provided proper validation of the alleged debt. 

Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I have the right to request validation of any alleged debt. This includes documentation verifying the original creditor, account details, and proof that the debt is legitimately tied to me. Columbia Debt Recovery has not fulfilled this legal obligation. 

Additionally, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), XXXX must ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information they report. Continuing to report unvalidated accounts violates federal law and causes undue harm to my credit profile. 

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate this matter thoroughly. I seek the immediate deletion of this unvalidated account from my credit report by XXXX. Furthermore, I demand that Columbia Debt Recovery cease all collection activities unless they can provide full and valid documentation proving the legitimacy of this debt, as required by law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am reaching out to seek your assistance regarding a troubling situation I am facing with Sunrise Credit Services, which I believe involves violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Recently, I discovered that two different collection agencies are reporting the same debt of {$1800.00} across my credit reports from all three major bureaus. This dual reporting is misleading and has negatively impacted my credit score, which is a clear violation of my rights as a consumer.

Upon noticing this issue, I contacted both collection agencies, and each asserted that my debt was active, despite my explanation of the double reporting. To clarify, I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX, the original creditor, who confirmed that the debt was recalled from Sunrise Credit Services back in XXXX. Therefore, they are no longer authorized to collect or report this debt, yet they have continued to do so for over XXXX months. 

When I reached out to Sunrise Credit Services to address this issue, their management insisted that my account was still open and argued against my claims. They demanded that I provide documentation from XXXX XXXX XXXX, which is not my responsibility as a consumer. After further discussions with XXXX XXXX XXXX, their management assured me they would send a notice to Sunrise Credit Services to clarify that they no longer have the right to collect this debt.

I believe Sunrise Credit Services has violated the FDCPA in the following ways : - Section 1692e : Misleading representations about the debt.

- Section 1692f : Engaging in unfair practices by pursuing a debt that has been recalled.

These actions have severely affected my credit standing, limiting my ability to secure loans and adding significant financial stress.

I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's assistance in addressing this matter. Your agency has the authority to investigate and take action against unfair or deceptive practices in the financial sector. Any guidance or intervention you can provide would be greatly appreciated in helping me resolve this issue and protect my rights as a consumer. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance.

I have contacted them numerous times since XXXX, most recently in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, regarding my covered borrower status under the Military Lending Act ( MLA ). Despite my inquiries specifically about MLA, they initially ran an SCRA check and informed me that I did not qualify under the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act ( SCRA ) because I opened the account while on XXXX XXXX, even though I had not asked about SCRA. 

Then said I qualified for MLA and they would need to apply it. In fact on their website it states, " Credit must be acquired while on XXXX XXXX '' which it was and has been. 

Eventually, they conducted an MLA inquiry but denied my eligibility, claiming that my account, opened in XXXX, was not covered because MLA protections apply only to accounts opened after XX/XX/XXXX despite me being on XXXX XXXX in XXXX and currently still being on XXXX XXXX. However, when I consulted the U.S. XXXX Legal Assistance Office, I was informed that this interpretation is incorrect. According to the legal office, credit card companies were required to comply with MLA provisions for all relevant accounts starting from that period, regardless of when the account was originally opened. 

Additionally, I had no balance on the account until recently, which means all transactions I am being billed for likely occurred after XXXX. Any changes to terms or agreements made after that date should have been subject to MLA requirements. Despite this, American Express continues to refuse to comply with the law despite me informing them numerous times and for years of my status.

I received a notification about potential fraud with my card, along with a notice that my card use was restricted if I did not act immediately, My options were to confirm the transaction or report it as fraud. The name of the merchant was listed as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Given I live in Illinois and do not own a XXXX, I markd the charge as fraud. Almost instantly, I received a notice from XXXX ( XXXX ) saying my charge had been declined. 

It turns out, that Apple/Goldman Sachs reported the wrong merchant. While the problem with XXXX ( XXXX ) was resolved quickly, Apple and Goldman Sachs invalidated my card number used for about 90 % of all transactions. When I contacted custoer service, they stated they could not solve the problem AND stated that it was because the merchant name on a website or store did not have to match what was on the statement. This excuse did not address the true problem that I had acted on false information they sent me. 

The problem is that I now have to track down dozens of accounts ( including insurance policies, automated payemnts, subscriptions, and so on. The amount of time and effort needed to cure this is tremendous, and may well result in late fees, reinstatment fees, or cancellations unless I go through 14 months of statements to try to figure out every singl place I used the card.

None of this would have happened if Apple and Goldman Sachs had not misidentified the merchant. They offered ZERO help and ZERO  compensation for their obvious error. To add insult to injury, they disconnected the chat before I could finish explaining the situation.

This unfortunate situation has also negatively impacted my credit score. 

I have attached a copy of my loan agreement for your reference. I would be happy to provide any additional information that you may need.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear LVNV Funding LLC, I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 
Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Illegal Credit Report Inquiry by [ USAA XXXX ] FCRA XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against [ USAA XXXX ] for unlawfully accessing my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ). On [ starting XXXX every single month till the last pull on XXXX ], USAA XXXX ] performed a credit inquiry without my authorization or any permissible purpose as defined by the FCRA. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, companies are required to have a permissible purposesuch as a credit transaction initiated by the consumer, a court order, or a business transaction that requires access to my credit informationto lawfully pull my credit report. I have no such relationship or outstanding debt with [ USAA XXXX ] that would justify this inquiry. This unauthorized credit pull has negatively affected my credit score and caused undue stress. As such, I am seeking the following : 1. Statutory Damages : Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( a ), I am requesting statutory damages in the amount of {$1000.00} for willful noncompliance with the FCRA. 2. Actual Damages : I have suffered harm, including emotional distress and potential damage to my credit standing, due to this unlawful inquiry. I reserve the right to seek actual damages in addition to statutory damages. Please investigate this violation of my consumer rights and take action against [ USAA XXXX ] to prevent future illegal activities. I also request that the unauthorized inquiry be removed from my credit report immediately. Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your timely response. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year>2024 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX OH XXXX Subject XXXX Debt Validation Request Dear ADS/COMENITY/SEPHORA, I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding the alleged debt referenced in your letter dated [ insert date of their letter ]. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I am requesting validation of this debt.

Specifically, I request the following documentation : 1. Proof of Debt : Copies of all records showing the amount of the debt, how it was calculated, and the original contract or agreement signed by me.

2. Assignment of Debt : Copies of all contracts or assignments that demonstrate your legal right to collect this debt, including any chain of assignment from the original creditor to your company.

3. Original Creditor Information : The name, address, and contact information of the original creditor, along with details about the account and any outstanding balance at the time of the assignment or sale.

4. Payment History : A detailed, itemized statement showing any payments made, fees added, and the balance still owed.

5. Statute of Limitations Verification : Documentation confirming the date of last payment and whether the debt is within the statute of limitations.

Until I receive the requested documentation, I dispute the validity of this debt. I also request that all collection efforts, including reporting to credit bureaus, be halted until this matter is resolved.

Please note that future communication regarding this matter should be in writing and sent to the address listed above. Additionally, I request that you do not contact me by phone.

Thank you for your cooperation. I look forward to receiving the requested information within 30 days of your receipt of this letter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request your assistance in addressing a credit reporting issue involving Toyota Financial Services and my car loan during the COVID-19 pandemic.

During the government-mandated shutdowns caused by COVID-19, my businessa source of incomewas completely shut down and unable to operate. In light of this unprecedented situation, I proactively reached out to Toyota Financial Services to explain my financial hardship caused by the natural disaster and proposed a resolution. 

I offered to pay the total price of the car, excluding the interest, and requested that Toyota Financial Services take back the car and close the account. They agreed to my proposal, accepted the payment, and repossessed the car. However, despite fulfilling this agreement, they subsequently reported the account as a foreclosure, which has negatively impacted my credit score.

This foreclosure report is unjustified because : 1. The financial hardship was caused by a government-mandated shutdown during a natural disaster.

2. Toyota Financial Services agreed to the proposed resolution, which included payment in full of the original loan amount ( excluding interest ) and repossession of the car.

3. The terms of the agreement were fully satisfied, and the foreclosure reporting is inaccurate and unfair under the circumstances.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I am happy to provide additional documentation or details as needed to support this request.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Despite repeated attempts to make payments towards principal only, M & T has not allowed me to do so on my loan. I have spoken with dozens of representatives, both in person and via the phone, to try to find a way to do so, and they either unsure or have told me it can not be done. As a result, I have had multiple payments wrongly applied as " early payments '' on the minimum payment due each month instead of payments towards principal. These additional payments, along with all my regularly scheduled " minimum payments owed '' each month are being applied to interest only. 

These payments are being wrongly applied as " early payments '' towards the monthly owed amount and thus my statements read that I am XXXX months ahead on payments. Despite this, my payments being made each month are still applying entirely or largely to interest only. 

As a result, despite making payments +/- {$15000.00} towards my original loan, I still owe ~ {$24000.00} on a loan that originally was {$28000.00}. This is deceptive and predatory. 

I have tried everything that has been suggested to me and that I could think of to make sure the payments are applied correctly. There is no way to do so via the online portal or application. I have gone in person and requested it, which was denied. I have called over the phone and it was denied over the phone. I have tried to make my regularly scheduled payment via the online portal and then paid a second payment in the same business day via the online portal. Despite this, both payments apply towards interest. I can not fathom how M & T is allowed to do this. 

Per the statements " [ My ] account is paid ahead for XXXX or more payment periods. Please note : even though youve paid ahead, the interest will continue to accrue daily on your outstanding principal balance. '' This means it is not paying down my principal ahead or decreasing my interest owed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Transworld Systems XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Re : Formal Dispute of Debt and Alleged FDCPA Violations Account Number : Dear Transworld Systems I am writing to dispute the debt referenced above, as permitted under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I request that you immediately cease all collection activities and provide validation of the alleged debt, as required by law.

In addition, I have identified several potential violations of the FDCPA in your collection efforts, including but not limited to the following : Adding Unauthorized Fees or Charges You appear to have added fees or charges to the alleged debt that were not authorized by any agreement or permitted by law.

Attempting to Collect Debts Not Owed or Already Discharged You have attempted to collect a debt that I do not owe or that has been previously discharged. Please provide proof that this debt is valid and legally enforceable. 

Failure to Validate the Debt You failed to provide a written notice of the debt within five days of your initial contact, as required by law. This notice must include the amount of the debt, the name of the original creditor, and information about my right to dispute the debt.

Despite my dispute of this debt and request for verification, you have continued collection activities without providing the necessary validation.

To comply with the FDCPA, I demand the following : Validation of the Debt : Provide documentation that substantiates the debt, including the name of the original creditor, an itemized account of the charges, and proof that you are authorized to collect it. 
Cease and Desist : Until you have validated the debt, cease all collection efforts, including communication with me. 
If these violations are not remedied and if you fail to validate this debt, I will file a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), my state attorney general, and consider legal action for damages. 

Please respond in writing and include the requested validation documents within 30 days of receiving this letter. Send your response to the address listed above.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Demand for Statutory Damages for Violation of Florida Consumer Collection Practices Act. 

I am writing to bring to your attention a violation of the Florida Consumer Collection Practices Act ( FCCPA ), specifically, Section 559.72 ( 17 ), which prohibits communication with a debtor outside the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. without prior consent from the debtor. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXXXXXX XXXX., and on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX., I received a payment reminder email regarding my account ending in XXXX. This communication was sent outside the legally permissible hours and without my prior consent, in clear violation of Florida law. 

Under the FCCPA, consumers are entitled to statutory damages of up to {$1000.00} per violation, in addition to compensation for any actual damages incurred. As a result of this unauthorized communication, I am formally requesting the following : Payment of statutory damages of up to {$1000.00}, as allowed under the FCCPA for each of these violations.

Immediate assurance that all future communications will adhere to the legal requirements set forth by the FCCPA.

Written confirmation that this violation has been acknowledged and addressed within 15 days of receiving this letter.

Failure to respond to this request within the specified timeframe will result in further action, including but not limited to filing formal complaints with the Florida Attorney General 's Office and/or pursuing legal action to seek statutory damages and any additional compensation for actual damages and attorneys fees.

I hope to resolve this matter promptly and amicably. Please confirm in writing that you will take the necessary steps to ensure compliance with the FCCPA going forward. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Representative ], I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) regarding their handling of a debt collection related to my previous apartment. Below is a summary of the events and issues I have encountered : XXXX. **Background on the Debt : ** - I previously resided in [ Name of Apartment Complex ], where my rent fell behind by XXXX months. 
- Upon catching up on payments, the apartment complex refused to accept my rent and subsequently took me to court. 
- We settled on a payment in court, and I paid a portion immediately, followed by monthly payments until I moved out. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX 's Involvement : ** - Years later, XXXX XXXX contacted me, alleging I still owed a balance. 
- During my interactions with XXXX XXXX, their representatives were verbally abusive, threatening, and unwilling to work collaboratively to resolve the debt. 

XXXX. **Efforts to Settle the Debt : ** - I attempted multiple times to resolve the issue by offering a lump sum payment or a payment plan. 
- XXXX XXXX refused all reasonable settlement offers and did not provide a clear explanation for their refusal. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX : ** - The original debt of {$XXXX} has ballooned to {$XXXX} due to accrued interest, making it even more challenging to resolve. 
- Despite my willingness to address the matter, XXXX XXXX aggressive and non-cooperative behavior has made it impossible to settle the debt fairly. 

XXXX. **Supporting Evidence : ** - I have attached relevant documentation, including proof of payments made to the apartment complex and court documents outlining the initial settlement. 

This experience has caused significant stress and hardship, as XXXX XXXX abusive tactics and refusal to cooperate have impeded my ability to resolve the matter. Additionally, their actions appear to violate ethical and potentially legal standards for debt collection practices. 

**Request for XXXX : ** I kindly request your assistance in investigating XXXX XXXX behavior and practices. Specifically, I ask that you : XXXX Review XXXX XXXX handling of this account to ensure compliance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 
XXXX. Intervene to facilitate a fair resolution, including the possibility of negotiating a reasonable settlement for the debt. 
XXXX. Take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX if their practices are found to be unethical or in violation of federal or state laws. 

I am prepared to provide any additional information or documentation necessary to support my complaint. Please let me know how I can assist in your investigation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

As a result, my title company needed to pay the taxes ( also ) to complete the sale of my house. They paid the taxes on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I reached out to Shellpoint on XX/XX/XXXX to initiate a refund of these funds, since their funds were received second, per XXXX XXXX MN process. 
-I called on XXXX and Shellpoint stated they had not received the funds yet. But they set me up for a text notification so that when they were received, I would be notified. 
-I called back on XX/XX/XXXX, as I checked XXXX XXXX XXXX website and saw that the refund was showing as having been completed and was told that the funds were received /by XXXX, however the funds were not applied to my account, and were 'missing. ' As a result, they could not issue a refund until they were 'found. ' -I called on XX/XX/XXXX and had to once again escalate the issue as the funds were still 'missing. ' -I called on XX/XX/XXXX and confirmed that the funds were located and applied to my account on XX/XX/XXXX and would be sent via ACH , via an escalation and I should have my funds in 1-3 business days. 
-I called on XX/XX/XXXX, as I still do not have funds in my bank account, was told that it is still pending and a complaint is being filed on my behalf with the company, but no time estimate can be given and per their records, it appears that funds were only received on XX/XX/XXXX. I reiterated that I want my funds released TODAY and that they have been sitting on these funds since XXXX, but they state there is no way to escalate further or ensure that my monies will be released to me by a specified time. I told them that at this point I am also filing a complaint with the CFPB, as this needs to be documented outside of just their company, but officially, and this needs to be resolved immediately.

High-pressure sales tactics
Consumer complaint narrative:
I went to the dealership in a very tough situation that required the necessity for 100 % financing. The finance person XXXX XXXX stated that because I needed 100 % financing my interest rate would be high. She further stated that no bank would approve me for a car with high miles because that was my initial request. She stated that they wanted me to be in an equity position, which I understood. I asked for the bottom line price and she stated that with a XXXX credit score, the payment would be XXXX including Gap. After I protested she explained that the interest rate was higher because of the 100 % and that overall with inflation interest rates are just high and that it is what it is. I asked if she tried XXXX XXXX which is my bank, she indicated that she did but they declined. She added that Credit Unions do not do 100 % financing for car loans. I didn't think anything of it because I know that XXXX XXXX  doesn't do 100 % on mortgages so I thought it was the same for car loans. I told her I wasn't comfortable. She told me to pay the loan for 6 months on time and I could return to refinance for something new or I can keep the car. Thinking that this was my only option I agreed. I told her that I didn't need registration and tags cause I was going to transfer them. She said I couldn't leave the lot unless I had those tags with me so I had to get it ( which was a lie ). I advised her that if I found out anything different I would return the car the next day. 

The next morning I found that my bank XXXX XXXX did not receive an inquiry which was later evidenced from the inquiry list on my credit report. I then went to my other credit Union ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and they not only thought the interest rate of 23.66 % was extremely high they informed me that they indeed do 100 % financing. The bank agreed to finance the loan and advised me to call the dealership to see if they would cancel the loan and let them finance it since it was done after banking hours and it hadn't been 24 hours. The bank also asked for the original purchase order. I called, the salesman who said to return the car and he would get a new purchase order for my bank. I returned to the dealership at approximately XXXX, and XXXX XXXX said it was too late that the bank had already processed the loan. I asked her how as it hadn't been 24 hours yet and the papers were signed after XXXX? She said because it was signed electronically it was final ; this was XX/XX/XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX I called the bank that the dealer processed ( Santander ), and they hadn't processed nor received my paperwork for the loan as they had no record of my SS #.. 

I then filed a complaint with he Attorney General 's Office and XXXX. I told both that the only resolution for me was to either cancel the loan and take the car back or cancel the loan and let me purchase it through my bank. I called the XXXX and advised him of what occurred with XXXX XXXX. I told him that I attempted to return the car and he said that it was too late and that the loan was processed. I then asked him to provide my bank with the original purchase order. He refused. He told me that they do not give that. He stated that my paperwork would suffice. I reiterated that they needed the original and that I wanted the window sticker. In the end, I gave the bank this number to explain exactly what they needed. The Bank Manager, XXXX XXXX called to advise that the XXXX was very rude and almost combative with their request. He did not provide the paperwork until XXXX called them. 

When I spoke to the XXXX I advised them that the loan was not processed. He said no We have already received the XXXX payment. I then spoke to my salesman immediately after and he advice that no check was received, this was XX/XX/year> @ XXXX They preyed on my situation and pushed for a loan painting it as my only option because of my circumstances. They further lied to me to make sure the paperwork was processed by Santander, preventing my bank from financing the loan at a significantly lower rate. The bank pulled my credit, and the score was XXXX points higher than with the dealership, and they have approved 7 % interest. 

I also have requested confirmation of the offers and or denials from the other Leanders who were contacted on my behalf. 

My ask is simple : stop this practice, cancel my loan with Santander and the GAP as it was signed under false pretenses, and allow XXXX to finance the car @ 7 %. 

I can be reached at XXXX any time.

XXXX of the times the call center representative kept me on the phone for an hour ( possibly longer ) trying to convince me it was a legal charge even though XXXX has told me categorically that it not only is not a charge of theirs but that it is clearly a fake impersonation of an XXXX charge because it says " XXXX '' which they do not use, and also does not have an accompanying number that matches their number conventions. Every time Chase cancels and issues a new card I have recurring charges assigned to that card that cause me grief and financial trouble and also, have to go through the process of changing the number with multiple companies. Then the charge shows up again on the new statement, even though it should have been flagged as fraud to begin with, by Chase and XXXX XXXX. Since this is still happening after XXXX months after multiple reports I have reason to believe it is being caused within XXXX XXXX and not outside since I almost never use the card physically at any retailers and my other cards are not experiencing this issue, and this card has had a new number assigned XXXX other times this year alone. The first time they changed the number they never removed the charges, btw. I had to call again and spend an hour on the phone to make that happen. Now I see multiple charges since XXXX so working with Chase to resolve it didn't make a difference.

Consumer complaint narrative: To Whom it May Concern, This letter is in response to your contact with myself in an amount owed that you have identified. This is neither an acknowledgement of debt nor a refusal to pay, but a notice to request validation. Under the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am entitled to request validation of the debt that you allege I owe to you. This is not a request to verity the debt, but rather a request for you to provide complete and competent evidence of my contractual obligation to provide payment due to you. Please provide the following alleged information to me within thirty ( 30 ) days from receipt of this letter. [ INSERT ALL THAT APPLY ] [ Creditor 's Name and Full Address ] [ Name of Debtor of Record ] [ Full Account Number ] [ Amount of Debt ] [ Due Date of Debt ] [ Original Charge Off or Delinquency Datel [ Explanation of how the Debt was calculated ] [ Evidence that the Debt is within State 's applicable Statute of Limitation ] [ Name of Collection Agency or Owner of Debt, if applicable ] [ Amount Paid if Debt was Purchased ] [ Completed and Executed Agreement, including Signature Pages, for the Debt ] Pursuant to my rights under FDCPA, I will not be responding or acknowledging any further collection attempts from you until you have verified that this debt is mine.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Email : XXXX Date : XX/XX/2024 Jefferson Capital Systems XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX MN XXXX Subject : Notice of Dispute and Request for Debt Validation** Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my formal Notice of Dispute regarding the alleged debt associated with the above-referenced account number. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting full validation of this debt. 

Please note that I do not acknowledge or admit responsibility for this alleged debt. I am exercising my rights under the FDCPA to dispute this claim and request that you provide the following documentation to validate the debt you are attempting to collect : Proof of the original agreement : A copy of the signed agreement or contract between me and the original creditor that demonstrates I am obligated to pay this debt. 
Itemized account statement : A detailed breakdown of the debt amount, including principal, interest, fees, and any additional charges. 
Proof of assignment or ownership : Documentation showing that Jefferson Capital Systems has the legal right to collect this debt, including the chain of custody if the debt was sold or transferred. 
Verification of compliance : Proof that this debt complies with all applicable state and federal laws, including statutes of limitations. 
Additionally, until the requested information is provided, I request that you immediately cease all collection activities related to this account, including reporting this alleged debt to any credit reporting agencies. If this debt has already been reported, please update any credit reporting agencies to reflect that the debt is under dispute. 

It has come to my attention that Jefferson Capital Systems has a history of lawsuits for violations of the FDCPA. For example : XXXX v. Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC : Your company was accused of sending misleading communications to consumers, and the court denied your motion for summary judgment, allowing the plaintiff 's claims to proceed. 
XXXX XXXX Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC : Your company was accused of filing a lawsuit without proper documentation and failing to send demand communications before initiating legal action. The court found that the plaintiffs claims under the FDCPA were valid and allowed the case to proceed. 
I urge you to ensure full compliance with the FDCPA in this matter to avoid similar legal consequences. 

You have 30 days from the date of receipt of this letter to respond with the requested documentation. If you can not validate this debt, you must cease all collection efforts and remove any negative information related to this account from my consumer reports. 

This letter is not an admission of liability for this debt and does not authorize any further collection activity. All correspondence regarding this matter must be in writing and sent to the address listed above or via email at XXXX. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
