Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX : Someone called my cell at XXXXXXXX XXXX, his # shown as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, he said he is from Citi fraud dept, alerted me that my credit card was used to purchase {$490.00} XXXX times in XXXX. I said I didn't purchase any thing w/those amounts. He offered to help me get credit back from those purchases and asked me to confirm my security word, he gave me hint that it started with letter " XXXX  '' ( now I think my credit card acct was already compromised before he called me, he even mentioned some of my latest charges that I made ), and that he would help me cancel my credit card ( card ending # XXXX ), and have the new card mail to me. 

He connected me to someone seemed like from Citicards ( # shown as Citi XXXX @ XXXX ), the lady asked me to confirm my personal infor in order to mail my new credit card. I now don't remember what infor she asked me to confirm. 

When done w/her phone call, he called me back @ XXXX XXXX, said his name is XXXX XXXX and he's assigned to my case, and that when I receive new card I should call his direct number XXXX, he will remove all the fraud charges and get credit back to my acct. He then asked me to call his direct number to make sure he receives my call, I did so at XXXX XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I signed on but couldnt access my online acct for card XXXX, it was closed. 

From Monday XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX  XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX several times ( the # shown as Toll Free Call XXXX ) to see if I receive my new card. 

XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX XXXX ( called from XXXX @ XXXX XXXX  ) asked me to call him as soon as new card arrives so he can remove the fraud charges and issue credit to my acct. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I received the new card ( card ending # XXXX ) and activated it. I then called XXXX XXXX at XXXX @ XXXX XXXX  in hope that the fraud charges will be taken care of. He asked me to hang up and he called me back from XXXX @ XXXX XXXX. 
I don't remember what infor he asked from me. He said he needed the full credit card number in order to remove the fraud charges and issue credit to my acct. 
He then asked for my home phone then he called my home phone from XXXX @ XXXX XXXX  at the same time he told me to leave my cell phone on. He instructed me that I will receive ID Code from Citi and I should read them to him, he said he needs these codes to remove the fraud charges and issue credit back to my acct. 
I read the codes to him. He even told me to enter a long number into a text message and send, the number is XXXX, he said it's part of the process to remove the fraud charges. Right after I sent the text, a phone call to my cell shown as XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX  called and hung up right away. 

After staying on the phone with XXXX XXXX for about XXXX min, that was almost XXXX XXXX  XXXX, I asked him why it took so long. His answer was because he worked from home and didn't have the regular gadgets as in the office and that's the reasons it took long and that he had to fill out application. I asked what application, his answer : application to get refund to my account. Only then suspected something isnt right, I told him I had to leave and I disconnected the phone call with him. 

Late that night I tried to remember the phone calls with XXXX XXXX and I realized I had been scammed. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I signed on to my XXXX XXXX online account and saw XXXX charges to merchants in XXXX and XXXX XXXX, the charges are : XXXX XXXX - Virtual Account Number XXXX ( {$490.00} ), XXXX XXXX XXXX Virtual Account Number XXXX ( {$990.00} ), XXXX XXXX - Virtual Account Number XXXX ( {$490.00} ), XXXX XXXX - Virtual Account Number XXXX ( {$490.00} ), XXXX XXXX  Virtual Account Number XXXX ( {$490.00} ), XXXX XXXX Virtual Account Number XXXX ( {$480.00} ), XXXX XXXX Virtual Account Number XXXX ( {$490.00} ). Total to {$3900.00}. I called Citicards at XXXX about XXXX XXXX  to reported the fraud charges and Citicards had them in dispute. 
Citi canceled my card # XXXX and issued a new one. 
Note : XXXX XXXX canceled but I was still able to access closed acct until new card activated. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I stopped by XXXX store but the item I want wasnt ready. I left for grocery shopping then came back. Store manager said he called me 2 times but an XXXX man answered and pretended to be me. Store manager then checked my phone and found out my phone was forwarded to XXXX when he saw the number XXXX. Store manager helped me cancel the call forwarding. The scammer also tried to activate XXXX Caller ID using my information. 

From XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX : I received several phone calls from # s shown as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX [ this # with XXXX XXXX voice asking if it was me answering phone, I hung up ], XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX. I received letters from Citicards Security Services dated XX/XX/XXXX saying my dispute is now closed. Citi denied my claim/dispute and refused to credit {$3900.00} back to my account. City said I have to pay that amount or else they will report as past due to the consumer reporting agencies : XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. And that if I want to pursue this matter further, Ill need to reach out to the merchant ( s ) directly. I do not know these merchants. 

A week later, I received another letter from Citi with different letterhead dated XX/XX/XXXX with the subject Were looking into the dispute. I still have not heard from Citi since. 

I did not authorize any of the XXXX fraud charges. I had been scammed by XXXX XXXX and a victim of fraud and identity theft. 

I reported this incident to the below agencies : XX/XX/XXXX : Reported to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Tel : XXXX. Report # XXXX XX/XX/XXXX : Reported to FTC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Report # XXXX XX/XX/XXXX : Reported to FBI [ IC3 ] for identity theft, there was no Report # given but there was an option to print the report. I printed out the report On XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX Ive placed Credit Freeze and Fraud Alert to XXXX, XXXX and XXXX

Sub-issue: Payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the improper handling of my mortgage loan servicing by Castle & Cooke Mortgage, which has caused significant financial and emotional distress. Prior to XX/XX/year>, I maintained a flawless payment history with no late payments. However, since the servicing of my loan was transferred, I have been reported as having five late payments, all of which I strongly dispute.

Here are the key issues I have encountered : Improper Notification of Loan Servicing Transfer : I was not informed about the transfer of my loan servicing through electronic communication, phone calls, or other timely notifications. I only learned of the transfer when I received a collection call regarding a late payment. At the time, I was out of the country for my wedding in my wifes home country, which compounded the challenges of addressing this issue promptly. 

Mishandling of Payments : I requested automatic payment drafts to ensure timely payments, yet Castle & Cooke has repeatedly mishandled my requests, leading to unwarranted late payments. 

Failure to Address Disputes and Resolve Errors : Over several months, I have diligently attempted to resolve these issues by speaking with customer service representatives who seemed sympathetic and assured me that the late payments and fees would be reversed. However, the written decisions have consistently reaffirmed their stance without adequately addressing my concerns. 

Given these issues, I am requesting the following resolutions : Removal of all late payment entries from my credit report to restore my credit standing. 
Reimbursement of all late fees and penalties assessed due to these mishandlings. 
Transfer of my loan servicing to a different servicer to prevent further issues. 
The repeated errors, lack of communication, and failure to provide timely resolutions have caused significant harm to my financial and personal well-being. I believe that Castle & Cooke Mortgage has violated federal regulations and failed to meet the standards of care required of a loan servicer. 

I respectfully request the CFPBs assistance in ensuring that these issues are resolved promptly and fairly. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require additional documentation or information regarding my complaint. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative: I called XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX regarding my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX and spoke to a representative to ask why my account appears to be closed without notice after I looked at my credit report to see it gone. I also wanted to know why it shows {$900.00} ( my original credit limit ) available as the current available credit amount on their website in some places and {$0.00} available credit in others. The representative who was being addressed as Sir and addressing me as Sir ( I did not get his name ) told me the account was closed on XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX  days ago ) after XXXX  months of no usage. I asked him why I wasn't notified that this account was being closed. His answer was that I was notified through a letter sent via XXXX without specifying the date the letter was sent. I told him I never received a letter and he let me know that it is not the company 's fault if the letter was lost in the mail ( I did not suggest this, I simply said I did not receive this notice ) and that it is my fault for not using the card for so long that the account was closed. I asked why I could not see that letter in the online system and was told his system showed the letter was sent via XXXX even though I was enrolled in Paperless, so it wasn't in the online system. I told him I was seeing multiple amounts on the website for current credit limit and that I was trying to make a purchase on the website. His only response to the available balances not matching on their website in different spots, multiple times, was that the account was closed by the bank and there's nothing they could do about that. He would not address the reason it still showed the {$900.00} still available in some places and repeated that it was not their fault if it was lost in the mail or some other reason I did not receive the notice, but they did send it out. I never received any notice that my account was being closed and I have had this account open with XXXX ( clothing store ) since XXXX. They filed XXXX  in XX/XX/XXXX, but the store in my city is still open. They did not close all of their stores nor go completely out of business. I told the representative that I know I have XXXX or XXXX  days to dispute this issue online or by writing a letter and he rudely provided me with the company 's mailing address. Things I found online suggested to file a complaint here for quicker and more accurate resolution. Since I did already contact the company via telephone call regarding this issue, I am filing this complaint. I expect my original account to be reopened so I can continue to make purchases there, wasn't notified that it was being closed, it affects my credit history length, and their systems don't apparently match since XXXX page shows {$900.00} credit available and another page shows {$0.00}. Their systems have had payment/balance issues in the past which is XXXX reason I started to just use my debit card in their stores, so this doesn't surprise me. If this isn't properly and fairly resolved with the original account re-opened, I will just stop giving the retailer my money.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Billing problem
Consumer complaint narrative: I have two loans with two different banks, XXXX XXXX  and BMO, both for recreational vehicles. Each loan is a fixed rate loan charged a daily interest rate. My monthly payments for each are distributed between principle and interest each month and I am completely aware that interest will be higher than the principle contributions. My issue is specifically on how they apply payments made in excess of what is owed as the minimum payment. Example ; fixed rate loan is 7.49 % with a monthly payment of {$560.00}. With exception of maybe 1 or 2 months, each month I have made payments in excess of that minimum amount. The idea was to have those applied to principle however that is not how they are applying payments. They are taking the excess monies and applying it to interest charges and then reducing the minimum payment amount for the following month by the overage amount that was applied to the interest charge. They are not applying this to principle. This practice seems incredibly unfair. They are taking my money which would allow for me to reduce the principle balance and instead applying to what I would XXXX future interest owned. They are applying it to their own interest income and changing me interest on a higher principle balance that I paid extra to reduce. After speaking to both companies, I was told that I have to actually go online, call, mail in or go into a branch to be sure that my additional payments are being allocated to principle. In fact, the BMO representative read me their internal policy or talking points and it said, excess payments were to be applied to principle but he assured me that that does not happen. If I am making my required minimum payment and then additional funds are received at the exact same time, why are they not applying those funds to benefit the consumer vs. themselves. This feels like a very unfair practice and almost deceptive. In order for clients to understand that what they intended to be principle contributions are not actually being applied, they would have to review their statements AND call the bank to understand why their payments are reflecting either a lower or no payment amount. I was told by the representative that even if I requested a reallocation of funds to be applied to principle vs. interest that in his experience, these are denied. He said it would be unsuccessful but did offer to submit it. This does not seem like a process that benefits the consumer at all and lines the pockets of the bank instead. I have two loans that this has happened to me on. Please review for unfair and deceptive practices.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am writing to bring to your attention a serious matter concerning the unprofessional behavior I have experienced with my credit card provider, CitiBank. As a long-time customer for over seven years, I am deeply disappointed by the level of service I have encountered, particularly regarding a recent dispute I had with a merchant. 

On XX/XX/2024, I made a purchase through XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX website for a pair of sneakers. After waiting several days for my order, I discovered that it had been canceled without my knowledge, and I was never issued a refund. After trying to resolve the issue directly with Citibank for nearly two months, I learned that they had closed the case in favor of the merchant, despite my clear evidence that my order was canceled. 

CitiBank allegedly sent a notice regarding this decision through the app 's notice section ; however, I never received any such notification. Additionally, I submitted all proof demonstrating that the order was indeed canceled and that I was entitled to a refund. Despite this, CitiBanks dispute department failed to take my side or handle the situation appropriately, siding instead with the merchant.

I have uncovered issues with CitiBanks dispute handling that extend beyond my individual case ; many other customers have voiced similar complaints concerning their disputes with merchants. This pattern of unprofessionalism and poor service is unacceptable. The dispute department appears to lack the necessary competence and commitment to fairly resolve customer issues. 

I am requesting the CFPB 's assistance in addressing this matter. It is crucial that consumers are treated with respect and that credit card companies like CitiBank are held accountable for their actions. We deserve a banking experience that prioritizes customer service and transparency. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious concern. I look forward to your response and any actions you can take to improve the situation for myself and other consumers facing similar challenges. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX Email : XXXX Date : XX/XX/year>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Subject : Notice of Dispute and Request for Debt Validation** Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my formal Notice of Dispute regarding the alleged medical debt associated with the above-referenced account number. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting full validation of this debt. Additionally, as this concerns a medical debt, I expect your strict compliance with all applicable federal and state laws, including but not limited to the No Surprises Act and recent Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidance on medical debt reporting.

Please be advised that I do not acknowledge or admit responsibility for this alleged debt. I am exercising my rights under the FDCPA and request that you provide the following documentation to validate the debt : Proof of the original medical service agreement : A copy of the signed agreement or authorization for treatment that demonstrates I am obligated to pay this debt. 
Itemized billing statement : A detailed breakdown of the medical debt, including the charges for each service, adjustments, payments made, and any outstanding balance. 
Proof of assignment or ownership : Documentation showing that XXXX has the legal right to collect this debt, including the chain of custody if the debt was sold or transferred. 
Verification of compliance : Proof that this debt complies with state and federal statutes, including those related to billing practices for XXXX XXXX. 
Until the requested information is provided, I request that you immediately cease all collection activities related to this account, including communication with me, and stop reporting this alleged debt to any credit reporting agencies. 

You have 30 days from the date of receipt of this letter to respond with the requested documentation. If you can not validate this debt, you must cease all collection efforts and remove any negative information related to this account from my consumer reports. 

This letter is not an admission of liability for this debt and does not authorize any further collection activity. All correspondence regarding this matter must be in writing and sent to the address listed above or via email at XXXX. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Heres the revised version incorporating the new information : I am writing to formally request assistance in resolving an issue regarding a collections account erroneously placed on my credit report by Wakefield & Associates. The account in question pertains to a debt allegedly owed to The XXXX XXXX XXXX, initiated by Choice Recovery and subsequently placed by Wakefield & Associates on XX/XX/XXXX, in the amount of {$950.00}. 

To provide context, The XXXX XXXX XXXX initially engaged Choice Recovery for collection efforts on XX/XX/XXXX, regarding an instrument return. Following disputes with XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, the debt was resolved, and I was issued a zero balance receipt in XXXX. As a result, the collection account was removed from my credit report on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Despite this resolution, Wakefield & Associates reported a similar debt in XXXX, requesting documentation I had already provided during the initial disputes in XXXX. Moreover, The XXXX XXXX XXXX generated and provided an invoice to Wakefield & Associates in XXXX XXXX after the collection account was placed on my credit report in XXXX. This invoice was never shared with me prior, and I was not notified of any additional fees or balances owed after receiving the zero balance receipt in XXXX. 

Per the attached evidence, the sudden re-reporting of this alleged debt and the creation of a new invoice years later raise serious concerns about the accuracy and legitimacy of this claim. It is unreasonable for Wakefield & Associates to request re-submission of information I provided years ago to resolve this matter.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Overcharged for something you did purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX. I joined XXXX others for a trip to XXXX, XXXX. We had prearranged transportation but for the return trip to the airport the transfer did not show up so we asked the doorman at XXXX XXXX XXXX to call a cab. He asked would it be cash or credit. WE said credit. 
Once we got in the taxi, I gave the driver my XXXXXXXX XXXX He swiped it several times and said the card reader was not working. I gave him my Citi card and he said the same thing. So, we gave him cash, which was between {$25.00} and {$45.00}. Rushing to get to the airport I did not get a receipt for the cash. While at the airport I got a call from XXXX that they noticed suspicious activity on the card. I explained what happened they was told they would back me when I filed a dispute. I never heard from Citi. 
When I returned home, some days later i discovered that the drive had indeed charged {$450.00} to XXXX and more than {$500.00} to Citi! I disputed both. I have not any acceptable resolution. XXXX accepted an XXXX for my signature XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ) so I would never use an XXXX Citi never produced any proof but unbelievably is taking the side of the taxi co. A luxury XXXX XXXX might be {$96.00} or so dollars to how can I get charged on two different cards for more than {$1000.00} for a ride to the airport? That's is fraudulent use of my card and theft by deception. I had always believed and was told that in such cases a credit card company would back you. they don't. A Citi rep even told me it was on me because " you did give him the card and you did get a ride to the airport. '' which makes no sense and is insulting at best. ( listen to the calls, they're recorded. ) I have explained what happened over and over ( you never get the same person twice. ) In both cases I was told it would be turned over to fraud and it never is. When I call the check I find out that the person never did what they said they were going to do in elevating this to fraud and deception. Citi has been especially bad. They never called to even report suspicious activity. nothing stood out for a {$500.00} plus taxi ride?? Seriously? I have even suggested they credit companies talk to each other and see where it clearly does not make sense. Citi said they don't do that and one rep even said nothing could be done basically because it was in XXXX, but Cit is a global firm, so that doesn't make sense. I have a Citi Costco Executive Card.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Midland Credit Management INC, I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute the collection/closee account listed on my credit report. I am not liable for this Debt of {$980.00} with CAPIO PARTNERS I did not sign a contract with CAPIO PARTNERS and I didnt receive Verification of the debt via the original Contract Account number : unknown i was listed as an authorized user to an account belonging to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I notice discrepancies in the personal information section, which I believe is inaccurate. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am entitled to accurate and verifiable information on my credit report. I am requesting that this collection account be investigated and removed if it is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable. Disputed Account Details : Collection Agency Name : CAPIO PARTNERS Date of entry : XX/XX/year> Reason for Dispute : XXXX. I have not been afforded the opportunity to dispute the account in accordance with 12CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( ). This denial of the dispute process deprives me of my right to challenge any inaccuracies or discrepancies regarding the alleged debt. 2. CAPIO PARTNERS has resorted to false, misleading, and deceptive means in their collection efforts, thereby violating my consumer rights. Such unethical practices undermine the integrity of the debt collection process and cause undue distress to consumers. 3. Furthermore, the agency lacks the authority to furnish any account to consumer reporting agencies without adhering to the necessary disclosures mandated by law. By neglecting to fulfil their obligations under 12 CER 1006.34 ( d ) and 15 USC 1681-S 2 ( 7 ) ( A ). CAPIO PARTNERS is flagrantly disregarding consumer protection statutes. I demand that CFPB investigate these egregious Legal Basis for Dispute : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. The credit bureau is required to investigate the disputed information and ensure that it is accurate and verifiable. If the information can not be verified, it must be removed from my credit report. 2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Under Section 809 of the FDCPA, I am entitled to verification of the debt from the collection agency. If the collection agency can not provide proper verification or validation of the debt, it must cease collection efforts and remove the account from my credit report. Request for Action : I request that you investigate this matter and provide me with the results of your investigation. If the collection account is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable, I ask that it be removed from my credit report. Please provide me with written confirmation once the correction has been made. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within the timeframe required by law.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint because several accounts listed on my credit report involve unverified or inaccurate information. Despite sending certified mail to request validation of these debts, I have not received a proper response. These actions violate my rights under federal laws, including 15 U.S.C. 1681b, 15 U.S.C. 6802, and 12 U.S.C. 6802, which regulate the proper handling of consumer information and debt collection practices. 

Below are the accounts and specific issues : The Guarantors ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : Balance : {$2200.00} Issue : On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified debt validation request ( USPS Tracking # XXXX ), which was delivered between XX/XX/XXXX. I have not received a response. The collection agency has failed to prove ownership of the debt or provide supporting documentation, violating my rights under the FDCPA and FCRA. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Balance : {$1200.00} Issue : I do not recognize this debt nor the collection agency managing it. Despite sending a certified validation request, I have received no response. This lack of response and continued reporting violates 15 U.S.C. 1681b regarding permissible purposes for sharing consumer information. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Balance : {$260.00} Issue : I do not recognize this account, which has been inaccurately marked under " fraud. '' I sent a certified debt validation request on XX/XX/XXXX, but the collection agency has not provided any documentation or proof of this debt. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Balance : {$1000.00} Issue : This account has been reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX without proper validation. Despite a certified mail request sent on XX/XX/XXXX, no response or documentation has been provided. This violates 12 U.S.C. 6802, which governs the sharing of consumer financial information without proper consent or verification. 
XXXX XXXX : Balance : {$2300.00} Issue : The original creditor is reporting this debt as charged off. However, I have no knowledge of this account. My certified mail request for validation has not been answered. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$0.00} ( Charged Off ) Issue : This account has been sold to another lender, yet I have received no information about the new creditor. This creates an incomplete and unverifiable record on my credit report, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681b. 
Violations of Federal Laws Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Collection agencies are continuing to report and pursue debts without validating their claims, in violation of my rights under the FDCPA. 
Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Information has been shared with collection agencies without proper validation or permissible purpose.

Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) 12 U.S.C. 6802 : My financial information has been shared without my knowledge or consent, violating federal privacy protections. 



On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified mail request for validation to the collection agency handling this account. The USPS tracking number for this request is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and it was confirmed delivered between XX/XX/XXXX. 

To date, I have not received a response or documentation validating this debt. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), this failure to validate violates my consumer rights. I respectfully request that this account be removed immediately from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I made a payment of {$1400.00} through XXXXXXXX XXXX  to reduce my Macys credit card balance. The payment was successfully processed, and I enrolled in autopay to pay off the remaining balance by the end of the month. 

On XX/XX/year>, Macys incorrectly charged my account {$2600.00} instead of the expected {$1200.00}, which caused my XXXX Bank account to overdraft. I immediately contacted Macys customer service to report the issue and request a correction, but despite several attempts, the issue was not resolved. 

Frustrated with the lack of resolution, I filed a dispute with XXXX XXXX  for the {$1400.00} payment, as I was uncertain how the funds were being applied. After XXXX resolved the dispute in my favor, Macys reposted the {$1400.00} as a balance owed on my account and subsequently closed my credit account without providing a proper explanation. 

This account closure negatively impacted my credit score. I have all the necessary documentation, including proof of the original {$1400.00} payment, the overdraft caused by Macys error, and communication attempts with Macys customer service.

I am requesting that Macys : Clear the reposted {$1400.00} balance. 
Reverse the account closure and correct its impact on my credit report. 
Provide an explanation and formal acknowledgment of their error. 
I would appreciate a prompt resolution to this matter.

Sub-issue: An existing modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or other loss mitigation relief
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against JPMorgan Chase and XXXX XXXX XXXX for their handling of my mortgage assistance application and subsequent predatory practices. 
My husband and I were owners of a business that was severely impacted by the pandemic. While we faced financial struggles as a result, we were not financially irresponsible. We submitted an application for mortgage assistance and forbearance to JPMorgan Chase, both via email and by personally delivering it to the bank. Despite this, JPMorgan Chase failed to review, process, or even acknowledge the application. This neglect is particularly concerning given that the bank was aware we were considering filing for bankruptcy due to our circumstances. 
Instead of fulfilling their legal obligation to review and respond to our application, JPMorgan Chase sold our mortgage to XXXX XXXX XXXX, a company with predatory practices. This sale appears to have been conducted in bad faith, allowing JPMorgan Chase to profit while avoiding their responsibilities under the law. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, in turn, charged us daily interest on the loan for the duration of the forbearance period without proper disclosure. We were not notified of these interest charges until after we sold our home. This lack of transparency and the financial burden it created exacerbated the challenges we were already facing, forcing us further into financial distress. 
Both JPMorgan Chase and XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to meet their legal and ethical obligations : Failure to Process Application : JPMorgan Chase was obligated to review and either approve or deny our application for forbearance. Their neglect to do so constitutes a breach of their responsibilities. 
Lack of Disclosure by XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to notify us of daily interest charges during the forbearance period, a violation of transparency requirements and consumer protection standards. 
Predatory Practices : The deliberate sale of our mortgage to XXXX XXXX XXXX appears to have been a calculated effort by JPMorgan Chase to profit at our expense, transferring us to a lender known for exploitative practices. 
The hardship of navigating bankruptcy, compounded by these actions, has caused significant financial and emotional distress. Both institutions leveraged legal loopholes to exploit our situation, underscoring the urgent need for stronger consumer protections for individuals in financial crisis. 
I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and hold both JPMorgan Chase and XXXX XXXX XXXX accountable for their actions. Specifically, I urge the Bureau to : Determine whether JPMorgan Chase violated its obligations in failing to process our application. 
Investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX for its lack of transparency and predatory interest-charging practices. 
Enforce penalties and require restitution for the financial harm caused by these actions. 
Additionally, both lenders now refuse to close my accounts after our home has sold and the loan ( s ) paid off. Chase still says they hold the loan even though XXXX is the loan servicer. 
Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX. Complaint I am filing this complaint against Midland Credit Management for failing to comply with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) in their attempt to collect an alleged debt. Specifically, the company sent a collection notice via XXXX, which is not a proper method for such communication under the FDCPA, as it does not provide the required tracking and acknowledgment of receipt. This action violates the standards of legal communication for debt collection and has caused confusion and concern regarding their practices. 

XXXX. Detailed Description of the Issue Timeline of Events : On XX/XX/year>, Midland Credit Management sent me a collection notice via XXXX to my address at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Texas XXXX. 
This notice failed to meet the legal standards required under the FDCPA, as it was not sent via certified mail with return receipt, a method that ensures proper tracking and acknowledgment of receipt. 
I wrote a formal dispute letter on XX/XX/year>, requesting debt validation and compliance with federal law. This letter will be sent via certified mail with return receipt on XX/XX/year> to ensure proper delivery and tracking. 
Failure to Validate the Debt : Midland Credit Management has not provided sufficient validation of the alleged debt as required under 15 U.S. Code 1692g. I dispute this debt and demand full compliance with the law before any collection activity resumes. 
Improper Communication Method : The use of XXXX  for delivering important legal communication circumvents proper procedure and does not ensure that I, as the consumer, can adequately track or confirm receipt of such notices. 

XXXX. Supporting Documentation I will upload the following documentation : A copy of the dispute letter I wrote on XX/XX/year>, which will be sent to Midland Credit Management on XX/XX/year> via certified mail with return receipt. 
A copy of the XXXX  delivery confirmation showing the improper method of delivery used by Midland Credit Management.

Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
Wells Fargo placed my account in a trial period starting on XX/XX/year>. The deadline for the first payment is XX/XX/year>. I was informed that if the payment setup was not suitable for me, I could decline the trial period and apply for a second review of a home preservation program to avoid foreclosure. 

I called Wells Fargo on XX/XX/year> ; XX/XX/year> ; XX/XX/year> ; XX/XX/year> ; XX/XX/year> ; and XX/XX/year>, to discuss my home preservation plan and explore better options between accepting the trial plan or making a lump sum payment to reduce my overdue balance so that I could have a manageable payment plan when I requested a second review of my home preservation program. 

On XX/XX/year>, during one of my calls to discuss these options, I was treated rudely by XXXX XXXX, a representative from Wells Fargo, who refused to verify her identity when I asked for her name and she insisted on having my Social Security number. I informed her that if she was going to be difficult, she could transfer me to a supervisor who would assist me. XXXX XXXX refused to verify her name because XXXX XXXX heard her correctly initially and said she would be happy to pass me along to a supervisor. Instead, she placed me back into the queue, where I waited for XXXX hour and XXXX minutes listening to an automated voice. 

I called back and spoke to XXXX XXXX, who spent almost XXXX hours with me. He informed me that XXXX XXXX XXXX, a representative from Wells Fargos executive office, would contact me with first-class service the day after Veterans Day on Tuesday, XX/XX/year>. XXXX XXXX asked what time would be best for her to call, and I replied that between XXXX and XXXX PM would be ideal. He assured me that XXXX XXXX would call at that time to discuss my home preservation plans so we could resolve the matter before XX/XX/XXXX. 

However, on XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX not only did not call me back to discuss my home preservation plans, but when I called back on XX/XX/XXXX, I was set up for another call with someone from the XXXX office to reach out after XXXX PM on XX/XX/year>, and again on XX/XX/year>, and XX/XX/year>. 

Each time, Wells Fargo failed to honor the callback, and I had to call back repeatedly to find out why and set up another appointment with no success. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX PM, I spoke to XXXX XXXX, another representative. I explained that I had been informed by previous representatives that I could schedule a callback from the XXXX office at a convenient time that worked around my job hours, so I wouldnt get in trouble with my boss while discussing my mortgage during work hours. XXXX XXXX told me that Wells Fargo does not call customers back at the costumers convenience. He insisted that Wells Fargo calls customers on Wellsfargo 's own schedule and that they had received my complaints and would review my situation, getting back to me in XXXX  days from XX/XX/XXXX. I told XXXX XXXX that it had been over XXXX working days since I requested to speak with Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX about this issue and that this was unacceptable, especially since my mortgage account is about to be jeopardized by XX/XX/XXXX due to mishandling by Wells Fargo. 

XXXX XXXX did not seem to care and continued to say that Wells Fargo would review my escalation and get back to me in 10 days, reiterating that they do not call customers back at their convenience. 

I would appreciate assistance from the XXXX office before my trial period expires on XX/XX/year>, so I can be better informed about which direction to take regarding my mortgagewhether to make the first trial period payment before it expires or to decline for a second review to avoid going into foreclosure. 

Regards, XXXX

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Capital One due to their refusal to recognize my Durable Power of Attorney ( DPOA ), violations of federal law, misrepresentation regarding account ownership, unjust enrichment, and lack of disclosure in financial dealings. Capital One has failed to address multiple lawful demands, and I request immediate intervention to protect my rights and enforce compliance and reopen closed accounts. 

Key Issues Refusal to Accept Durable Power of Attorney ( DPOA ) : Capital One has sent me correspondence stating they do not or can not accept my legally binding DPOA. This refusal directly violates federal and state laws regarding recognition of legal documents, including but not limited to : UCC 3-306 : Right of a claimant to enforce interests in negotiable instruments. 
XXXX v. Agnitsch, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. 1978 ) : Enforceability of actions taken under XXXX. 
I am not requesting ; I am demanding that my legal document be recognized as valid. 

Failure to Reopen Accounts and Use Principals Interest to Offset Debts : As the Principal, it is my legal right to have my accounts reopened. The principals promissory note ( collateral security ) created the account, and the bank is using this as an asset on its books. This constitutes misrepresentation when labeling the Principal as a borrower, as banks are not authorized to lend their own credit. 

XXXX v. Market XXXX. Bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Contracts beyond a corporations power are unlawful and void. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX : Corporations have no authority to lend credit. 
Capital One is unjustly enriching itself from my financial instrument while refusing to reopen my accounts. 

Unjust Enrichment and Proceeds of Securitization : I hereby claim all proceeds derived from the securitization of my promissory note. Capital Ones practice of bundling and selling securities for profit without disclosing this activity constitutes fraud and violates : Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : Requires clear and conspicuous disclosure of material terms.

UCC Article 9-203 : Enforceability of security interests and proceeds derived therefrom. 
As the creator of the promissory note, I am the grantor and registered owner. I demand my rights be upheld. 

Violation of 12 U.S.C. 411 Lawful Money : Capital One must accept payments in lawful money as defined under 12 U.S.C. 411. The failure to disclose how the application serves as collateral security is a breach of federal law. 

Lack of Disclosure and Proof of Delegation Authority : Capital One has failed to disclose the monetization process of my note and to provide proof of delegation authority to impose liabilities on the Principal. This lack of disclosure violates : 15 U.S.C. 1639 ( TILA ) : Requirement for accurate disclosure of credit terms.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against WAKEFIELD & ASSOCIATES and their Agents XXXX ( Client Success Representative ) and XXXX XXXX ( Collection Specialist ) for violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ( HIPAA ), as well as provisions under the HITECH Act.

The debt collector has failed to provide the required documentation to validate the debt in question. Specifically, I have requested the following information, which has not been provided : Validation of Debt : Proof that I am the correct party being asked to pay the debt.

Details of the Alleged Debt : Information about the medical service ( s ), including the date of service and the name of the patient.

Proof of Contractual Obligation : Documentation proving my legal responsibility to pay this debt.

Authority to Collect : Copies of any agreements with the creditor granting the debt collector authority to collect the alleged debt, or proof of acquisition by purchase or assignment.

HIPAA Compliance : Documentation that supports the disclosure of medical records under HIPAA.

Security Provisions Compliance : Documentation demonstrating compliance with the breach of security provisions of Subtitle D of the ARRA and provisions related to health information security ( HITECH Act ).

Additionally, I have requested that the debt collector cease and desist any further collection activities, including reporting or verifying the debt on my credit reports. I have specified a ten-day period for compliance with these requests.

Despite these requests, the debt collector has failed to provide the necessary documentation or cease collection activities, which is in direct violation of the FDCPA, FCRA, and HIPAA. As a result of these violations, I have suffered potential harm to my credit, privacy, and peace of mind.

Consumer complaint narrative: As a federally protected consumer I'm seeking proof of the alleged debt, under the doctrine of estoppel by silence, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I may presume that no proof of the alleged debt, nor therefore any such debt, in fact exists. In a good faith effort to resolve this matter amicably, I demand for proof of the debt, specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature in wet ink, as well as proof of your authority in this matter. Absent such proof, you must terminate this collection action and correct any erroneous reports of this debt as mine. For the record, I state again that as I have no account with you, nor am I your customer, nor have I entered into a contract with you, I must ask for the following information : 1 ) Please evidence your authorization under 15 USC 1692 ( e ) 15 USC 1692 ( f ) and USC 1692 ( g ) in this alleged matter. 2 ) What is your authorization of law for your collection of information? 3 ) What is your authorization of law for your collection of this alleged debt? 4 ) Please evidence your authorization to do business or operate in the state. 5 ) Please provide proof of the alleged debt, including specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my wet signature. You have 7 days of this notice to respond. Your failure to respond, on point, in writing, hand signed, and in a timely manner, will work as a waiver to any and all of your claims in this matter, and will entitle me to presume that you sent your letter ( XXXX ) in error, and that this matter is permanently closed. Your continued silence is unacceptable. Either provide the proof or correct the record to remove the invalid debt from my credit files with the three-primary credit-reporting agencies. You are currently in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and the Fair Debt Collection Act. I can't obtain housing or employment due to the violations on my credit file. Failure to respond within 7 days of this letter will begin my small claims action against your company. I will be seeking { {$5000.00} } in damages for the following : 1 ) Defamation 2 ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3 ) Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act After obtaining the judgment against your company, I will obtain a Writ of Execution from the Sheriffs office in your county and I will begin the process of attaching property or funds to satisfy the judgment. For the purposes of 15 USC 1692 et seq., this Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity of the alleged debt and a dispute to the validity of your claims. This Notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status. The Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) will be notified regarding this alleged debt.

- According to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ), once an account is charged off, it is classified as a loss, and the creditor acknowledges that it no longer expects to collect the outstanding debt. 
I DEMAND MY COPY OF THE 1099 C AS WELL AS THE RELEASE OF ELECTRONIC TITLE LIEN, WITHIN XXXX BUSINESS DAYS. 

Legal Basis for Demand - Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) XXXX : Requires lienholders to release their lien upon discharge of the debt. - Georgia Code XXXX : Mandates prompt release of liens to facilitate clear title issuance I will be Requesting for Investigation with the CFPB AND THE IRS FOR THESE Relevant Laws and Codes XXXX. Internal Revenue Code XXXX : Creditors are required to issue Form 1099-C to the debtor and the IRS when a debt of {$600.00} or more is discharged. This regulation includes instances where a debt is charged off as a loss. 

XXXX. Treasury Regulation XXXX : Details the conditions under which creditors are obligated to issue Form 1099-C, including charge-offs, settlements, or other recognitions of debt cancellation. 

XXXX. IRS Instructions for Form 1099-C : Clearly state that creditors who fail to issue the form may be subject to penalties under XXXX XXXX for failure to file correct information returns with the IRS and XXXX XXXX for failure to furnish correct payee statements

I HAVE ASKED PORFOLIO RECOVERY TO SHOW PROOF OF THE PURCHASE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THEM AND THE ORIGNAL CREDITOR THEY SENT STATEMENT TRANSACTIONS WHICH IS NOT A PURCHASE AGREEMENT ALSO ITS REPORTING AS A CHARGE OFF PER THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE A CHARGE OFF IS CONSIDERED INCOME AND INCOME CAN NOT BE REPORTED AND A CONSUMER REPORT IF IT IS A CHARGE OFF WHY HAVE I NOT received A 1099C cancellation OF DEBT LAST THING THE DATES OPEN ARE ALL different which is inaccurate information being reported I am writing to formally dispute the charge-off account reported by [ Creditor 's Name ] under my name, account number [ Account Number ]. This correspondence serves as a notice of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

I would like to bring to your attention that, under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), consumers have the right to dispute any information in their credit report that they believe is inaccurate or incomplete. I believe that the charge-off designation on my account is misleading and improperly represented for the following reasons : 1. IRS Conclusions on Charge-Offs : The Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) has concluded that a charge-off can be considered income to a debtor under certain circumstances. However, this should be reported accurately through a Form 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) if applicable. To date, I have not received a 1099-C concerning this debt, which calls into question the legitimacy of the charge-off being reported. As such, it should not be treated as a completed transaction as it lacks adequate documentation. 

2. Reporting of Late Payments : The Fair Credit Reporting Act requires that all information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate and reflect the true payment history. If [ Creditor 's Name ] has reported late payments leading up to the charge-off, I demand verification of these claims. If accurate payment history exists, it should not have been misrepresented as an accumulation of late payments leading to a charge-off. 

3. FDCPA Compliance : Furthermore, I would like to assert my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ). If [ Creditor 's Name ] or any collection agency that reports on this account has failed to provide adequate validation of the debt when requested, this can be deemed a violation of my rights under the FDCPA as well. 

Given these points, I request a detailed investigation into this matter. I ask that you provide documentation of the charge-off, proof that a 1099-C has been issued to the IRS, and verification of any late payments or outstanding balances. If you can not provide such documentation, I request that you immediately correct the reporting of this account with the credit bureaus.

Per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ), your failure to provide accurate and complete disclosure of all necessary information prior to furnishing details to consumer reporting agencies further substantiates the illegal practices you are engaged in. 

P.s. My NEXT letter will be a notification of my LOITS! So that you do not need for a legal dictionary, a LOITS notice is a Letter Of Intent To Suit! You BEST be PROVEN COMPLIANT to ALL requirements and standards of FCRA COMPLIANCE and also of the implemented CRSA enacted CDIA implemented Metro 2 Compliance mandates as well. I will demand verification that each employee at your firm which MIGHT have seen or conducted any business on the file you allege mine has been properly trained by a certified and qualified instructor of the Metro 2 data field formatted reporting standards. I am NOT shy in detailing my DOUBTS you can withstand the requisites to survive a court hearing versus me as I leverage your DEFICIENCIES for a slew of victories being awarded a minimum of {$1000.00} PER VIOLATION PER TIME, and there certainly appears to be a bucket full. So, lets do this! Anything OTHER than your letter describing to me that you have already begun or completed the annulment of these unproven claims versus me and have eradicated ENTIRELY any and all aspects of records of what you allege being mine ( yeah! ) will IMMEDIATE compel me to assume your hostile to my demands of proper reporting and I will assume that your ignorance of appropriate and adequate duties are willful and intentionally injurious. Being such, civil suits are obvious however criminal charges are not out the question, particularly if your chicanery-led subterfuge brings forth or allows.

The options didnt really didnt fit but I DONT FEEL I OWE THE DEBT. I purchased an XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX. For over 20 years weve always had an upgrade contract where we could replace & upgrade our phones in 18-24 months. ALWAYS!! Under my deceased husbands name then mine. When I purchased this phone I went straight home, plugged it in & it showed liquid in the charging port error & wouldnt charge. I went right back to the store, they couldnt duplicate the problem so they said it must be my cord. I bought a new cord. Periodically I had that issue. Ive had nothing but problems with this phone. I bought the extended warranty on the phone, I cant use the speaker because people cant understand me, it cuts out, XXXX support test trouble, I took it to the XXXX XXXX, they supposedly repaired it, left the store & it did the same thing. I was having XXXX  XXXX I needed my phone so I went back in and spoke with a supervisor, they tested it and claimed it was a provider problem. I went to the XXXX XXXX XXXX store & they laughed. After a XXXX hour XXXX where I had little use of my phone because of limited motion we tried again to get it fixed, still under warranty & with an extended warranty and since they dont test trouble they wont fix it even though they hear it. Not only that my calls have always cut off, Ive had charging issues, calls cut off, and trouble with getting the touch pad!! This was a bad phone from day 1 and if they would have exchanged it when I took it back an hour after I bought it I would have a reliable phone. So, I thought Ill stick it out until I can replace it when my upgrade period is in effect. WRONG. The representative that did my contract did not do what I asked for and did not give me the upgrade option for the first time since Ive had AT & T cell service. I think that is their fault because they should have replaced the obvious defective phone when I took it back & written the contract the way I requested. I will continue to dispute this because I still dont have a reliable phone, Im an almost XXXX year old XXXX woman that I feel they took advantage off and I think they gave me a defective phone to get it out of their inventory! 
Once this negative remark hit my credit report, one of my credit card companies lowered my credit limit on XXXX of my cards even though I pay them and all of my cards much more than the minimum monthly payments.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> there was a charge of {$110.00} charged to my Barclaycard Credit Card. The charge was placed on a card that Barclaycard had already told me that they cancelled in early XX/XX/year>. Barclaycard added an unknown and unauthorized user to my account. They did not notify me that they did this, even my contact email address was changed inside of my account when I went to access my account in early XXXX. I have gone over this again and again with Barclaycard representatives and they are now ignoring my request for proof, I have asked for the voice records from early XXXX where the representative told me that they were cancelling the card in question and issuing me a new card. This was due to suspicious activity on my card and a month prior to the fraudulent charge at a XXXX in Kansas by a XXXX XXXX, an unknown person to me, an unauthorized person. My data was leaked in a data breach earlier this year by a health care company and apparently my sensitive information is now on the dark web as this is the only place that someone could have gained access to it. 

I have also requested any voice records where someone may have impersonated me, and or the computer IP address from where such information was entered to gain access to my credit card. Barclaycard never contacted me to ask for permission to add someone to my card, they never contacted me that they had added a complete stranger to my credit card account. I have made numerous calls to address this and they keep ignoring the fact that they cancelled the card in early XXXX and issued me a new card and added a complete stranger to my account without ever notifying me. This is complete negligence in security and has caused me hours of my time trying to reason with incompetent employees from Barclaycard. They have sent me notices that they will have a manager call me within 48 hours and no manager has called. They sometimes tell me that they have called, but not one caller Id number on my phone says Barclaycard, and they have never left a message to notify me that they called, so that I can call them back. 

I pay my card in full each month, I have disputed the charge and told them that I am not paying for this fraudulent charge nor any of the interest they are now accruing on my account due to this fraudulent charge. This has affected my credit score and has caused me an enormous amount of time, yet they are not providing any resolution.

I have been on a payment plan with Tenaglia and Hunt for over 3 yrs. Suddenly, there was an issue w my bank or the payments back in XXXX and Tenaglia and Hunt stopped taking money for the arrangement. 

Since then, nobody at the debt collector/ law firm, has attempted to contact me to let me know there was an issue on my account to allow me to rectify the issue. 

I suddenly received a letter stating Im being sued for the debt without any prior notice nor notification. I have been calling and calling and calling leaving messages asking for someone to call me back to rectify the issue and nobody has called me back. 

I spoke to someone today who told me dont you notice the extra {$200.00} in your account every month or what?! The firm has a bad reputation for taking people to court and no notice and garnishing wages without due process and this is happening to me and I am asking for help! 

Please let know what else is needed to rectify this issue and ensure that Tenaglia and Hunt are handled properly because they are violating so many laws!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Credit Bureaus reported inaccurate information in violation of due process as outlined in the statute below. Credit Bureaus reported late payments and I have never been late on any payments.

15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) ( b ) ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

( b ) Grace period If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without incurring an additional finance charge, such additional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.

I transferred it from my Wells Fargo checking account to my new Wells Fargo savings account that I had just opened. Due to me owing money on my Wells Fargo credit card, they took the {$XXXX} towards it. Without my knowledge. They just took my money. That was money for my kids and I to survive on. The Federal Reserve XXXX prohibits banks from seizing funds to cover credit card debt. Only loans and mortgages fall under a bank 's right to offset. So I called the bank and asked them for my money back or is there anything I could do to where I can at least have some of it back. They said there was nothing. So I transferred the XXXX dollars I had left from my savings account into my checking account and closed my savings account. What they did was illegal.

Sub-issue: Changes in loan terms during or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, I received my closing disclosure that had all the final numbers that were approved by other departments. The loan amount was {$300000.00} and the total monthly payment was {$2100.00} and the closing costs were {$4700.00}. I agreed with these numbers and signed the disclosures and shortly after I received a call from Freedom Mortgage closing department and they were eager to set the appt for closing. During the call the lady informed me that we would be using a notary who would come to the house at XXXX XX/XX/year> to sign all the documents. After the date was set the lady from the closing department asked me to grab a pen and write down information about what figures I should expect for closing. She confirmed that the loan amount, rate, term and total monthly payment would be exactly what was on the disclosure I signed early that day ( same day XXXX ). Friday the XXXX of XXXX comes around and at XXXX the notary lady arrives and I welcome her into my home to sit and sign the documents. While she was getting to the final disclosure she made a point to remind us to review it to make sure nothing had changed since it has for her in the past. Immediately I noticed the loan amount had gone higher to {$300000.00} ( {$4500.00} difference ) and the mortgage payment had gone higher as well {$2400.00} ( {$350.00} difference ) and the closing costs was higher too! It had gone higher to {$9000.00} ( {$4300.00} difference ). Once I saw this I immediately called Freedom Mortgage and explained the difference I seen and the lady could not explain why the values had increased but she assumed it was because of a delinquent account somehow but I explained that we are at the table with the notary lady ready to close and that it would have been impossible for us to have gotten this far if we had any delinquencies associated with this account. She agreed but was unable to assist. She informed me to sign and we can figure it out later and I absolutely denied that action. I kindly asked the notary lady to leave our and we will figure out whats going on. After a few hours of hearing nothing back from Freedom Mortgage we received a call from XXXX in Closing Recovery who was very rude and deceptive. He said he called just to check in with me and congratulate our closing but I informed him we did not close and he immediately started to explain the difference in the loan amount vs what I was show and signed against what was presented at closing and he starting saying that it was because of my property tax and because we have a bill for {$4800.00} in taxes that they had to increase our escrow making my payment increase and that this was the only difference in the loan. First off, notice how he was just checking up on me but then immediately knows the issues that we are having and has all our records up on his computer, very deceiving. I explained that taxes were clearly included on the closing disclosure from the XXXX of XXXX, the last one I signed until closing. He said that it was human error on their side of things because they were calculating our taxes at less than {$1000.00} when in reality our taxes are {$4800.00}. To this I tried to plead our case, Freedom mortgage had made a mistake and it wasnt caught by the underwriting or loan officers or the escrow team and that we were presented numbers and was called and they confirmed their numbers for closing but on the day of closing everything changed and that we were not notified of any changes. XXXX admitted that they made a mistake, not only by not honoring what was presented to us by the loan department ( closing disclosure XXXX ) but also because they did not notify my by email like they should have to make sure that I was aware before closing. Instead they just sent a random lady into my house with higher numbers than what was promised/presented and expected us to just sign and not ask questions. All of this has been the worst experience in my life, I planned on closing the XXXX of XXXX and not having a payment for the months of XXXX and XXXX. Every day except for the weekends I called the freedom mortgage line and asked to speak to someone in hopes to figure out what is going to be done to get back on track and every time I was treated like absolute garbage. I was hung up on, I was yelled at, I was placed on hold while they spoke to each other to get the scoop on what the situation was, and I know this because every time I called in they asked me to verify my account and then they would immediately put me on hold and then after 5 minutes would come back on the line and say the exact same thing as XXXX, its the taxes. Every time I called in I asked to speak to a manager and every time I was told no one was available, they would take a message and have someone call me back but of course no one ever did. Im going on 3 weeks of dealing with this and still no one has called me back. To make matters worse, I received another closing disclosure after the closing fell through and it was even higher!!! How the XXXX does any of this make any sense!!! I feel deceived and no one should ever be treated the way I have been, but worse than all, no one should ever be told that their loan amount will be something and then on the day of closing have the numbers be completely different with out notice. I want something to be done about this, Freedom mortgage is a deceiving mortgage company that thinks they dont have to disclose any information until your sitting down at the closing table, I know thats not lawful. I know that they can not out right lie about what your loan amount will be, or change your taxes, or your closing costs at the last second! Someone needs to stand up to these corporate bullies, Im a XXXXXXXX XXXX  veteran that served for my country and I will not be treated like this.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is being sent to re-open my complaint ( Case XXXX ) with CFPB against Midland Credit Management . 

I have no relationship with Midland Credit Management. My account was sold to Midland Credit Management after being denied a payment negotiation with Citibank.

Since filing a complaint with CFPB, Midland Credit Management stated that they would put me on a payment plan under the conditions that I sign a contract. This happened XX/XX/year> I then made a counter claim through CFPB for {$1500.00} in XX/XX/year>. However, my case with CFPB was closed. In XX/XX/year>, I contacted Midland Credit Management and spoke with a paralegal and offered the {$1500.00} settlement to them directly. I was denied and told that I needed to pay over {$8000.00} to settle. 

In addition, Midland Credit Management has attempted to contact me without properly identifying themselves. Each time they have called, they have asked if they were speaking with me. My response has always been may I asked what you are calling in reference to, and they have always said it is a private matter. Midland Credit Management is trying to manipulate me into giving information so they can trap me into agreeing to pay something to them. They also have used intimidating language such as wage garnishment and they are cruel. 

I learned that if a consumer has a {$600.00} debt or more, the debt can be cancelled and used as income per 1099-c code, which is something I am willing to do. However, I was still denied. Now, I have to appear in court on XXXX. 

This year, I have a had a decrease in income. In addition, I no longer have housing. I have temporary housing. This debt is cumbersome and has added to my stress. I have been affected mentally and physically. 

If I am not able to get a fair settlement, I fear that my wages will be garnished or that I may have to file bankruptcy. 

How is this fair to a consumer with financial hardship?

Consumer complaint narrative:
Sir/Madam : RE : LoanCare Mortage Servicer for my FHA loan XX/XX/XXXX Loancare sends letter please contact " we would like to help you '' I called in. 

XX/XX/XXXX I submit Application for Mortgage Assistance XX/XX/XXXX We received your application letter - will review letter within XXXX business days from the date we received and let you know whether your application is complete. I then did not receive anything requesting any further information. I sent a pay stub with the application. Customer service states that my loan is in " protected status ''. 

XX/XX/XXXX Request for Mortgage Assistance Letter " withing the next 15 days, we will calculate the terms of your mortgage assitance offer and send you a document package with required paperwork. NOTHING HAS BEEN RECIEVED XX/XX/XXXX letter from collections department about availability of telephone conference to discuss your mortgage. ( Mind you, I have called in many times already and spoken with different CS agents assuring me that mortgage is in protected status ). 
I have also emailed XXXXLoancareXXXX, and no response. 

XX/XX/XXXX letter of NOTICE of Default and Right to cure on or before XX/XX/XXXX. Demanding {$8300.00} by XX/XX/XXXX. 

Today : XX/XX/XXXX - no response to application for mortgage assistance, no package or next steps necessary to save my home from foreclosure. 

I am behind XXXX {$2700.00}, XXXX {$2700.00}, XXXX {$2700.00}. I can pay XXXX payment on XX/XX/XXXX in full. 

I am writing in desperate need of help in trying to get mortgage assistance that has been offered as I am in default right now with this lender. This lender will Not accept partial payments on my mortgage monthly payments. I am currently 60 days late, and have applied for some mortgage assistance with them. They are stating that I only can have a COVID 19 Owner Occupant Loan modification ( but I have not received this paperwork to look at ). I qualified for this mortgage with a 3.25 % interest rate. And instead of offering me ( single mom/debt to income ratio high ) ; a payment deferral, or a repayment plan, that " allows you time to bring your mortgage current without having to make a single lump sum payment ''. They instead want me to restructure my loan which would cause me to fall even into a worse position with a higher interest rate. I think you should know that this loan servicer, LoanCare, immediately wants to inspect property when you are just 30 days late on your mortgage, they send someone out to your home. They refuse partial payments that could really help get money into the escrow account to at least cover insurance and interest. And that is disastrous. They state that if you send partial payments, that they will be sent back and your loan will be put into default ( where mine is ), and then finally foreclosure. 

And they say they appoint someone as your " mortgage resolution advocate '' - who never calls, emails or writes a letter to try to assist. I have not heard one word from XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  XXXX XXXX ). Instead I have received a Notice of Default since submitting my application for relief. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, they stated Next Steps : " We will begin processing your COVID XXXX Owner Occupant Loan Modification immediately and within approximately 15 days and you should expect to receive the offer and all of the instructions required to accept it. After 15 days from XX/XX/XXXX what I have received is a Notice of Default, and not a Owner Occupant Loan Modification. 

So, after wasting my time and having me fill out a mortgage assistance application and customer service reassuring me that the loan is in a protected status, they send a scary letter out instead telling me to cough up {$8300.00} and that I have the right to cure the default on or before XX/XX/XXXX. I will attempt to make my XXXX payment of {$2700.00} in whole on XX/XX/XXXX so I am not past 60 days late. But I could sure use an offer for deferred repayments right about now before come snatch my townhome from us. 

It does not seem like that is anything close to mortgage assistance. 

My reasons for falling behind are from huge home repairs that really should have been caught by the inspection when I bought the home. The plumbing upstairs was leaking in the wall of the second bath down to my dining room, and my furnace went out, then my car engine blew ( for a car that was paid off ) ; and I had to finance a vehicle which then added a {$500.00} payment monthly to my household. I am also under alot pressure for medical bills for my younger son and myself. I am heading into some medical testing ( biopsy procedure ) for potential XXXX. I got into a car accident in XXXX which also set me back. But the hardest thing began with my loan servicer LoanCare increasing my payment by almost {$300.00} due to what they say was an increase in the escrow homeowners insurance rates, from {$2400.00} to {$2700.00} ( roughly ). Neither the lender, nor XXXX XXXX XXXX, could even let me know that was going to happen. So, the home repairs, that increase and then also the mortgage insurance is $ XXXX. LoanCare tells me that they will not take the mortgage insurance off of the payment. I have friends that are telling me that it should have come off a year after my loan began? 

So either way they get my house, and if I default they get to have the home, and all while I pay a mortgage insurance that also guarantees money and property to them if I default and this pays them also? This does not make sense to me. 

I have documentation to prove all of these costs. The totalled car, the home repairs, the increase of house payment, and the mortgage insurance. Oh and my current car almost got repossessed in XXXX and that was what hindered me from making XXXX 's payment. 

There has to be a way to request a payment deferral with them, " Defer repayment of XXXX or more past due principal and interest payments as a non-interest bearing balance, which will be due and payable at the maturity of the mortgage loan or earlier upon the sale of the property, refinance of the mortgage loan, or payoff of the interest-bearing unpaid principal balance. 

Can you help me? Surely the federal government would like me to stay in my town home, keep my 3.25 % interest rate I worked hard to earn, and the money I put down for this home was the only money that I received from my mother 's trailer home sale. She died from XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and from then on, I have struggled to finally become a homeowner. I have come into some really hard circumstances XXXX right after another. 

I can not see the advantage to FHA to get me into some outrageous restructuring of my mortgage when I put money down $ XXXX of my mother 's money, and earned an interest rate of 3.25 %. Me and my XXXX sons, my dogs and my cat will have nowhere to go that we can afford here in the XXXX area. 

I have a lot of attachments for this situation, bills/etc coming. But the fact of the matter is that I have a good job, I just need time to catch up my payments and pay XXXX payment twice per month to help me. Beginning XX/XX/XXXX {$2700.00} ( XXXX XXXX ) ; XX/XX/XXXX {$1300.00} ; XX/XX/XXXX {$1300.00} ( XXXX payment ). XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX Bonus {$2700.00} ( XXXX payment ). XX/XX/XXXX, {$2700.00} XXXX payment. 

And that would catch me up to making the XXXX payment on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Documents forthcoming. 

, XXXX -- -- -- -- -- Forwarded message -- -- -- -- - From : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : Thu, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX Subject : XXXX : XXXX - Mortgage Assistance Application of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX, XXXX--
