Hello, My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and I am the holder of a Chase Business credit card. 

. I am disputing the following charges : XX/XX/XXXX, {$250.00}, XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, {$9900.00}, XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, {$7700.00}, XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, {$9600.00}, XXXX, XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX, I was in transit between XXXX, XXXX and the XXXX. 

When the fraudulent charges happened, chase was contacted immediately, a new card was issued, and the charges were reversed. 

In XXXX, XXXX, these charges were back in my account. 

I believe our card was cloned and used in XXXX where the fraudulent charges were made. 

I have not been to XXXX for over XXXX decades. I have not purchased any goods or services from XXXX. 

The company XXXX provides XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. They are XXXX XXXX  My assumption is, someone used our card to pay XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  payments require a contract or a receipt. 

I have sent an email to XXXX, XXXX requesting the charges to be refund imediately and proof of a sign receipt so we can give to the authorities for further investigation. We have not received a reply yet. See email attached. 

Chase stated the transaction is valid because they emailed me on XXXX, 5 days after transaction occurred, requesting confirmation the charges were legit and we replied yes. 

I have confirmed with our XXXX XXXX email host that there was no such email. 

We sent an email to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX requesting a copy of the email with the confirmation. Exhibit 1 attached. 

Chase has yet to respond. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent an email to XXXX sumarizing the problem with the unauthorized charges. See email attached. 

These were large charges within a few hours from a company we never done business with before, in a foreign country. Chase should have flagged that. 

Our business and me personally only own Chase United Cards. We are loyal customers, we spend well and pay for our statements in full, never missing a payment for over XXXX decades. 

We value our partnership with Chase. We are sad to have this issue and potentially have to close ou

r 20+ year old account if Chase can not protect us. Communication has be
en an issue,. The fraud department does not answer emails or return calls. Consumer complaint narrative:
According to my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting detailed validation of the debt in question. Account Information : Creditor Name : PORTFOLIO RECOV ASSOC Account Number : XXXX Amount : {$2100.00} I am exercising my rights under the FDCPA to request the following information : XXXX. XXXX or proof of the alleged debt, including the original creditor 's name and address. 
XXXX. Documentation evidencing that the collection agency has legal authority to collect this debt. 
XXXX. A complete accounting of the alleged debt, including all charges, fees, and interest applied. I also request that you provide me with a copy of the agreement that authorizes the creditor to assign or sell the debt to the collection agency. 
Furthermore, please verify that the statute of limitations on this debt has not expired. I understand that, under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, you need to provide me with the requested information within 30 days of receiving this dispute. Failure to do so will result in the assumption that the debt is invalid, and you must promptly remove it from my credit report. Please send all correspondence regarding this matter to the address listed above. I appreciate your prompt attention to this dispute and compliance with the FDCPA regulations.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a home in XXXX XXXX XXXX  in XX/XX/2024. 
My home in XXXX XXXX  had not sold yet. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX told me that my home payments would initially be high, but that the Mortgage Company, Provident Financial, would re-cast the loan once I paid it down after selling my home in XXXX. 
My monthly payments are around XXXX XXXXmonth with Provident Financial. 
In XX/XX/2024 we sold the house in XXXX, which gave me {$400000.00} in cash to put towards my mortgage on my XXXX XXXX home, financed with Provident Financial. 

On XX/XX/2024 I called Provident Financial to inquire how to recast my loan. They instructed me to send a check for the amount that I wished to pay down to the principal, with a note that I wished to recast the loan. They also instructed me to pay a {$300.00} fee towards interest as a fee for the recast. I sent a check to Provident Financial for {$370000.00} to pay down my principal for the recast. Then I went online and made a {$300.00} payment towards interest for the recast fee. 

On XX/XX/2024 I wrote an email to Provident Financial to inquire about when the recast would happen. The response was exactly " Our recast department has been notified that you would like to proceed with a recast. They will draft your recast agreements that outline the new payment terms of your loan and once completed, these arrangements will be made available under the " Letters and Monthly Statements '' tab of your online account. Please print, wet-sign, both original documents to : Provident Financial XXXX XXXX' On XX/XX/XXXX I wrote Provident Financial again to inquire on the recast. They told me that the fee has been applied to the loan and that it is noted for recast once an investor is determined. 

On XX/XX/2024 I was called by Provident Financial and was instructed that " Unfortunately, the investor assigned to your loan does not allow recasts. '' Now I am forced to either re-finance with a new mortgage company or pay XXXX XXXXXXXX on my home loan. I can not afford to continue paying this high payment for my mortgage loan. At the onset I was informed that a re-cast would occur once an investor was assigned and I would be allowed to recast. 

I would not have purchased a loan with Provident Financial if I knew they would sell my loan to someone else who does not re-cast. It seems shady an underhanded that they would sell the loan less than 6-months old to a company who does not allow the same procedures as they do.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Flagship Credit Acceptance LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Response to Complaint Review and Request for Release of Vehicle Title Dear Flagship Credit Acceptance LLC, I am writing in response to your XX/XX/year>, communication regarding my complaint filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). While I appreciate your acknowledgment of my concerns, your response contains inaccuracies and omissions that merit further review. 

Legal Breaches and Violations 1. Predatory Lending Practices under the Federal Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) TILA ( 15 U.S.C. 1601-1667f ) mandates clear and accurate disclosure of loan terms, including finance charges, annual percentage rates ( APR ), and fees. However, your internal risk assessment model and the terms of my loan reflect disproportionate interest rates and fees inconsistent with the standard market for borrowers in my credit category. 
Hidden Fees : Despite your assertion that no hidden fees exist, the compounding of extensions and associated costs demonstrates a lack of clarity, constituting a failure to provide the material disclosures required under 12 C.F.R. 1026.17.

Excessive Late Fees : The late fees imposed ( 10 % of the unpaid amount, with a {$5.00} minimum ) may exceed state usury laws, depending on the specific terms disclosed in your contract. Excessive penalties that are arbitrary or disproportionate to actual damages are prohibited under TILA.

2. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Violations The ECOA ( 15 U.S.C. 1691-1691f ) prohibits discriminatory practices in credit transactions. By placing bureaucratic obstacles on my requests for a loan modification and due date adjustment, you effectively denied me equal access to amend the loan terms despite my good-faith efforts to resolve the account.

I contacted Flagship on multiple occasions to request both a loan modification and deferred payment, but these efforts were met with resistance. Your failure to provide these options as promised violates contractual good faith and fair dealing principles.

3. Allocation of Payments and Failure to Disclose Payment Application Your response notes that the allocation method used is common to consumer finance companies. However, the lack of transparency regarding how payments are applied ( principal vs. interest vs. fees ) violates TILA disclosure requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1639 ). This omission prevents me from effectively managing my repayment obl

igations. 4. State Lien Law and Contractual Good Faith Breaches State lien laws typically require lenders to act in good faith when enforcing security interests. Your refusal to waive late fees or offer reasonable modifications, coupled with threats of repossession, undermines the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing inherent in all contracts. According to UCC 9-610, secured parties must act in a commercially reasonable manner when enforcing security interests. The refusal to accommodate reasonable requests for modifications or deferments, particularly during financial hardship, may be deemed unreasonable under state law. Request for Title Release and Additional Remedies Given the breaches outlined above, I request that Flagship : 1. Release the vehicle title free and clear. Flagships practices, as described, fail to comply with federal and state laws governing loan disclosures, payment application, and equitable modifications. 2. Provide an accurate accounting of all fees and interest accrued to date, with an explanation of their compliance with applicable laws. 3. Cease repossession threats immediately. Any repossession actions without addressing these issues will constitute unlawful seizure under state law. 
I trust that Flagship will recognize its obligation to resolve this dispute in good faith. Please respond to this letter in writing within 14 days.

There seemed to be discrepancies in the amounts paid out for homeowner 's insurance. XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I contacted XXXX XXXX on the payments made from the escrow account and received a print out. I contacted Bank of America also on XXXX. There was a payment of {$1600.00} that was paid according to this document near XX/XX/XXXX and on XX/XX/XXXX another XXXX. Consumer complaint narrative:
Credit Bureaus reported inaccurate information in violation of due process as outlined in the statute below. Credit Bureaus reported late payments and I have never been late on any payments. 
15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) ( b ) ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

( b ) Grace period If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without incurring an additional finance charge, such additional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I filed a formal dispute with Equifax on XX/XX/year> ( Dispute Identification : XXXX ), requesting the removal of inaccurate names, addresses, and employment information from my credit report. The dispute specifically identified the following issues : Incorrect Name : " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' ( I requested this be removed as my correct name is " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' ). 
Incorrect Addresses : I disputed nine invalid addresses that do not belong to me, requesting their removal from my credit report. 
Incorrect Employment Information : I requested the removal of " US Fed Benefits, '' which I have never been affiliated with as an employer. 
I also provided supporting documentation, including a copy of my valid ID and proof of my correct address, to facilitate Equifax 's investigation. Despite this, Equifax failed to address my dispute within the 30-day legally mandated timeframe under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This deadline was XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year>, I sent a 15-day follow-up letter reiterating my requests and urging Equifax to comply. Finally, on XX/XX/year>, I sent a final demand letter after receiving no response from Equifax. 

Equifax eventually responded on XX/XX/year>, only after I filed a complaint with the CFPB. While Equifax deleted the disputed addresses and the employment information, they failed to correct the name issue by retaining the inaccurate name " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' on my credit report, despite having received proof of my correct name. This failure to comply within the required 30-day timeframe and provide complete corrections violates multiple sections of the FCRA, including Sections 607 ( b ), 609 ( a ), and 611 ( a ). 

XXXX delays and incomplete resolution have caused emotional distress and financial harm, as the inaccuracies have negatively affected my creditworthiness and led to unnecessary confusion regarding my financial history.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am receiving student loan repayment through the Department of Defense ( DOD ). A lump sum payment was made in XX/XX/XXXX on my behalf. According to PSLF rules : " For each lump-sum payment made by the U.S. Department of Defense ( DOD ) toward your Direct Loans as part of one of the student loan repayment programs it administers, youwill receive credit for up to 12 future qualifying payments for PSLF if you also have qualifying employment during those future months. I also noticed the terms and condition along with their operations maybe in violation of the law. 
My issue for filing this complaint today XX/XX/year> is a payment issue. A double payment was made on XX/XX/year>, Friday for {$160.00}. I called my bank and Uplift/ XXXX XXXX. I was informed by a Uplift agent that is was there app error that has been down for a few months or glitch. They noted this in their system and told me I would be refunded. I kept calling and emailing them. I called last week several times and they told me they had to wait until the payment posted or cleared the bank first to refund. A week later the payment was cleared but no refund for the double payment. I filed a dispute with my XXXX XXXXXXXX. I received a text message alert on XX/XX/year> Saturday saying payment failure and when i logged into my account on the browser website I noticed the double charge or {$160.00} was gone, likely due to my bank dispute. I called this morning / today on XX/XX/year> and spoke to an agent about the refund for the double charge. Instead of complying with my request the lady agent refunded my current payment for the amount which is {$160.00}. I told her this was incorrect and almost immediately my account turned red saying past due {$160.00}. The agent wasn't well trained and made several mistakes. The phone called disconnected. I called back and male agent answer my call. He saw what happened and was noted in the system. He told me he couldn't stop the actions of the last agent and couldn't get the refund for my regular payment to stop but TOLD ME SINCE MY ACCOUNT IS NOW PAST DUE YOU CAN MAKE ANOTHER PAYMENT! Seems illegal. I would like billing issues fixed and refund. I can't even use my current bank account to make any payments on their website being blocked.

Sub-issue: Billing problem
Consumer complaint narrative: One ( 1 ) year ago ( roughly ) NMAC / Nissan failed to bill my new bank in XXXX of XXXX, after switching the second of two vehicles over from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Nissan in XXXX of XXXX, Submitted for payments to both banks creating a double-payment ( double autopay ) unbeknownst to me at the time. These affect accounts have never been the same since. We have two vehicles both XXXX XXXX 's on of which generally bills on or around the XXXX of each month for a total sum of {$320.00} and the other, on or around the XXXX of the month, for a total sum of {$320.00}, until the discrepancy at hand. Several checks were bounced and what was not included was the times retried which also assess fees. At this time we are just seeking to make our statements correct by not only adjusting their own fees charged in the amounts of {$20.00} and {$16.00} making it look like they are due at any given time {$350.00}, when that isn't the entire picture. There is interest I am certain that the additional {$36.00} has incurred and we would like that also to be accounted for as well and for this account not to be charged anything more than we would have originally had this issue not happened. Back to the initial root of the problem at hand. The double automatic payment occurred when Nissan submitted and both banks remitted payment in the month of XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX Nissan aka NMAC received # XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX -- the new bank on XX/XX/XXXX, and then on XX/XX/XXXX, they also received {$320.00} from the old bank, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX as well, causing a double payment. But the did not stop there. for XX/XX/XXXX, they tried to collect again, but from the former bank, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, which already hit with fee both from being presented with payments that could not be covered and from the accounts billed that could not collect from funds depleted from the additional withdrawal. Upon noticing this, XXXX XXXX  XXXX agreed to recall their payment that had gone through the previous month on XX/XX/XXXX, once they knew about the XX/XX/XXXX payment having already been taking by the new XXXX XXXXXXXX. When they recalled this payment which should have left everything even/correct except for their next pending payment on XX/XX/XXXX, that had not yet cleared ; the reversing the XX/XX/XXXX payment, then caused the pending XX/XX/XXXX that had not completed its posting for XX/XX/XXXX to be dropped. This also would not have been an issue, had Nissan / NMAC submitted payment to the new XXXX XXXX like they did the month prior ( when they established autopay with the new bank ) ; but when XXXX did not initially receive a request for payment per the autopay set up, so they did not fulfill sending one, which is why we went from having a double payment in XX/XX/XXXX, to having no final payment on record initially for XX/XX/XXXX. This was rectified as soon as we realized there wasn't a payment official for the month of XX/XX/XXXX. But that was not due to our neglect. We had set everything up the same on both accounts, and the account that gets billed the XXXX of each month in the amount of {$320.00} had a smooth transition from the first to the second bank -- unlike with the 2nd vehicle whose payments post the XXXX of each month for the amount of {$320.00}. We had no idea what would happen next, whether or not early on if a payment was coming through to the new bank ; and we had been spending all of our time trying to cover all of the bounced items one their first postings or second postings and those fees were putting us further in the hole.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an urgent problem related to what I owe in federal and State of Florida taxes in connection to my mortgage debt, and to a lack of understanding what interest rates I was charged on my mortgage loan. I don't know what amount I owe and to which government agency, even though I am now in a second lawsuit regarding this matter. Please help me getting this information...

I tried at least 12 times -using a variety of communication methods such as certified mail, phone conversation, email, and court- to obtain this information from : 1. The lender Wilmington Trust , National Association. 
XXXX. The servicer XXXX XXXX. 
3. The debt collector XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
4. IRS. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
6. Florida Department of Revenue.

All of these attempts were unsuccessful. I have been trying for a whole year. 
If I do not get this information in next couple weeks, I can be accused of a federal bankruptcy fraud crime.

Here is what happened : 1. I wanted to sell my condo when I became ill and was 6 weeks behind in my mortgage payments. I asked my ex-husband to help. 

XXXX. My ex looked at my loan applications which were submitted on my behalf by my landlord at a time ( who has been a long time condo board member and licensed realtor ). He discovered that my condo address was changed during the loan origination by the seller entering a new building number for my condo. My title report was forged and it was not shown that there is a mortgage on whole building and land, and open mortgage from the former owner on the condo unit which I was buying in the building. My ex told me that government can forfeit my condo because false info was submitted to bank. 

3. I notified the mortgage servicer on XX/XX/XXXX about the fraud and sent evidence of fraudulent loan applications and changed property address.

4. Mortgage servicer, instead of putting me in a nonmonetary default for fraud in the borrower 's application, as it is required in my mortgage contract, waited until I am eligible for a monetary default for failure to make mortgage payments, and started the foreclosure proceedings then. 

5. Three days after the foreclosure complaint was filed in XXXX XXXX XXXX court on XXXX XXXX, my condo was sold to the condominium XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Our condominium operates as a special purpose entity due to being a historic-contributing property in XXXX XXXX XXXX Every time there is a sale, it is first sold to condominium, and the condominium sells the condo to a new owner. This is a double escrow scheme where a separate deed with the county recorder is not recorded at a time the condo is sold to the condominium. Condominium doesn't pay state or federal taxes due to being part of conservation easement syndicate in XXXX XXXX and the sale taking place with the help of the infinite banking insurance entity XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

6. Wilmington Trust secured the summary judgement from the court and scheduled the sale of my condo on XX/XX/XXXX. 

7. The summary judgement order was written by Wilmington Trust lawyers XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX as it was ordered by the judge for them to upload the order into the court system. The summary judgement order changed the contract terms where the interest rate was changed and times when those interest rates were charged were also changed. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX filed three different summary jud

gement orders with different amounts showing as owed. 8. Under Florida law, both the lender and the borrower are liable for the unpaid taxes. I wrote to IRS and Florida Department of Revenue asking to clarify what I owe but have not heard back.

9. I didnt receive the tax forms from the mortgage servicer for the year of XXXX. So I am not sure if IRS was paid for the mortgage interest income. 

10. I filed a bankruptcy petition with the XXXX Florida XXXX XXXX. But I have no idea what I owe to Wilmington Trust and to IRS and the Department of Revenue because there are at least 3 different versions filed by Wilmington Trust , National Association in the public records. 

11. I called and wrote to Wilmington Trust and XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX many many times, asking for - 1.Explanation on which dates which interest rate was charged.

2.Title Search Report.

3.Evidence that IRS taxes were paid for interest charged in XXXX. 
4.Proof the documentary taxes were paid to Department of Revenue.

5.Proof the court cost taxes were paid.

6. Explanation why the lawyers filed another document in court for over XXXX dol in legal costs 2 months after the final judgement was entered when the case was closed and there were no legal actions being taken such as appeal or rehearing. I was a pro se litigant in my foreclosure case. 

I found 250 email addresses of Wilmington Trust executives and emailed them all my questions but no one responded.

Tomorrow is my first hearing in bankruptcy court and I am scared the judge will accuse me of bankruptcy crime when they see that my petition has inaccurate numbers on mortgage and taxes debt, and all because Wilmington Trust and XXXX XXXX ignored my begging to provide clarification... help...

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
VALIDATION AND CEASE AND DESIST Collection agency name : Address : Account number : Your NAME : Your address : Dear ( Debt Collector ) I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : XXXX. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 
XXXX. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed. 
XXXX. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor. 
XXXX. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt. 
XXXX. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 
Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter

Sub-issue: Problem with your payment plan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have multiple student loans serviced by DEPTEDXXXX, which have been on my credit report for over a decade. These loans have been in forbearance since I graduated in XXXX, as I have been unable to secure gainful employment that would allow me to repay them. Despite this, the loans continue to negatively impact my credit report, preventing me from obtaining stable housing and even some employment opportunities, as certain employers review credit reports. 

Here are the relevant details of the loans : - Opened between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX  Total balances range from {$1900.00} to {$10000.00}. 
XXXX  Payments are listed as current, but the loans are still in forbearance due to my financial hardship. 

I have a child to support and have struggled to provide basic necessities, including housing, because these loans continue to limit my ability to qualify for assistance or improve my financial standing. I am requesting a review of whether these loans should remain on my credit report, as they have been in forbearance for over 11 years without progress, and are hindering my ability to achieve financial stability. 

Additionally, I have disputed these loans on my credit report in the past, but the disputes were resolved in favor of the servicer. I am seeking assistance to find a resolution, whether through removal of the loans from my report or other remedies to address this ongoing issue. 

Thank you for your help in addressing this matter.

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank of America Claim ID : XXXX Multiple unauthorized purchases on my card. Called on XX/XX/XXXX after seeing over {$1400.00} of charges on my card i did not make. Account given temporary credit while they review. These charges were done around the location of XXXX of my home. A couple of the places like XXXX and XXXX  XXXX i have been to before. The other places I have not. Such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  among others within that claim. When i initiated my claim I asked the rep to provide the expiration date of the card being used, as i had a card ( old card ) in my possession still. They told me they could not provide this information. All cards were cancelled at this time and replaced with a new card number. I received notification on XX/XX/XXXX that my claim was denied. I called up to inquire about the situation and had it escalated. I asked for the proof that they are basing their decision on and they said the chip was used and a signature was given. If the card was lost then the fact the chip was used does not prove anything and a signature is easily forged. They never sent me the proof requested either. I reopened the case and had it escalated as I did not make these transactions and BoA offers a {$0.00} Liability Guarantee covers fraudulent transactions made by others using your Bank of America consumer debit card. This falls under that category. Not sure if they are using AI to do their work now and since I do have a presence in XXXX XXXX XXXX that is causing the decision to be made. I reviewed my account on XX/XX/XXXX and found a notification they denied the claim again under the same reason. " We confirmed your card was used for the charge ( s ). The chip was read, your PIN was entered, and/or you signed for the merchandise or service, which indicates you or someone you allowed to use your card was present. '' Their notation also said they reported to the credit agencies. Also, weve contacted these credit reporting agencies to add a comment to your credit report stating you disagree with our decision on your fraud claim. Please keep in mind it may take up to 60 days for the comment to appear on your credit file. Since I did not do these transactions, I don't understand how they can use this as a reason for denying my claim. I asked if they contacted the merchants for any video surveillance that would prove my claim to be true. They did not provide anything. They just keep repeating the generic answer of We confirmed your card was used for the charge ( s ). The chip was read, your PIN was entered, and/or you signed for the merchandise or service, which indicates you or someone you allowed to use your card was present. This must be a generic response as the Credit card does not even have a PIN. On this same call I was on hold for 45 minutes between them transferring me around from person to person. Then they hung up at the 1hr 4min mark. Did not call me back. Called again- on hold for 8 minutes and was disconnected again. Called again was told they can only reopen the case and escalate again. I cant talk to anyone in the actual fraud division. Will be filing a police report later today and sending it to BoA to add to my case. 


Still trying to resolve this 6 months later. They continue to say they have no actual proof I made these transactions. Only that i am guilty because i live close by. 0 % fraud liability seems like a blatant lie by this company since they are trying to force me to pay for things I did not do. Refuse to supply any evidence that it was me. surveillance or if the transaction was completed online then a public IP address that matches with my own. There is 0 proof provided even when i directly ask them. Just the same generic response that is read off to me. How does a bank operate in such a manner and not get in legal trouble for actions such as this. Filed a police report and sent them this, in which their response was they don't care about it and it doesn't matter. 


This is their answer We notified you on XX/XX/XXXX, we were unable to approve your claim as your card was used for the charges. The chip was read, Personal Identification Number ( PIN ) was entered, and/or they signed for the merchandise or service, which indicates you or someone you allowed to use your card was present Nowhere in this does it have proof I did anything. How are we letting a bank get away with this?

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
Credit Bureaus reported inaccurate information in violation of due process as outlined in the statute below. Credit Bureaus reported late payments and I have never been late on any payments.

15 U.S.C. 1666 ( a ) ( b ) ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

( b ) Grace period If an open end consumer credit plan provides a time period within which an obligor may repay any portion of the credit extended without incurring an additional finance charge, such additional finance charge may not be imposed with respect to such portion of the credit extended for the billing cycle of which such period is a part, unless a statement which includes the amount upon which the finance charge for the period is based was mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the date specified in the statement by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a debt collection notice after I won a disputed transaction through my credit card company. The collection notice is {$740.00} while the disputed transaction I won is {$550.00}. 

What upsets me the most is because there is NO FAX OR EMAIL on the notice. 

The collection agency ( XXXX ) gave me 40 days to respond either by writing or calling to either XXXX or XXXX ( the creditor ). I immediately called each of them 3 times. 

Knowing that they can easily deny my respond, each time I called and left messages, I specifically asked them to write me an email that acknowledged my respond. 

Unfortunately, the life agents of both companies refused to send me an email or any formal letter that acknowledged my respond. 

So, the only way for customers to get written proof of their respond by certified receipts mail. That will be time consuming, laborious, and expensive. 
I feel that it was arranged that way in order to trap to vulnerable people. For example, senior citizens with diminishing mental capacity, mentally XXXX, and limited English speaker. 

Most vulnerable people will not spend extra postage for return receipt, let alone to line up for hours at the post office, just to get written proof of their responds. 
So, I filed a complaint with XXXX ( to get the creditors fax number and get written proof of my respond ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was denied a personal loan from Discover Personal Loans this afternoon due to a cyber scam that negatively impacted my credit through no fault of my own. Discover extended the offer to me, which I had not solicited. The denial was also influenced by a delayed response from XXXX concerning a missing telephone number on their fraud alert. The persistent denials from Discover and XXXX are distressing and unfair, given that the nature of these transactions is clearly fraudulent. The scammer 's deceit and subsequent threats of physical harm have already caused me immense emotional distress, and the financial impact is exacerbating my hardship. 

Despite my reasonable faith efforts to dispute the fraudulent charges with Discover and XXXX, both institutions have maintained their stance that these charges are legitimate and have refused to remove them from my account. This continued refusal has placed a considerable financial burden on me, with a negative balance of {$2400.00} still reflecting on my Discover card, and has destroyed my credit.

Consumer complaint narrative:
please see the attachment below to how XXXX XXXX about there service. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX FTC Charges it Misled Students About Career Training, Credit Transfers XX/XX/201XXXX XXXX Tags : Consumer Protection Bureau of Consumer Protection Education Finance deceptive/misleading conduct XXXX  XXXX XXXX has agreed to settle Federal Trade Commission charges it misrepresented to students that they would get the training and credentials needed to switch careers or get a new job, and that the course credits they earned would transfer to other schools. In reality, many programs offered by the for-profit institution did not meet state requirements for desired careers, and the claims made about credit transfers were often not true. 

When schools promise students they can transfer course credits or get a better job after completing their programs, theyd better be able to back up those claims, said XXXX XXXX, Director, FTCs Bureau of Consumer Protection. XXXX XXXX didnt tell the truth when it made those promises to prospective students. 

According to the Commissions complaint, the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, doing business as XXXX XXXX, violated the FTC Act by deceptively marketing its online college degree and career-training programs. The FTC alleges some degrees and programs offered by XXXX XXXX failed to meet the basic educational requirements set by state licensing boards for careers or jobs such as real estate appraisers, home inspectors, elementary school educators, massage practitioners, and more. The FTC also alleges the institution claimed that its credits would transfer even though it lacked supporting data that other colleges and universities would accept their credits. 

Tuition at XXXX XXXX ranges from hundreds to several thousand dollars. XXXX XXXX does not accept student loans, and students are required to pay tuition in full or make monthly payments. However, it does accept military  benefits including XXXX  XXXX  payments, and has directed some of its advertising to military servicemembers and their families. 

The proposed stipulated court order prohibits XXXX XXXX from misrepresenting that : completing XXXX program will qualify students to obtain vocational licenses without any additional training or experience ; XXXX programs provide all the training and credentials required to switch careers or obtain a job in a new field ; there will be job security or steady employment for consumers completing its programs ; and that course credits are generally recognized by, and accepted, by other postsecondary institutions. 
The order also includes an {$11.00} XXXX judgment, which is suspended based on the institutions inability to pay. 

Students interested in pursuing a higher education should check out the FTCs updated guidance, Choosing a College : Questions to Ask. Commission staff also has a new post, An Unlikely Commencement Address, on the Business Center Blog. 

The Commission vote authorizing the filing of the complaint and the proposed stipulated court order was 5-0. The complaint and proposed order were filed in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of XXXX  on XX/XX/2015. 

The Federal Trade Commission works for consumers to prevent fraudulent, deceptive, and unfair business practices and to provide information to help spot, stop, and avoid them. To file a complaint in English or Spanish, visit the FTCs online Complaint Assistant or call XXXX ( XXXX ). The FTC enters complaints into Consumer Sentinel, a secure, online database available to more than 2,000 civil and criminal law enforcement agencies in the U.S. and abroad. The FTCs website provides free information on a variety of consumer topics. Like the FTC on XXXX, follow us on XXXX, and subscribe to press releases for the latest FTC news and resources. 

Contact Information MEDIA CONTACT : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  STAFF CONTACT : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  For Consumers Blog : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Collection Agency Name, I am writing to address the adverse marks on my credit file that have been attributed to me. While I would willingly acknowledge and assume responsibility for any valid debts, I am unable to do so in this case without Proper Validation and Proof Of Claim. As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am formally requesting comprehensive validation of the alleged debt. 
I seek evidence establishing that I am the party obligated to settle this debt and that there exists a legally binding contractual obligation compelling me to do so. For clarity, I request that all communication be limited to written correspondence until adequate validation of the purported debt is provided. To assist you in meeting this request, please furnish the following required documentation : Complete payment history, as per the precedent set by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ; XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX. Provide a detailed verification by line item, including information on the purchase date, itemized amounts, receipt of goods, and any relevant details directly from the Original Creditor. 
Date of Last Activity. 
Full, accurate social security number that may help to identify me as the correct person you are trying to collect from. 
Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor, indicating the commitment to pay the original creditor. 
The obligation between your company ( [ Collection Agency Name ] and me that authorizes the collection of the alleged debt, along with any transactions binding me to an agreement to pay your company. 
Proof of photo identification ( i.e., driver 's license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) presented at the time of incurring the debt. 
Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company, including any agreement with your client granting the authority to collect on this alleged debt. ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. ) XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) - information relating to the purchase of a bad debt is not proprietary or burdensome. 
Any other pertinent information regarding the creation of the debt by your collection agency like ( 1. Where the debt originated from, 2. ) The sum paid by the bad debt buyer for the plaintiff 's debt, 3. ) How the total amount was determined, and 4 ) A list of documents that authorize the collection of debts. ) I must emphasize that, under FDCPA Section 809 ( b ), collection activity is prohibited until the debt is duly validated. The court ruling in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) confirms that reporting a collection account constitutes collection activity. Please be aware that this is not a request for partial validation ; rather, it is a demand for all the listed information to constitute full and sufficient validation of this debt. 
While I prefer not to litigate, I will use the courts as needed to enforce my rights under the FDCPA and other statutes. I look forward to an uneventful resolution of this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
LVNV FUNDING LLC {$1300.00} C/O RESURGENT CAPITAL SERVICES XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX They above company was attempting to collect a debt from me. However, I did not know about the debt collection process until i received a summons that a family member gave to me. This was a summons to appear in court on XX/XX/year> at XXXX. 

I contacted the Attorney 's office that is representing LVNV FUNDING LLC Attorney Office : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Mississippi XXXX I asked them about the debt and they falsely gave me information the was not true. They told me that the debt was for a company that I did business with over 10 years ago. I then looked at my credit report and did not see this company that they spoke of. I then decided to file an answer with the court after looking up my federal rights. In my answer I stated that I am disputing this debt, and I'm requesting a validation from the pursuant. I stated the plaintiff has not provided breakdown fees including how the alleged debt was calculated and what they claim I am responsible for. The state the debt was created in nor responded to my verbal request for the address and contact information of the original debtor. I was not provided a copy of my signature on a contract or document that hold me responsible for the alleged debt with LVNV funding LLC. 

I also requested that they have not violated the stature of limitations for this debt in the state in which this debt was created. According to the fair debt collection practice act. The reason I requested this in my answer is because the verbally stated this debt was from a creditor from over 10 years ago. 

I also stated to them that, a communication in form of a formal pleading in a civil action shall not be treated XXXX initial communication according to the FDCPA. 

I sent this to them in my answer through the court in XXXX XXXX in XXXX, XXXX XXXX 

After my answer was filed on XX/XX/year>. I received a credit card statement with the company name XXXX  on it. This is clearly not the company they initially said they are taking me to court about. 

They also attached a letter stating this is the proof of debt. 

I appeared in court on XX/XX/year>XXXX  at XXXX at the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Where I stood before a Judge was not prepared. He didn't even know I filed an answer. The Plaintiff informed him that I filed an answer. The Plaintiff then gave the judge his copy of my answer. 

The judge scan the answer and made a ruling over my case for the plaintiff and ruled default for the plaintiff. 

I feel this is unfair this law off had a stack of case similar to mine and the judge was ruling default for the plaintiff on all of the cases. 

I feel the debt collection process was not done correctly and the judge did not care to event check the laws the was stated in this case on my behalf.

Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to register a formal complaint against Citi Bank for the illegitimate closure of my recently opened CitiBank AAdvantage XXXX Credit Card. 

I applied for and was approved for this card at the end of XX/XX/2024. Since receiving the card, I have complied with all terms and conditions and have not received any prior warnings or notifications regarding my account being in jeopardy. Much to my surprise, today-XX/XX/2024-I found that Citi Bank has closed my account without giving any explanation or reason.

When I spoke with Citi Bank today and asked for an account manager, they could not explain why the account was closed. The manager explicitly expressed that the account closure " does not make sense, '' again highlighting that there is no valid reason or clear communication for this decision. 

What makes this even more vexing is that, by the time the card was closed, I had already spent {$7000.00} on it, meeting its spending requirement for the sign-on bonus. This sudden closing seems to be a false and misleading business practice that could also be a CFPA violation under 12 U.S.C. 5531, since it prohibits any act or practice in connection with any consumer financial product or service that involves unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAPs ). 

This act has dislocated my business, disrupted my credit profile, and more importantly, has eroded trust in Citi Bank as a house. What is worse, however, is that without providing a clear explanation or even allowing me a hearing of my alleged concerns, a failure to apply the basic principles of fairness and accountability has occurred. 

I request the immediate reinstatement of my account. It is not only against basic notions of equity but also possibly in contravention of the responsibilities imposed on them by consumer protection laws. In case Citi Bank feels that this closure was justified, I hereby request a detailed reason, quoting correctly any violation or terms on which such an action was based. 

Furthermore, I am asking for : The immediate reopening of my account. 
A complete investigation into the unjustified account closure was in order. Assurance that this incident in no way affects my credit report or, indeed, any business operations. Immediate action to ensure the sign-on bonus I had qualified for. I view this situation as an unfair and deceptive practice that is contrived to deny me benefits under the credit card agreement. I request the CFPB 's assistance in investigating and resolving this matter promptly. 

Please feel free to contact me if further details are required at XXXX or XXXX. 

Thank you for your time and attention.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have written to formally dispute the charges on my XXXX XXXX lease ( Account Number : XXXX ) as well as the predatory practices and harassment I have endured since XX/XX/year>. 

During the COVID-19 lockdown, I made multiple attempts to return the vehicle in accordance with the lease agreement terms, but my return was refused due to dealership closures and restrictions related to the pandemic. Under the terms of my lease agreement, I was entitled to return the vehicle at **Normal Maturity Lease End** or **before** the lease end date. 
The refusal to accept the vehicle directly violated the agreement, which stipulates that I may return the vehicle either to the dealership that leased me the vehicle or to any other location that you designate. Despite my efforts, Ally Financial and its affiliates failed to honor this contractual obligation. As a result of your refusal to accept the vehicle, I have been subjected to unjust and predatory charges, including excess mileage and wear fees that would have been waived had the return process been followed as outlined in the agreement. 
These charges were imposed despite my good faith efforts to comply with the lease terms and the extraordinary circumstances of the pandemic. 
Additionally, XXXX consumer protection laws, which were enforced during the pandemic, specifically protected consumers from predatory practices, including refusal to accept lease returns. 
Your refusal to accept my lease return during this time violates these protections and constitutes a breach of contract. 
In addition, I was also deprived of a fair opportunity to settle my lease under the best financial terms. 
This refusal resulted in unnecessary excess fees and charges, making them predatory in nature. The contract outlines that excess mileage and wear fees are capped by the vehicle 's residual value. But since I was unable to return the vehicle, these charges have been wrongfully imposed. 

I request that you immediately : 1. Remove all charges related to the excess mileage, wear, and other penalties.

2. Correct the derogatory information on my credit report and provide me with a deletion letter.

3. Confirm in writing that this issue has been resolved and the charges removed.

Please respond to this dispute within 30 days, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Ally financial has all records of numerous attempts to dispute this with their employees at call centers and emails messages that went unanswered through their portal. I expect a resolution to this matter promptly and will escalate to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX if necessary. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported in to be removed. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ). I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Regarding Venmo Credit Card Account : App Bug, Miscommunication, and Customer Support Failures Dear PayPal Customer Service Team, I am writing to formally raise a complaint regarding Venmo and its handling of my Venmo Credit Card account. This issue has caused significant financial and emotional distress and has not been addressed adequately. While XXXX XXXX  the financier of the Venmo Credit Card, has responded to my previous complaint, it is clear that the responsibility for the problems I encountered lies with Venmo/PayPal. 

Background of the Issue On XX/XX/year>, I received an alert from my credit monitoring service about a drastic drop in my credit score, suggesting potential identity theft. I immediately investigated all my accounts and discovered an unexpected balance of {$9900.00} on my Venmo Credit Card, along with approximately {$2600.00} in interest charges.

As a loyal Venmo user, I have relied heavily on the Venmo app to manage my account. However, despite checking the app frequently, I never saw this balance or any alerts about the accrued interest. The apps display consistently showed Venmo Credit Card without any clear balance or payment information, misleading me into thinking my account was in good standing. 

Additionally, I received paper statements from Venmo every month, and none of them showed this balance or the accumulating interest. This failure of communication from Venmoboth through the app and via mailed statementsprevented me from addressing the issue in a timely manner. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  has confirmed that their billing processes are compliant and that all statements were sent according to their records. While I acknowledge their explanation, my complaint is not about XXXX or its processesit is about Venmos app functionality, its failure to display accurate account information, and the failure of its customer support team to resolve the issue.

Key Points of My Complaint Venmo App Bug and Miscommunication : The Venmo app failed to display my balance or provide adequate notifications about my account status. This is a technical failure that misled me into believing there were no outstanding balances or interest charges. Screenshots of the apps misleading interface are available to demonstrate this issue. 
Failure of Customer Support : When I discovered the issue, I contacted Venmo customer support and spent over an hour speaking with multiple representatives. Despite raising valid concerns about the apps functionality and lack of communication, I was met with dismissive responses and no actionable resolution.

Unacceptable Shift of Responsibility to XXXX XXXX  Venmo has effectively deflected responsibility to XXXX Bank, yet this issue clearly stems from Venmos platform, which users like me rely on to monitor and manage accounts. XXXX can not be held accountable for Venmos app bugs or customer service failures.

Sub-issue: Credit denial
Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
AFFIRM INC XXXX XXXX XXXX FL XXXX, XXXX XXXX CA XXXX Subject : Debt Validation Request Dear AFFIRM INC, I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding the alleged debt referenced in your letter. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I am requesting validation of this debt.

Specifically, I request the following documentation : 1. Proof of Debt : Copies of all records showing the amount of the debt, how it was calculated, and the original contract or agreement signed by me.

2. Assignment of Debt : Copies of all contracts or assignments that demonstrate your legal right to collect this debt, including any chain of assignment from the original creditor to your company.

3. Original Creditor Information : The name, address, and contact information of the original creditor, along with details about the account and any outstanding balance at the time of the assignment or sale.

4. Payment History : A detailed, itemized statement showing any payments made, fees added, and the balance still owed.

5. Statute of Limitations Verification : Documentation confirming the date of last payment and whether the debt is within the statute of limitations.

Until I receive the requested documentation, I dispute the validity of this debt. I also request that all collection efforts, including reporting to credit bureaus, be halted until this matter is resolved.

Please note that future communication regarding this matter should be in writing and sent to the address listed on file. Additionally, I request that you do not contact me by phone. 

Thank you for your cooperation. I look forward to receiving the requested information within 30 days of your receipt of this letter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I reached out other Sallie Mae in regards to my difficulty in making monthly payments. On both of my calls, the collections agents offered no solutions to my issues, explained that the only option I had moving forward was to make the minimum monthly payments or risk having negative information be sent to credit bureaus. I tried unsuccessfully to both agents that I simply am unable to afford the monthly payments, that the terms of the rate reduction plan I was recently enrolled in was barely affordable, that I would like to make some sort of payment, but both explained to me that there was nothing available. 

I also requested that my loans be placed on forbearance temporarily, but was told that that was not an option. 

I would like to make some sort of payments to Sallie Mae to honor my obligation, but if they are unable or unwilling to work with me on this matter I don't know what else to do.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, My name is XXXX XXXX and I had private student loans through Navient earlier this year. I attended a predatory school ( XXXXXXXX XXXX  ) where I have received forgiveness on my federal student loans through the XXXX vs XXXX lawsuit. I qualified for the XXXX XXXX to XXXX through the XXXX vs XXXX lawsuit. I started corresponding with multiple people at Navient in XXXX regarding my private student loans. Even though I was making regular payments, the balance continued to only increase because these were in my opinion " bad loans '' with high interest rates. As a result, I talked to representatives with Navient to include XXXX XXXX the " Unit Collections Manager '' of XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX at Navient ( EMAIL : XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX 's phone numberXXXX ) starting in XXXX of XXXX. Despite talking to XXXX XXXX via phone ( and over email ) as well as MULTIPLE other Navient employees ( XXXX and XXXX as well who work in that department ). NONE of these Navient employees informed me of other options even though I told them I attended a predatory school ( where my private loans were taken out ) and was approved for XXXX XXXX to Repayment. NONE of the Navient employees including XXXX XXXX who is a SUPERVISOR with Navient informed me that within a couple months ( summer of XXXX ) there would be an option to request a " School Misconduct Discharge Application '' ( see XXXX XXXX XXXXnavientXXXX for more information. ) Because I was never provided this information, I ended up taking out {$21000.00} in my retirement to " settle '' on my private loans with Navient. If I had been provided ACCURATE, HELPFUL information from Navient I would have been told that this program would be beneficial for me to apply for instead of taking out that much money of my retirement. I would like to file a complaint and request that I am allowed to apply for the " School Misconduct Discharge '' for the settled amount ( {$21000.00} ) I paid Navient out of my RETIREMENT because I was PURPOSELY not provided this information from Navient that there were other options or that this program even existed. None of this is surprising given Navient 's recent lawsuit. Consumer complaint narrative:
Midland Mortgage is purposely delaying an endorsed check of {$35000.00} which was delivered to them on XX/XX/year>. This amount was sent by our insurance company for for siding and gutters replacement. Roofing repairs, which are a part of the same claim, have already been completed with the first check of {$14000.00}. From XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Midland representatives have provided inconsistent, misleading and false information. After numerous phone calls and escalation, it was advised on XX/XX/year> that the check was endorsed and it would be mailed out on XX/XX/year>XXXX  and was even provided with a new tracking number than the previous one provided. 
We later received a phone call on XX/XX/year> stating there was an error in the inspection ( that was performed by a Midland representative ). Midland is now stating that 100 % of the roofing, siding and gutter repairs have to be completed in order to release the funds. However, the documents that Midland requires states the exact repairs, amounts and draw schedule. I was told that there was still no available supervisor, and was transferred to a voicemail where I left a message. 

After not receiving a call back from a supervisor, I called again on XX/XX/year> and spoke with a representative who stated that there was no supervisor available but was speaking with someone who was helping her. The representative first asked what the minimum amount needed was to start repairs. After I advised that the whole amount was needed, she stated they could send {$22000.00}. I again advised that we need the full amount. I also relayed the additional damage being caused to the home, which caused Midland to give a counteroffer of {$25000.00}. I agreed to this amount because work HAS to be started as soon as possible. No one has been able to give clear, correct information about what is going on and why our funds are being held unnecessarily. 

We have submitted every piece of information that is required. Somewhere, there is a disconnect and the documentation is not being clearly read. Midland is unfairly delaying the shipping of this check, which is causing unnecessary damage to the property as we await further repairs. Again, Midland is not following their own policies.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am reaching out to seek urgent assistance regarding what I feel is an unfair and financially devastating situation involving Synchrony Bank. This matter, if not addressed, will have a serious impact on my familys financial well-being. 

In XXXX, I had a balance of {$7700.00} left for a XXXX XXXX purchase of appliances from XXXX XXXX {$14000.00}, and I continued making my monthly payments as scheduled. I planned to pay off the total balance, expecting it would now be around {$6000.00}. To my shock, when I went to pay it off, my balance had more than doubled to {$13000.00}. Unbeknownst to me, three different interest-free promotions on the purchases had expired, adding {$7400.00} in interest to my balance. 

Back in XX/XX/XXXX, when setting up my auto-payments, I spoke to a Synchrony representative to clarify the promotion terms, as my three appliance purchases were delivered at different times. I was under the impression that they understood my goal was to pay off the purchases in full by the end of the promotional period. I trusted that the auto-payments were set up accordingly. 

Despite my efforts to explain this honest misunderstanding, Synchrony has refused to provide any assistance, saying that the information was in the statements. While I admit I missed those notifications amidst a flood of emails from Synchrony 6-8 a month, I have always maintained my accounts with Synchrony, dating back to XXXX, and have never had a late payment, ever. 

Given my perfect history with Synchrony, I believe the added {$7400.00} interest fee is an excessive penalty for a minor oversight of missing the promotional deadlines by just three months. I am prepared to pay the balance in full immediately and am simply requesting the removal of the added interest, as this fee is exorbitant and could significantly harm my familys finances.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> Capital One attempted to do a a scheduled ACH transfer from XXXX to pay a Venture Card ( XXXX ) outstanding balance of {$14000.00}. This was the first payment on this new card. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the XXXX charge was " returned ''. I do not know why but given that this was the first payment, a likely cause is a mistyped account number. Capital One refuses to provide the information needed to verify this hypothesis though they clearly have it because otherwise they could not initiate an ACH transfer. Their refusal also makes it impossible to show that they are at fault. The ACH charge does not show on the XXXX side. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I learned of the problem because CapitalOne restricted ( i.e. suspended ) XXXX. Not knowing what the problem was, I did an ACH transfer of {$14000.00} from XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). This transfer was successful. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I did an XXXX transfer of {$540.00} from the original account, XXXX, to pay the not-yet-due balance. This transfer was successful. 

Capital One then suspended another, unrelated, credit card, XXXX. This card has a scheduled autopay from XXXX and has been current on payments since its inception ( at least one year, Capital One 's web site does not let me go further back ) Given the likely cause of this situation and the fact that Capital One and that I've given Capitol One all the money that they are due, and did so within hours of learning of the situation, it's unreasonable that Capital One continues to accuse me of fraud. 

They've demanded a ridiculous amount of information from me. Among other things, Capital One demanded a utility bill for " proof of residence ''. The utility company quite rightly refused to verify my billing address when Capital One called. So, their fraud department wanted something else. I pointed out that the bank statement that Capital One demanded had my address on it ( it's the original XXXX account ) they told me to resubmit the same sheet of paper that I'd already given them again but this time mark it " proof of residence '', not " bank statement ''. This is ridiculous. 

At this point, I'm thinking that Capital One is merely trying to avoid paying out the " rewards '' on XXXX. Why they also want to kill what had been a satisfactory business relationship by restricting XXXX, I just can't fathom.

Problem during payment process
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, I have different balances on my Citi XXXX XXXX  credit card ( different % XXXX, promo periods, loans, etc ). 

I used to have : - BalTrnOffer 5 : 0.99 % expiring XX/XX/XXXX. 

I waited until the next statement after XX/XX/XXXX to confirm " BalTrnOffer 5 '' no longer showed 0.99 %, but a high 24.24 %. I called to verify the correct payoff amount, then I paid {$15000.00} online on XX/XX/XXXX. This successfully paid off BalTrnOffer 5. 

The phone rep explained that I had accrued a little bit of interest by waiting to make a payment until *after* the statement. He said ( paraphrased ), " Next time, you can pay *on the day* the promo rate expires. You don't have to wait for the statement. 

That was great advice! The next balance to pay off was : - BalTrnOffer 7 : 0 % expiring XX/XX/XXXX Just to be extra safe, I called again on XX/XX/XXXX and/or XX/XX/XXXX. And again, the phone rep told me, " Yes, you can pay now because the promo period has ended -- and your payment will pay off this BalTrnOffer 7 balance. '' Perfect! I paid {$8500.00}. ( I believe I made the payment on the phone with the rep. ) But instead of paying down BalTrnOffer 7, my payment was assigned to : - Plan 4 : 60-month loan@ 8.99 % This messed up my entire pay-off plan because I was diligently monitoring and paying down my highest-interest balances first, wanting to leave my low-interest loan to be paid off at the end of its term. ( Plus, my loan was set for 60 months@ 8.99 % -- there was no need to pay this off early while BalTrnOffer 7 went up to 24.24 %! ) I talked to Citi multiple times ( at least half a dozen ) and each time was told they were investigating this matter to correct it. 

I specifically asked them to listen to the phone call on XX/XX/XXXX where I was told that my payment would pay off BalTrnOffer 7. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I was told this recording had been listened to on XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, a phone rep said my request was resolved and I would see my corrected balances soon. I was also assured that the interest that had been accruing due to the mis-assigning of my payment would be credited to me. 

But all I have been receiving are generic letters from Citi explaining that payments go to balance in APR order from lowest to highest. ( I knew that -- that's why I was so careful to ensure my BalTrnOffer 7 was indeed high interest at the time of my payment. ) Sorry, this has been very frustrating. I believe I have a strong case because multiple Citi representatives repeatedly told me that my payment would pay off BalTrnOffer 7, specifically calls on : - XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX and - XX/XX/XXXX ( when I paid off XXXX XXXX ) Thank you very much for your help.

XXXX [ XX/XX/year> Midland Credit Management XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Request for Debt Validation Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding an alleged debt associated with my name. Please be advised that I am requesting validation of the debt in accordance with my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g.

Specifically, I request that you provide the following information : The amount of the alleged debt. 
The name of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed. 
Documentation that verifies your legal right to collect on this debt, including the original contract or agreement. 
A complete account history, including any interest or fees added to the original debt. 
A copy of any judgment, if applicable. 
Until you provide this information, I ask that you cease any further collection activity, including reporting to credit bureaus, as required by law. 

Please send your response to the address listed above. If you are unable to validate this debt, I expect all collection efforts to cease and any reported information to be removed from my credit report. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

In late XX/XX/year>, I saw an advertisement for the AMEX XXXX credit card with an attractive XXXX points promotional offer ( in picture XXXX attached ). I applied for this card, and it was approved. In the process, I did not receive any notification on my eligibility issues. ( otherwise I would definitely not apply for the card ) After receiving the card, I was told that I needed to spend at least {$8000.00} with the card during the first 6 months to receive the XXXX points. So I used the card to pay for most of my family 's expenses, and we spent over {$10000.00} during the first 4 months. 

Because I did not receive the bonus offer I was expecting, I contacted American Experess customer service. I was first told that I would receive the points in a few days. I waited, and then asked again. The answer was similar. After waiting longer, I reached out to the company again. This time, all of a sudden, I was told that I was not eligible for the promotional offer at all! Also, the company claimed that I was notified in the card application process. I was shocked, and I asked for evidence for this eligibilty notification. My request for information was refused. I believe that the company misled me to applying for this card and to spending significant amount of money with it, without giving any of the promised offer.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Application denied
Consumer complaint narrative:
Received mailer for Bank of America Customized Cash Card and applied by phone on XX/XX/XXXX. Was informed that I was approved for just over $ XXXX credit limit and I would be receiving my card in 5-7 business days. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, my neighbor received a call on her phone from someone from BoA fraud department asking for me. The phone number they called was NOT LISTED ON MY APPLICATION NOR WAS IT ASSOCIATED WITH ME IN ANY WAY IN ANY PUBLIC RECORD. 

She, suspecting it was a fraudster, told the caller to not call again and hung up. 

She told me about it later that evening, after which I called BoA and spent over 2 hours on the phone trying to escalate my complaint, as this was extremely concerning to me and I had no way of knowing how they came to the idea to call the number they did and how many other numbers they called.

Was told that they would share no information about the situation with me, but that I could continue with the process of the application and verify other ways later if I wanted. I decided to wait and think about it and follow-up the next day with the Case Number they gave me. 

I called the next day, XX/XX/XXXX, to try to get more info on the progress of my complaint. They said I would have to verify. They " could not '' find me in their system with MY PHONE NUMBER, but I explained the situation, to which they requested the number they had incorrectly called. Suddenly, they could then miraculously find my account! Was told the application was denied, which I feel was merely retaliation. 

Was advised to visit a branch in-person to verify physically and have a customer profile entered directly from there. I did so. Was again on the phone while at the branch trying to get this fixed. Several agents said they understood my concerns and agreed that this was not right. Phone agent said they had successfully verified me and reopened the application. At the phone agent 's advise, the bank manager created my profile directly using my accurate and real ID info ( same info as provided on the application ), he placed a note in the system to not change any account contact data without me being physically present in a branch, and told me to wait a couple of days for the profile to go through normal upload procedures and propagate into the banks larger database. I did so. 

I called today, XX/XX/XXXX, only to be bounced around for another 2 hours ( at this point, I've spent approximately 7+ hours on the phone with BoA ), getting transferred and being told I was sent to the wrong department over and over again. Finally got on to look up my case number, only to find out it had been set to resolved and closed by " apologizing to the client '' I do not feel an apology satisfactorily resolves my issue. They used incorrect info from an unknown source. They attempted to discuss MY application with a person by voice alone should be able to tell was NOT me ( I am male and from the XXXX, neighbor is female and from XXXX - and remember, I applied by phone call which had recorded segments, that they obviously did not refer to before calling ). They revealed my name and that I had applied for a Bank of America card to an individual they had NOT verified, which is valuable information to a potential ID thief or fraudster. They would not provide any info as to HOW MANY OTHER PHONE CALLS THEY MADE TO UNKNOWNS. 

Bank of America should be strongly reprimanded for terrible fraud prevention procedures ( calling phone numbers not connected with the applicant ), for breach of trust and publishing private info ( for telling an unverified individual they were calling from BoA for me by name about a card application ) That is too much info to be giving out. Customers should be informed of ALL PHONE NUMBERS/EMAILS/ETC. that are NOT ON THE APPLICATION BoA uses to contact applicants. BoA should inform applicants that they will call numbers not on the application ( still don't know why they wouldn't at least try to contact me by my phone number, which the repeatedly refused to ) I could see if in this situation, BoA should, if they are too lazy to use contact info that appears in application which matches my profiles at other banks and on my credit reports as well as XXXX and XXXX reports, then they should have ONLY sent a letter to my address, which is clearly OWNED BY ME as evidenced by county public tax records and deed records. BoA should change their procedures to protect applicants and their existing customers. Their actions are beyond understanding. BTW, as a XXXX, I'd never give a passing opinion on their actions in an audit!
