Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX. 
Escalations Representative XXXX XXXX XXXX Office Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, SD XXXX Subject : Pre-Arbitration Dispute and Demand for Remedy Wells Fargo Case Number : XXXX CFPB Case Number : XXXX Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX I am writing to respond to your letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, concerning my dispute over the charged-off account ending in XXXX. Your response fails to properly validate the account in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, and your continued reporting of inaccuracies violates my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

This letter serves as a final demand for proper resolution before I escalate the matter to arbitration under the XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), as provided for in your Consumer Credit Card Customer Agreement. I am also demanding a remedy of {$9000.00} for the damages caused by your violations, including mental distress and inconvenience. 

Failure to Properly Validate the Debt Your response indicates prior validation of this debt ; however, you have not provided an adequate method of verification as required under the FCRA and FDCPA. The information provided does not resolve the following discrepancies : 1. Inaccurate Reporting : The payment history and account details on my consumer report reflect inconsistencies, making the account misleading and incomplete. In XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), the court held that failing to note a disputed debt is misleading and violates 1681s-2 ( b ). Your refusal to update my credit report to reflect this dispute constitutes non-compliance. 
2. Reasonable Investigation : In XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), the court held that furnishers must conduct a reasonable investigation upon notice of a dispute. Your response merely restates prior findings without demonstrating a thorough investigation into the discrepancies I raised. 
3. Reporting Without Verification : Under 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ), furnishers are prohibited from reporting information to consumer reporting agencies if they knowor have reasonable cause to believethe information is inaccurate. In XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ), the court emphasized the duty of furnishers to ensure accuracy. 

Request for Verification Methods I am requesting that you provide the method of verification used to validate this account, as required under 1681i of the FCRA. This must include : The exact steps taken to verify the account. 
Documentation from the original creditor substantiating the accuracy of the reported information. 

If you can not provide proper verification, you are in violation of the FCRA and must cease reporting this account immediately. 

Demand for Arbitration Fees and Itemized Fee Disclosure Should you fail to resolve this dispute, I will file for arbitration with the XXXX under your customer agreement. To prepare, I request a full itemized list of all arbitration fees and costs, as outlined on the adr.org website. 

Demand for Remedy Due to your violations of the FCRA and FDCPA, as well as the mental and financial distress caused by your practices, I demand : 1. The immediate correction of my consumer report to reflect the dispute. 
2. Compensation of {$9000.00} for damages and inconvenience.

Next Steps You have 14 days to respond to this letter with : 1. Proper verification of the account.

2. Confirmation of the corrections to my consumer report.

3. The {$9000.00} remedy payment or a formal settlement offer.

Failure to comply will result in immediate arbitration, and I will seek additional damages and reimbursement of all arbitration fees.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing regarding a notice I received from your agency concerning the referenced account. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Section 809 ( b ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1692g ], I am requesting written validation of the alleged debt.

Please provide the following information : 1. **Verification of the debt : ** - The amount of the debt and how it was calculated.

- The name of the original creditor.

- Copies of any contracts or agreements that outline my responsibility for this debt.

2. **Proof of your authority to collect the debt : ** - Documentation showing that your agency is authorized to collect on this account.

3. **Details of payments and charges : ** - An itemized statement of all payments made on this account, including dates and amounts.

- Evidence of the debt 's ownership, including a complete chain of title.

Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the debt. While I await your response, you must cease all collection activities, including reporting this account to credit reporting agencies. Under the FDCPA, collection activity on a disputed debt is prohibited until validation is provided.

If you can not provide sufficient validation, I request that you cease all further collection attempts and notify all relevant credit reporting agencies to delete any reported information about this debt. 

Please respond to this request in writing at the address provided above. I will need at least 30 days to review the validation once it is received. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

I feel robbed, and truly disappointed in what I thought was a top tier retailer who doesnt give a XXXX about their loyal customers I am attaching my statements showing my autodebits, some very recent public rants from other customers expressing their frustrations from various apps as well. Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
You never received your bill or did not know a payment was due
Consumer complaint narrative:
I made a purchase of an Apple product and chose to pay an on an installment plan through Apple. When you make the purchase you put in all of your information for payment to the same company that you were getting the installment from... Essentially making the first installments payment that day. For good reason I assumed that this would be used for all of my future payments. I didn't opt out of paper billing. I didn't select anything special. 

3 months later I checked my credit report and it showed up as having unpaid accounts. Using that information I was able to track down a website to check on auto billing status. The company claims that no information was entered even though I clearly put all of it in when I made the first purchase or they wouldn't have sent me the computer I purchased. 

They sent me no bills or past due notices. I didn't even have any information to know who the financing was through... When I called the number after finding this website it claimed the financing was through Goldman Sachs, not Apple. They informed me that they never sent any paper bills... Even though there were past due notices on the account, I had no idea this was happening and that my initial payment information wasn't being used. 

I would understand if it was a third party financing company that I had set up a totally separate account with... But then you get all of your account information in the mail. The website I'm still being sent to is an Apple based website. Apple is the company that I entered all my payment information to initially. This seems like it is clearly set up as a scam for customers that would give us no way to understand that the information we are submitting upon agreeing to the payment plan requires additional setup beyond entering all of our payment information to make the first installment payment and get the item. This process needs to be fixed. It's predatory. They claimed to have sent emails, but unless it was just going to my spam box and being filtered out automatically, I certainly don't see them. And having no system to send paper bills if you aren't getting payments or not giving someone the option to opt in or out of online payments at the time they sign up so they are aware and have copies of all of their account information and website for setup for additional payments.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Account Number XXXX Name : XXXX XXXX Dear Aldous  I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Your office did provide the original creditor information but did not provide my signature, in the box it says " Digitally signed ''. This is fraud. I did not work out at blink during these times. Also failed to provide number 3 from the below. I also did not live in the state of New York during part of the time period.Please remove from my credit report.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, I request the following information : 1. T

he name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe you this debt. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> American Coradius International LLC ( ACI ) XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Dispute of Debt and Demand for Removal Dear To Whom It May Concern I am writing in response to your [ letter/phone call ] dated [ date ], regarding the collection of an alleged debt you claim I owe. Pursuant to my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I formally dispute the validity of this debt and request immediate validation.

In accordance with the FDCPA, you are required to : Provide documentation verifying the name and address of the original creditor.

Supply a detailed accounting of the amount claimed, including principal, interest, and any fees.

Offer proof that I am legally obligated to pay this debt.

Additionally, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ), any debt reported to the credit bureaus must be accurate and verifiable. I have reason to believe this debt is either inaccurate, incomplete, or does not belong to me. Failure to validate this debt in compliance with the law obligates you to cease reporting it and to immediately instruct all credit reporting agencies to remove it from my credit file.

This is my formal demand for you to : Immediately remove this debt from my credit report if it can not be validated.

Cease all collection activities until you can provide adequate validation as outlined above.

If you fail to comply, I reserve the right to file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and may pursue legal remedies as permitted by law.

This letter serves as notice that I am documenting all communications regarding this matter. Any further action to collect on this alleged debt without proper validation is a violation of federal law and will be addressed accordingly.

I request a response to this letter within 30 days of receipt, as required by law. Please send all correspondence and documentation to the address listed above. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Denied request to lower payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year>XXXX my active-duty husband was sent to California for a 6- to 7-month training course. At the time, I was unemployed, and all of our money went into relocating from Oregon to California. I contacted Western Funding in XX/XX/year> to request a payment extension to avoid losing my car, which is essential for my daily life. Instead of extending the payment, the representative said they would change my payment due date. I did not request this specific change, but they proceeded with it anyway. 

A few months later, I called again to request that my due date be moved to the 15th of the month since my husband, being in the military, is paid on the 1st and the 15th. Our rent is covered by the 1st paycheck, and bills are handled with the 15th paycheck. However, I was informed that my account had already reached the limit of two due date changes, even though I had only requested one changethe other was done without my consent. 

For the past year, I have repeatedly asked Western Funding to adjust my due date to the 15th to avoid late fees, but they have refused. As a result, Ive accrued {$58.00} in late fees despite consistently paying my car payment between the 11th and 15th, depending on when my paycheck clears. I am a reliable customer who makes payments every month, yet their refusal to adjust my due date feels unethical, as it seems they prefer to collect additional money through late fees. 

Additionally, there is an error in how they are reporting to the credit bureaus. My credit report reflects an extra {$16.00} added to my balance, even though I am making my payments each month. 

Ive also attempted to speak with a supervisor multiple times, but I am consistently told that no one is available. This has made resolving the issue even more difficult. I believe these practices are unfair and would appreciate having my concerns addressed.

XXXX : SANTANDER CONSUMER USA Date open : XX/XX/XXXX Account status : close Balance : {$24000.00} Account : XXXX Illegal debt collection XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account status : collection Balance : {$12000.00} Account : XXXX NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL AND NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT To Whom It May Concern : I recently received a copy of my credit report and I noticed some account on my consumer report that should not be on there. I demand this account be deleted from my consumer report immediately. 

The reporting of these account ( s ) is/are violations of 15 USC 1681a , The Fair Credit Reporting Act [ 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( B ) ] : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( B ) any authorization or approval of a specific extension of credit directly or indirectly by the issuer of a credit card or similar device ; So let me explain. Under the Truth in Lending Act 15 USC 1602 ( g ), credit card is defined as the following : The term credit card means any card, plate, coupon book or other credit device existing for the purpose of obtaining money, property, labor, or services on credit. 
This makes my social security card, drivers license/ID, and license plate credit cards that are/were used for the extension of credit. 
. 
I have recently come across inform from the Federal trade Commission ( FTC ) more specifically the GrammLeachBliley Act 15 usc 6802 obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( a ) NOTICE REQUIREMENTS Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) OPT OUT ( 1 ) IN GENERAL A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. 

SANTANDER CONSUMER USA did not disclose this information to me that is required by federal law. 
SANTANDER CONSUMER USA knowingly and willfully withheld pertinent information regarding the disclosure of my information to affiliated and non-affiliated third parties. 

The above is talking about furnishing items to a consumer report. There are three notices that were supposed to be given and have to be clear as day. 
XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX are not affiliates of the original creditor nor are they " bureaus. The only true credit bureau is the CFPB and they DO NOT furnish consumer reports as stated in federal law. I have a right to privacy and Per the Privacy Act of XXXX as a federally protected consumer I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer may have given the original creditor, non written, verbal, and nonverbal per 5 U.S. Code 552a. Selling my nonpublic personal information is against federal law. The only way information can be shared is by common ownership or control. 

15 U.S. Code 6809 - Definitions ( 5 ) Nonaffiliated third party The term nonaffiliated third party means any entity that is not an affiliate of, or related by common ownership or affiliated by corporate control with, the financial institution, but does not include a joint employee of such institution. 

SANTANDER CONSUMER USA knowingly and willfully withheld information that explained how I the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. 
SANTANDER CONSUMER USA sold my nonpublic personal information to a debt collector company XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

15 U.S. Code 1692e ( 12 ) - False or misleading representations ( 12 ) The false representation or implication that accounts have been turned over to innocent purchasers for value.

18 U.S.C. 1028A Simply stated, aggravated identity theft occurs when someone knowingly transfers, possesses, or uses without permission, identification of another person, and then uses that identification during and/or in relation to the act of a particular felony violation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I entered an agreement with XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( services obtained from XXXX XXXX XXXX ) located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  contact number XXXX for a shower remodel at my residence for the price of {$12000.00}. The agreement was a pre printed yellow form of a contract. Prior to the execution of the contract, XXXX XXXX asked me for my social security number to ensure financing for the project. They failed to explain to me the cancellation policy or the financing rules and regulations, it was only confirmed that the loan application ( XXXX XXXXXXXX ) was approved by Momnt located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. I went through the next few months after signing the agreement without any communication from XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX. I reached out to XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX every week multiple times inquiring when will the installation of my shower be installed and I kept receiving the runaround ( responses such as the vendor lost the materials so we have to start the order all over again ) during each call that I made. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX never contacted me ( via email or phone ) and eventually, they stopped answering my calls and I left numerous voicemail messages on both numbers listed above asking for a returned phone call. 

I contacted Momnt, around XX/XX/XXXX informing them that XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX has stopped communicating with me therefore leaving me without a remodeled shower installation & I was told by Momnt that they will have to conduct an investigation. According to the FCRA it is the company responsibility to follow up regarding this contract as a consumer. Both XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Momnt violated me as the consumer, 15 U.A. code 1681ab permissible purposes of consumer reports. No one sent me documentation regarding the loan and no services were rendered-12 CFR Part 1022 ( Fair Credit Reporting ) along with 16 CFR 433 A and B ( Preservation of consumers ' claims and defenses, unfair or deceptive acts or practices. ) I repeatedly asked numerous times of copies of documentation with my wet ink signature at which XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX nor Momnt failed to provide me. As a consumer ( myself ) these documents were supposed to have been provided. 

Momnt sent me an email recently as of XX/XX/XXXX stating that " we placed a provisional credit on your account while we investigated an issue related to your account and/or your merchant.Our review is complete, and we have determined that the provisional credit should be removed from your account and the loan should be placed in active status in 30 days. '' However, when I called XXXX that same day to inquire about the investigation they had conducted since XXXX, I was told that they can not disclose the information to me. I requested for the loan to be removed from my name, financial and credit records-15 U.S. code 6802 Nonpublic personal information Obligations with respect to disclosure of personal information. Neither company can provide documentation that i am soley responsible for services that i did not receive. My request made was disregarded as then I asked to speak to a manager and was told that they don't have any managers to speak with about this matter. I was told that I'm stuck with the loan and that, I need to start making payments as soon as possible. 

As of today, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX have not reponded to any of my complaints. I have been harassed by Momnt via emails every month reminding me of payments that needed to be made prior them completing their so called investigation. I am devastated that I've been waiting over a year for a brand new shower that was never installed. The mental anguish of going through this process had been overwhelming, stressful and uncomprehensible. Under the circumstances, this loan should have already been removed from my financial and credit records several months ago and their lack of responsiveness, unprofessionalism and accountability have violated several standards. We will discuss credit report violations, compensation and removing this from my credit report. Please assist in taking action with whatever means that are available. 

Much Regards, XXXX XXXX

Debt Validation : I have requested debt validation from IQ Data on XXXX separate occasions. Despite their assurances on recorded phone calls, I have not received any documentation to substantiate their claims. 

Misreporting Delinquency Date : The reported First Date of Delinquency is XX/XX/year>. However, my move-out date was XX/XX/year>, per the court order. Reporting delinquency before the move-out date is factually incorrect.

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure IQ Data International ceases all reporting to credit bureaus and removes the inaccurate collection account from my report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to report a series of serious incidents involving predatory lending, financial misconduct, and possibleidentity theft perpetrated by Title Max.I am deeply concerned about the potential impact of these actions on vulnerable individuals, particularly veterans. 

My Circumstances : Please note that while I have relocated, my current accommodations are temporary. I am a legally registered homeless person. This situation highlights the vulnerability of veterans, who may be particularly susceptible to financial exploitation due to factors such as XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Detailed Incident Descriptions Title XXXX Incident ( XX/XX/year> ) : Title Max loan officer refused to return my vehicle title after an initial consultation for a {$25000.00} loan with monthly repayments of {$2000.00} leaving me alone in the parking lot of the loan office after it closed with no title to my vehicle. 
The loan officer physically withheld my personal property to coerce me into a loan agreement. 
I was prevented from voluntarily withdrawing from the loan process. 

Unauthorized Financial Access and Fraud : Fraudulent charges were made to a XXXX Dating Site. 
Unauthorized cell phone devices were synced to my online banking. 
Attempted fraudulent charges were made to Rideshare Companies. 
Unauthorized XXXX account debits were initiated. 
The first fraudulent charge at XXXX  XXXX XXXX occurred on XX/XX/year>. 

Solicitation of XXXX XXXX : The loan officer repeatedly suggested receiving a cash tip.

The loan officer offered a " good interest rate '' in exchange for a cash payment. 

XXXX XXXX and XXXX ( XXXX hours later ) : Another loan officer physically blocked me from leaving the premises.

The loan officer demanded that I download a specific app, provide email referrals, and share emergency contact information.

The loan officer used physical positioning to restrict my movement. 

Requested Actions : Full investigation of identity theft and unauthorized financial access Financial restitution for all fraudulent charges Compensation for emotional and financial distress Cessation of harassment and repossession attempts Investigation of bribery and unethical loan practices Enforcement of consumer protection laws to prevent future harm to veterans and other vulnerable individuals I believe that Title Max 's actions constitute predatory lending, financial misconduct, and identity theft. These practices are particularly harmful to veterans, who may be more susceptible to exploitation due to their unique circumstances. I urge your agency to take immediate action to investigate these allegations and hold Title Max accountable for its wrongdoing. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Log in Sign up You said : please rewrite this note, for clarity, thank you. This complaint is concerning XXXX  and Mohela 's loan services for my student loans. The continuous frequent phone calls have caused me to feel traumatized as a senior.

I am making this complaint that is pertain to the constant calls I receive daily even though I have made a forbearing agreement with them. I have spoken to representatives from XXXX  and Mohela to please stop calling me. However, that was ignored, and the calls continues even though my account has been transferred to Mohela. Despite my account being approved for bearing status, I received an email requesting payment. I have made it very clear to contact me by mail or by regular mail and not by phone, but that request is not being followed.

Whenever I talk to them, I am subjected to harassment and pressure to make payments. Additionally, they do not examine the account to check if I had previously communicated with them to check my account 's status. It seems that their only objective is to persist with phone calls and disregard the status of the account. I have also made several attempt to go to the website and I was denied accesses.

They have been told about my situation, which includes not working and not receiving any Social Security benefits. After asking for a forbearance and sending a money order to process it for three months, my request was approved. The representative took note of my account and requested that I call back in 3 months if I am unable to work to ask for another forbearing. I ask to send me a copy by mail, but I never received it. Whenever a representative calls, they seem to lack knowledge about the status of my account and that it is currently in a forbearing state. I have no idea how to deal with the continuous phone calls. I've asked for them to review my account and discontinue the number of representatives calling me, which starts early in the XXXX  before XXXXXXXX XXXX but it continues and I'm uncertain what to do. 
After my XXXX XXXX church service, XXXX and XXXX I was contacted by XXXX of XXXX  via voicemail at XXXX. Which said I need to contact a counselor to make payment arrangements. I have submitted my number to the do not call. Gov website list today with the hope this call persistent will stop. However, they have disregarded my request and continuously calling. Please advise what is the best way for me to approach this issue, thank you.

Subject : Complaint Regarding Unwanted and Harassing Calls from XXXX  and Mohela and disregarding the forbearance agreement To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding the ongoing harassment and unwanted phone calls I have been receiving from XXXX  and Mohela concerning my student loans. As a senior, these frequent calls have caused me significant distress, and despite my repeated requests to stop, they continue. I received a letter in XXXX that my loans would be services by Mohela and yet XXXX  continuously calling me as well as Mohela. I have told them both to stop calling, but it persist.

I have already made a forbearance agreement with XXXX, and my account is currently in forbearance status. In XXXX, it has to be renewed by me sending XXXX XXXX dollars to re establish the forbearance. However, I continue to receive daily phone calls, even though my account has been transferred to Mohela. Despite informing their representatives that I only wish to be contacted by mail, my requests have been ignored, and the calls persist.

Additionally, I received an email from them requesting a payment, which is confusing since my forbearance status has been approved. When I speak to representatives, I am often subjected to pressure and harassment to make payments, even though they fail to check the status of my account or acknowledge my previous communications. It seems that their only focus is making phone calls, regardless of the current status of my account.

I have also tried to access my account online through the website but have been denied access multiple times. Ive communicated my financial situation, including not working and not receiving Social Security benefits. After submitting a money order for a forbearance request, I was told to call back in three months if I am still unable to work. However, I never received a written confirmation of this agreement, even though I specifically requested it.

Despite my account being in forbearance, I continue to receive calls from XXXX  and Mohela representatives who appear to have no knowledge of the forbearance status. The calls start as early as XXXX a.m., and I am unable to stop them. On Sunday mornings, XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>, I received voicemails from XXXX at XXXX  ( phone number XXXX ), stating that I need to contact a counselor to make payment arrangements. 

I have already registered my number with the DoNotCall.gov website, but the calls have not stopped. I am at a loss for how to handle this ongoing situation and am seeking your advice on the best course of action. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Delays in the application process
Consumer complaint narrative: This complaint addresses many, many issues. Too many to try and list everything. Summary : The VA allows lenders 45 days to process loans. I am now on day XXXX. We signed a contract in late XXXX. The assumption pkg was delivered on or about XX/XX/XXXX. Since then, I've been asked for some documents multiple times after having sent them each time. Only a week or so ago was an Escalation Manager was assigned. After multiple attempts to find a way to reach this person other than the department email address, I did receive a call. I told her that months ago I was told one had been assigned. She could find no record of that. She also could not find the documents I sent a week prior scanned into their system. I sent them again. Those were the same documents requested and provided four times prior. During this process, starting approximately 2 weeks into it, I would ask to speak to someone assigned to the assumption so that we could communicate more frequently. Even though I made that request multiple times, nobody in the Assumption Department would even acknowledge they received that request. ( For that matter, I've left three voicemails just this week for that Escalation Manager with no response. ) Most often, after delivering the documents I would just get an email ( a week later ) saying the documents have been sent to the VA for their underwriters to review. The VA doesn't have underwriters ... they are internal to PHH. I even called them out on that ( having been a VA and FHA underwriter many years ago, and it didn't change their answer ). Again and again they would wait several days after I send, or resend, the requested documents before telling me, again, that they have been sent to VA 's 'government underwriters '. As example : A couple of weeks after responding to a request, I asked via email if there were any further questions from the underwriter and they said they are still waiting on me to send the requested documents ( the same one 's I had provided multiple times ). That, across multiple occasions, has added a month to the process. The initial assumption packet asked for a Credit Report fee of {$19.00}. Two weeks after sending that check I was told they hadn't received the checks. I provided a tracking number documenting receipt by PHH. They then informed me that {$19.00} isn't the correct amount anyway. The didn't seem too concerned that their initial welcome packet was incorrectly stating required upfront fees. That next day I overnighted the new undocumented amount. To this day that check has not cleared my bank. The original check was returned a month after it was received by someone at PHH with a note there wasn't sufficient information to know what it was for. Even thought I had the property address in the note. The last request for additional documents was the XXXX of XXXX. It is now the XXXX and no reply has been received from PHH. As a 100 % XXXX veteran, this has been probably more stressful than it should be. I feel lost and forgotten. Nobody at PHH seems to care. If they do, they haven't bothered to say anything to me. The sellers ( note holders ) signed an authorization document allowing PHH to speak to me about the loan process early in this endeavor. So that's not a valid reason, if given. I've lost three buyers for my home during this time. I've afraid to list it again until this is finally resolved. Which, of course means that I'll have two mortgage payments until mine sells and closes. VA XXXX and Social Security retirement dollars are not near enough to sustain that for long.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing about an unresolved issue that I have with XXXX cash loans. They are currently contacting me via XXXX XXXX firm, and It was brought to my attention that XXXX being sued for missed payments with interest included, totaling {$XXXX}. I have tried on numerous occasions to get a settlement before court and I am getting nothing but the run around. They are not being very helpful or understanding of my situation. I received the loan amount of {$XXXX} on XX/XX/XXXX, and my first automatic withdrawal for the amount of {$XXXX} was successful. On XX/XX/XXXX, I was let go from my job, and my check was held for administrative purposes. With the interest rate at XXXX  %, and was struggling to make timely payments. I reached out to XXXX loan to explain my situation and to see if we could work something out for the remaining balance. By XXXX of XXXX, I was XXXX  months behind on rent, and car payments and was struggling to stay on top of my utility payments. At this time I was facing extreme financial hardship and thought I was doing the right thing by explaining my situation. Also during this time I was taking care of my grandparents who both suffered from XXXX  XXXX. Currently my grandmother needs full supportive and personal cares now with her battle with XXXX XXXX and my grandfather has XXXX  XXXX or XXXX  times a week and has trouble doing things around the house. As the burden has swiftly switched to my responsibility, even with a new job, XXXX often using our last to take care of the household. I called American cash loans the after being served court papers, explaining my situation and they told my they cant do anything for me but provide my pay off amount. When I ask to settle I was referred to this number ( XXXX ) XXXX. I then gave them a call, and the representative stated that he cant help at this point because the account has been referred to XXXX. He then provided me with XXXX numbers : ( XXXX ) XXXX and ( XXXX ) XXXX. Ive since left voicemails, and sent a email to XXXX. I received a response from XXXX asking for all my financial info so they can garnish my checks. Before the court date roughly around XXXX, XXXX ( court date XX/XX/XXXX ) I contacted XXXX to get on a payment plan which they agreed to me paying {$XXXX} I believe the XXXX of each month until same time next year, which would equal to me paying {$XXXX} in total! I feel like this is very unreasonable, and complete usury considering that the interest rate is predatory and I have tried to get ahead of this by explaining my situation multiple times to XXXX loans. Even with explaining my situation to XXXX, they totally disregarded what I said I can afford and could settle for during this time of extreme hardship for my family. 

Out of the {$XXXX} loan I owe {$XXXX} without the interest. I offered to settle the debt with {$XXXX} cash before it got to court. XXXX even on a payment plan with XXXX since XX/XX/XXXX and have paid at least {$XXXX} back on the loan. I can no longer afford this and this is complete usury. My purpose for writing is in hopes that I can settle this debt and move forward and continue providing for my grandparents, and preparing for what XXXX come from their illnesses. I have no support system and im learning new things everyday. I truthfully regret taking a loan with this interest rate, but look to this experience as a learning experience. I have dreams and aspirations as most Americans do, to be debt free, and to XXXX day own a home. Please help me with my issue with this loan company.

Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I made a purchase using my XXXX XXXX  account for XXXX XXXX. This was a service that provided automated trading for which they offered a XXXX  day money back guarantee if I failed to make money. The cost was {$9900.00}. 

Over the XXXX  days, I ended up losing $ XXXX on an initial investment of $ XXXX. The company was stonewalling so I filed a dispute on my card as I knew or at least thought I was protected. 

I was told I had XXXX  days to file the dispute and did exactly that. I sent all info in supporting the dispute timely. After a couple weeks, I finally received an email in my junk folder ( no call ) stating some of the attachments did not come through.. I replied to the email timely with all the attachments and asked them to please call me if they had any questions. I also sent the same info back to a separate dispute email to ensure they had it. 


A few days later I received an email stating the attachments did not go through, so I sent once again and once again asking for a call. A few days later I received the same email again so this time I printed everything out, scanned all the documents and reset. 

A few days later I received an email from XXXX XXXX  indicating they were issuing a full refund for {$9900.00} ( what I paid ) so I assumed the dispute was settled as I sent all documentation supporting the XXXX  day guarantee, proof of my loss, and conversations with XXXX XXXX. 

Yesterday I called Citi to confirm and was told that my dispute was closed as time elapsed. I asked why I was told I had XXXX  days and that the delays were on XXXX  side. I further explained that no one ever called me even though I asked several times. I asked to speak with someone and was told the investigation teams do not take calls. They would not even help me after I said I received an email showing a credit was issued and all they said is it could take time I am at a loss due to this blackhole of misinformation and lack of communication and may be out {$9900.00} due to XXXX  lack of transparency and urgency.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Vehicle Repossession and Breach of Contract Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the wrongful repossession of my vehicle that occurred on XX/XX/XXXX, by Hyundai Motor Finance. I believe this action constitutes a violation of the terms outlined in my original retail installment contract ( see attached document ( XXXX ) and an amended contract that I submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. 

According to my original retail installment contract, any amendments must be documented in writing and signed by both parties. I submitted an amended retail installment contract, which was sent via USPS Registered Mail, acknowledged as received on XX/XX/XXXX ( tracking number XXXX ) to Hyundais Motor Finance Trustee XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX ( tracking number XXXX ) at XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( See attached document ( s ) who are the sole trustees based on Hyundai Auto Receivables XXXX XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, SEC XXXX annual report which is filed with Securities and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) XXXX This document is a legitimate and binding amendment to the original agreement, establishing my rights as the buyer. 

Hyundai Motor Finance has failed to honor the amended contract, disregarding the changes made, which ultimately led to the wrongful repossession of my vehicle. This failure represents a breach of contract that violates regulations in the UCC and the Truth in Lending Act of 1933. Additionally, I have not received my security interests or necessary documentation to conduct business in good faith, further illustrating a breach of trust that could be perceived as security fraud. 

Furthermore, I have expressly revoked any rights granted to Hyundai Motor Finance to repossess my vehicle and have not consented to share my personal information with any third party. This unauthorized repossession raises significant concerns regarding potential identity theft and fraud, under the regulations outlined in 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted a promissory note in the amount of {$54000.00}, which represented the total full pay amount due on the vehicle. The instructions provided with this promissory note ( see attached document ( s ) specified that Hyundai had ten days to respond to any issues regarding the note ; however, my attempts to communicate and resolve this matter have been ignored. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Collection Account Request for Removal Due to Lack of Debt Validation To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the accuracy of a collection account listed on my credit report under the account # XXXX. I previously requested debt validation from the collection agency handling this account, but they failed to provide the required validation. According to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 809 ( a ), a collection agency must provide verification of the debt upon request. Since the collection agency has not provided this validation, the collection account should not be reported on my credit file. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( a ), I am requesting that you reinvestigate this matter. The continued reporting of this collection account without proper validation is inaccurate and violates the FDCPA. Please remove this collection account from my credit report and provide written confirmation of this action. If the collection agency can not validate the debt, the account must be deleted from my credit file as required by law. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

[ XXXX A XXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX ] [ XXXX, Ga, XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] World Acceptance Corporation Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Debt Reporting and FCRA Violations To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally complain regarding the inaccurate reporting of a debt in your companys records. Despite never entering into a contract with World Acceptance Corporation, I find that you are reporting I owe a debt to your company. Notably, World Finance is also reporting this same debt, yet neither company operates as a legitimate debt collector according to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

I recently spoke with a representative from World Finance, who asserted that your company is a separate entity. During this conversation, the representative was unable to explain why an account charged off at {$180.00} has inexplicably accumulated to an amount well beyond this initial figure. It wasnt until a senior representative made a call to the home office that he received undocumented information regarding the reasons for the interest applied over time, which has resulted in a total that exceeds the maximum allowable limit. This lack of transparency and documentation raises serious concerns about the validity of the claimed debt. 

The representative then offered me an option to settle the alleged debt at a sum that exceeds the original charged-off amount, further highlighting inconsistencies and raising questions about the legitimacy of this claim and the methods employed to recoup this alleged debt. 

I believe this situation constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as you are reporting inaccurate information to credit bureaus without the appropriate contractual agreements or documentation to substantiate the debt in question. 

I request that you promptly investigate this matter, correct any inaccuracies in your reporting, and cease communications regarding this alleged debt until this issue has been resolved. Please provide a written response detailing the steps you will take to rectify this situation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ]

To Whom It May Concern,

Just like many other people in this world, XXXX  and XXXX were extremely difficult for our family. For many years prior to XXXX XXXX he worked hard and was away a lot, `but we were able to live a good life.  We had the things we needed and made sure we helped the three boys as well.

When XXXX went out on XXXX, he had no idea there were several different problems he was having. It was difficult to see the specialist doctors because many decreased their hours due to XXXX. So, between not being able to get in to see the doctor and the additional unexpected medical problems the months flew by quickly. He was still able to bring in close to the amount of money he made when he was working. (I have a letter that I sent in several weeks ago, but I could never confirm you received it.

I realize working with customers is difficult because I did it for over XXXX  years. There are so many things that end up getting mixed up or dropped and before you know it you have an angry customer. 

What I would like to let you know is when I was able to get someone on the phone, they were very kind and understanding which helped me a lot. The problem was getting them on the phone and the changes weekly in what they requested. 

Because XXXX was not cleared by the XXXX to fly, he decided to take a job in Texas to try to catch up on our bills. XXXX did the application and mailed it in sometime the end of XXXX When he started his job in Texas on XXXX XXXX XXXX, he had all the information with him. For several months paperwork was requested and sent in, but I could never get anyone to respond that they received it. We were never told a contact person so that was a huge problem.

I tried numerous times to find out exactly what I needed to send but they would mail me the same loss ligation form each time. I had information I wanted to explain to someone, but it was difficult to get someone on the phone. I often waited for XXXX minutes before leaving a message or hanging up. I remember recently, I spoke to two people and one of them was trying to get a manager, and I ended up being on the phone holding for an XXXX  and XXXX  minutes. I was told someone would call me back, but by the time I received the message the office was closed.

Having people that can answer the phone in a timely manner is critical. I believe if you are trying to reach customer service it is okay, but the loss litigation number is always a nightmare.  I have stay on the phone every time at least XXXX  minutes and usually more like XXXX  minutes or an hour.  I would not have waited so long but no one would answer an email. That is a huge problem. If the staff emailed it would save time and they would be able to get more done without so many interruptions. 

The phone would give you an option occasionally to press 1 and leave a message, but I never had anyone call me back. I cannot begin to tell you the frustration and stress when you need to get someone, and they do not email or call you back.

It was my understanding from talking to several of the employees that everything would be okay I just needed to provide the information, but it was like a never-ending circle. One week something was requested and then the next week something else which in many causes had already been sent in. I have never in my entire life had to deal with such and unorganized company.

Finally, the end of XXXX we received a letter to contact someone by the name of XXXX XXXX The letter requested I work with XXXX which sounded great, but I could not reach him. I tried for about a week and so did XXXX. I finally found out his extension XXXX  did not work because he was working from home. That was when I almost lost it. 

All I want at this point is for someone to talk to XXXX and explain exactly what you need. Due to my XXXX, I said I would have to stay out of it, but that did not happen because of XXXX schedule so I ended up helping and ended up being put on XXXX  medication.  

Because you have the calls recorded you should be able to go back and listen to the calls that were made, and I can send you a list of the emails if you would like them. My only concern is XXXX is in class almost every day so I do not know if you will be able to reach him. His number is XXXX and mine is XXXX

I have been more than willing the entire time to provide you with anything you want, but communication is the problem. We need emails or calls to let us what is needed as well as notify us if you received it.

I hope you will be willing to work with us and that this can be resolved without any additional delays or complications.

Sincerely,

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, 2024, an unauthorized device accessed my XXXX XXXX  checking account, and I notified the bank. XXXX XXXX  investigated the incident and flagged multiple transactions for potentially fraudulent activity. Among the transactions the bank flagged for fraud were three payments to my CreditFresh  line of credit, in the amounts of {$500.00}, {$510.00}, and {$700.00}. On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX  initiated chargebacks on the transactions without my knowledge. These were legitimate payments that I had made to my line of credit, so upon learning of the chargebacks I contacted XXXX XXXX  's claims department to reverse the chargebacks and return the funds to CreditFresh. I called and emailed CreditFresh, keeping them informed of the situation as I did not want to incur any penalties on my credit line. They assured me that once the chargebacks were reversed, all would be well. 

At the time, my outstanding principal balance with CreditFresh was {$1100.00}, with an available credit amount of {$1000.00}. I made two additional payments to CreditFresh in the amounts of {$380.00} on XX/XX/year>, and {$96.00} on XX/XX/year>. On the day of my last payment, XX/XX/XXXX, I was notified that my CreditFresh account was in default for a balance of {$2400.00} and that payment was due immediately. 

I contacted CreditFresh to see why my account had been defaulted, and was told that no payments had been received and the chargebacks from XXXX XXXX  had not been reversed. I contacted XXXX XXXX, and was told that the chargebacks had indeed been reversed, that all investigation into those transactions had been closed as requested, and my other payments had been processed and sent to CreditFresh. XXXX XXXX  provided ARNs that I sent to CreditFresh so they could verify these payments. 

CreditFresh continued to deny that payment had been received, and insisted that I owed a balance of {$2400.00}. They ignored the ARNs I sent them and did not give any indication that they had tried to verify the transactions. They told me that XXXX XXXX  had taken the money back, and that I needed to pay them immediately. I went back to the bank and was told the same as before, that all three chargebacks were reversed and sent to CreditFresh, and my other payments had been made successfully. The bank told me that this information was readily apparent from my bank statements, but called the XXXX claims department again anyway to reconfirm. 

I contacted CreditFresh again to see if they could use the ARNs to verify receipt of the payments, but they ignored this suggestion and demanded payment in full. I checked my account on the CreditFresh website, and none of the payments were listed in my account activity. In several phone calls and emails that followed, I asked them to provide the payment history for my account, and a validation of debt document. I have asked for these documents multiple times since XXXX, and have yet to receive anything. I continued contacting the company, suggesting on multiple occasions that they should speak to XXXX XXXX  to see what happened. They were not interested, and demanded that I repay the full balance immediately. I told them that I would be happy to facilitate a phone conversation between CreditFresh, myself, and XXXX XXXX  so that we could get to the bottom of this, but CreditFresh refused.

I supplied my written account and provided all relevant documents from XXXX XXXX  and my CreditFresh account, along with copies of my email correspondence with CreditFresh. They sent " receipts '' for these alleged chargebacks to my email. This claim was not supported by my bank statements, as no such transactions existed, but I asked XXXX XXXX  to look into it anyway. I was informed by XXXX XXXX  's claims department that no second round of chargebacks was ever initiated, and that the three chargebacks from XX/XX/year> had long since been returned to CreditFresh. I visited my local branch office to show a banker the " receipts '' sent by CreditFresh, and was told that no such transactions had ever occurred and these " receipts '' were invalid. I asked the the banker what other evidence I could provide to CreditFresh that these payments were sent, and was told that I had already given them more than they should need. I reported all this to the XXXX, to which CreditFresh did not provide any meaningful response ; they simply replied " refer to our previous email. '' I have done everything I can think of to resolve this situation amicably, but CreditFresh still refuses to speak with XXXX XXXX  or entertain the notion of verifying the ARNs I provided them. They continue to report a defaulted account which they threaten will be sent to collections ; this is both false and damaging to my credit profile. Despite my efforts, CreditFresh does not seem interested in working with me to rectify the situation. According to XXXX XXXX, all transactions in question have been paid to CreditFresh, yet they still insist that I must pay them again.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Email : XXXX Midland Credit Management , Inc . 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX  : XXXX / XXXX Subject : Notice of Dispute and Pre-Arbitration Demand** Account Number : XXXX XX/XX/2024 To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my formal Notice of Dispute regarding the alleged debt you claim I owe, associated with Account Number XXXX, which you reportedly purchased from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Additionally, this is a Pre-Arbitration Demand in accordance with the arbitration agreement contained within XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX original account agreement. 
It is my understanding that as the purchaser of this alleged debt, Midland Credit Management XXXX Inc. ( MCM ) is now subject to all terms and conditions of the arbitration agreement. I am fully aware that initiating arbitration would impose substantial costs on your company, with initial fees for such proceedings typically exceeding {$3000.00}. I also understand that MCM likely purchased this alleged debt for pennies on the dollar. 
The reporting and collection actions you have taken have caused me significant XXXX, emotional distress, and financial hardship. Rather than immediately proceeding with arbitration, I am granting MCM one opportunity to resolve this matter amicably. To do so, you must : Pay me {$5000.00} to compensate for the harm you have caused me. 
Permanently delete the tradeline associated with this alleged debt from any and all consumer reporting agencies to which you have reported it. 
You have 15 days from the date of this letter to respond and confirm your agreement to these terms. If you fail to meet these demands within this timeframe, I will have no choice but to proceed with arbitration, where I will seek all available damages and legal remedies. 
This letter is not an admission of liability for any alleged debt. It is also not a waiver of any rights I may have under federal or state law. I reserve all rights to pursue further legal action if this matter is not resolved to my satisfaction. 
I urge you to consider the financial and reputational cost of arbitration and litigation, as well as the likelihood of a favorable resolution if you meet my demands now. 
Please direct all correspondence regarding this matter to the address listed above or via email at XXXX. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Timeline In XX/XX/XXXX, I leased a XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) from XXXX XXXX in XXXXXXXX XXXX. The sticker price was {$62000.00}. Within XXXX weeks, I started experiencing issues with the car. While driving the car, it completely shut off. I was forced to turn down a street and use my emergency brake as the brakes did not work. When I brought it to the dealership, I was told that nothing was wrong with the car. In XXXX, I got a letter in the mail stating that there was a recall for an electrical issue. The dealership denied any wrongdoing As the weather turned colder ( Fall/Winter XXXX ) the electric mode started to fail so it was only allowing gas use. After many more back-and-forth trips to the dealership, I was eventually told that the electric mode simply does not work when it is cold out. I tried to go through XXXX XXXX who offered trade assistance to get out of the car. I was then told that there was over $ XXXX in negative equity just after 6 months of owning the car. Needless to say, I did not go that route. 

The car worked ok during the summer but around XX/XX/XXXX the car 's electric mode failed again. To make things worse, the car felt like it was " bucking '' and not running correctly. Again, after much back and forth from the dealership, I was told that nothing could be done unless a check engine light came on. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, the check engine light did come on and through diagnostics, I was told that it was going to cost {$25000.00} to fix the vehicle. Although this is covered under warranty, I continue to have concerns over the safety of the vehicle, given the history of issues experienced. I once again requested that I be let out of my lease but they forced me to take the car back. After driving it off the lot, I noticed that the electric mode still did not work but I was told that the $ XXXX repairs did not address that issue. I attached the response from the dealership. 

I tried once again over the winter ( XXXX ) to get the car returned but the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX denied my request. 

This summer, the car had various problems such as shaking while going over bumps and the touch screen freezing. I was told that it needed more repairs but they can not provide a loaner. I am still trying to figure out a way to drop it off and still have transportation. 

This XXXX, I received a letter in the mail informing me of a new recall. This time it stated that the car was a potential fire hazard. I have attached the letter to the email. There is currently no fix for this recall and per the letter, I am not to park it near any buildings or other vehicles. I am still expected to make my lease payment. 

I had been working with a Lemon Law Lawyer ( no cost to me ). I was told that XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) had access to my warranty history but upon requesting ( myself and the law firm ) it, we were both told that it would not be released without a subpoena. The lawyer ( XXXX XXXX XXXX has mentioned that it would be a good idea and would help my case if the story was shared. 

As of today, my husband and I still refuse to drive the vehicle with our children in it. I find it to be more than reasonable to simply return the car and be let out of my lease without penalty.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Privacy issues creator : XXXX XXXX XXXX Date open : XX/XX/XXXX Account status : close Balance : {$XXXX} Account : XXXX Illegal debt collection XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account status : collection Balance : {$XXXX} Account : XXXX NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL AND NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT To Whom It XXXX Concern : In response to the illegal privacy violation notice of selling my nonpublic personal information via cfpb case number # XXXX please be advised this was not a debt validation request. But showing you that your company Santander Consumer USA is breaking consumer law. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is not an affiliate of the XXXX XXXX Santander Consumer USA. The only true credit bureau is the CFPB and they DO NOT furnish consumer reports as stated in federal law. I have a right to privacy and Per the Privacy Act of XXXX as a federally protected consumer I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer XXXX have given the original creditor, non written, verbal, and nonverbal per 5 U.S. Code 552a. Selling my nonpublic personal information is against federal law. The only way information can be shared is by common ownership or control.

In your response via CFPB your company openly admits to selling nonpublic personal information. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, we mailed a letter informing you that the account was sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). They now own and service the account. We have stopped collection activity and contact attempts as we no longer own the account. 

Your company policy and Contracts have to be in accordance with federal law. Federal laws state your company can not sell or turn over my nonpublic personal information to a third party for any reason. This is why I want it deleted immediately.

15 U.S. Code 6809 - Definitions ( 5 ) Nonaffiliated third party The term " nonaffiliated third party '' means any entity that is not an affiliate of, or related by common ownership or affiliated by corporate control with, the financial institution, but does not include a joint employee of such institution.

15 U.S. Code 1692e ( 12 ) - False or misleading representations ( 12 ) The false representation or implication that accounts have been turned over to innocent purchasers for value. 
So yes! The transfer of these contractual rights from Santander to XXXX is breaking federal law! is a continuing violation of my consumer rights. Your company XXXX XXXX share our customers ' information for our everyday business purposes only means you can share my nonpublic personal information with affiliates or companies owned by corporate control, not third party debt collectors companies.

15 U.S. Code 1692e - False or misleading representations A debt collector may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation or means in connection with the collection of any debt.

The failure to follow federal laws pursuant to FDCPA, this is considered aggravated identity theft. Your company is participating in aggravated identity theft.

18 U.S.C. 1028A Simply stated, aggravated identity theft occurs when someone knowingly transfers, possesses, or uses without permission, identification of another person, and then uses that identification during and/or in relation to the act of a particular felony violation. Your company is aiding XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in the collection of extension of credit by extortion means.

XXXX ( b ) FDCPA To Whom It May Concern : Be advised this is not a refusal to pay a debt, but a notice that your claim is hereby disputed, and a validation of debt is requested. Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request a validation of the debt that you claim is owed to your company or organization. 

I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and written agreement of a contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this alleged debt. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION OF DEBT made pursuant to XXXX5 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA.

I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal and or contractual obligation to pay you. At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX ), attempts to call, text or email, this action may constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character. 

I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. If your offices can provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require 30 days to investigate this information and during such times all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with legal counsel for a suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. 
If your offices fail to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. It would be advisable that you and your client assure us that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action.

Name on file of alleged debtor. 
Alleged account number. 
Address on file for alleged debtor. 
Amount of alleged debt. 
Date this alleged debt became payable. 
Date of original charge off or delinquency. 
XXXX that this debt was assigned or sold to collector. 
Complete accounting of alleged debt. 
Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful. 

Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for PORTFOLIO RECOVERY, PORTFOLIO RECOVERY ASSOSIATION LLC, PORTFOLIO RECOVERY ASSOSIATION INC, ET AL in case legal action becomes necessary. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of the above is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, i went to XXXX with three others. We had pre-arranged transportation, which on the return did not show up so we asked the hotel doorman to call a taxi. He asked would it be credit or cash. We said credit. In driver tried to swipe my American Express several times and said it was not working. Something about reception in that area. I have him my XXXX card. Same thing. So we gave him cash between {$25.00} and {$45.00}. We were worried about missing an early morning flight back to the US. 
While at the airport I got a call from Amex saying they noticed suspicious activity on the my card. I explained what happened and told him not to pay that we had given cash. He said once it posted I could dispute and that we will take care of you, XXXX XXXXXXXX. I see you're a 20-year card holder. Well when it posted, I disputed and they said I was responsible for what turned out to be a $ {$450.00} credit card charge. Their proof was a receipt signed with an " XXXX  ''. I have a XXXX XXXX XXXX and working writer. Why would I sign with an XXXX Additionally, the XXXX XXXX. charged more than {$500.00} to my XXXX  card, which I also disputed and which a person in the dispute center told me " well you did give him your card, and you did get a ride to the airport ''. Amazing. I did not know the charges were made until it posted. Neither Amex or XXXX have backed me up and say I'm responsible for the full amount. I have been robbed three times. Once by the XXXX XXXX XXXX and now by American Express and XXXX. Everyone should beware of using either card. They do not support customers. I have never disputed a charge so why now? Obviously, I was victim of fraud overcharged. How can I be charged over {$1000.00} on two different cards on the same taxi ride. That doesn't make sense. Now Amex wants a receipt. Perhaps they will accept an XXXX  from me, though I doubt it. Watch these card companies.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute the collection/closee account listed on my credit report. I am not liable for this Debt of {$560.00} with BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE I did not sign a contract with BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE and I didnt receive Verification of the debt via the original Contract Account number : unknown i was listed as an authorized user to an account belonging to. I notice discrepancies in the personal information section, which I believe is inaccurate. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am entitled to accurate and verifiable information on my credit report. I am requesting that this collection account be investigated and removed if it is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable. Disputed Account Details : Collection Agency Name : BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE Date of entry : XX/XX/year> Reason for Dispute : 1. I have not been afforded the opportunity to dispute the account in accordance with 12CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( ). This denial of the dispute process deprives me of my right to challenge any inaccuracies or discrepancies regarding the alleged debt. 2. BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE has resorted to false, misleading, and deceptive means in their collection efforts, thereby violating my consumer rights. Such unethical practices undermine the integrity of the debt collection process and cause undue distress to consumers. 3. Furthermore, the agency lacks the authority to furnish any account to consumer reporting agencies without adhering to the necessary disclosures mandated by law. By neglecting to fulfil their obligations under 12 CER 1006.34 ( d ) and 15 USC 1681-S 2 ( 7 ) ( A ). BARCLAYS BANK DELAWARE is flagrantly disregarding consumer protection statutes. I demand that CFPB investigate these egregious Legal Basis for Dispute : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. The credit bureau is required to investigate the disputed information and ensure that it is accurate and verifiable. If the information can not be verified, it must be removed from my credit report. XXXX. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Under Section 809 of the FDCPA, I am entitled to verification of the debt from the collection agency. If the collection agency can not provide proper verification or validation of the debt, it must cease collection efforts and remove the account from my credit report. Request for Action : I request that you investigate this matter and provide me with the results of your investigation. If the collection account is found to be inaccurate or unverifiable, I ask that it be removed from my credit report. Please provide me with written confirmation once the correction has been made. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within the timeframe required by law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Email : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Bureau of Account Management XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Notice of Dispute and Request for Debt Validation** Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my formal Notice of Dispute regarding the alleged medical debt associated with the above-referenced account number. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting full validation of this debt. Additionally, as this concerns a medical debt, I expect your strict compliance with all applicable federal and state laws, including but not limited to the No Surprises Act and recent Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidance on medical debt reporting. 

Please be advised that I do not acknowledge or admit responsibility for this alleged debt. I am exercising my rights under the FDCPA and request that you provide the following documentation to validate the debt : Proof of the original medical service agreement : A copy of the signed agreement or authorization for treatment that demonstrates I am obligated to pay this debt. 
Itemized billing statement : A detailed breakdown of the medical debt, including the charges for each service, adjustments, payments made, and any outstanding balance. 
Proof of assignment or ownership : Documentation showing that Bureau of Account Management has the legal right to collect this debt, including the chain of custody if the debt was sold or transferred.

Verification of compliance : Proof that this debt complies with state and federal statutes, including those related to billing practices for medical services.

It has come to my attention that Bureau of Account Management has been involved in legal proceedings where courts found violations of the FDCPA. For example, in XXXX XXXX Bureau of Account Management ( XXXX ), your agency was found to have failed to provide proper debt validation and continued collection efforts despite a valid dispute from the consumer. I urge you to ensure full compliance with the FDCPA in this matter to avoid similar consequences. 

Until the requested information is provided, I request that you immediately cease all collection activities related to this account, including communication with me, and stop reporting this alleged debt to any credit reporting agencies. 

You have 30 days from the date of receipt of this letter to respond with the requested documentation. If you can not validate this debt, you must cease all collection efforts and remove any negative information related to this account from my consumer reports. 

This letter is not an admission of liability for this debt and does not authorize any further collection activity. All correspondence regarding this matter must be in writing and sent to the address listed above or via email at XXXX. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
