Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Email : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX LVNV Funding LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX Subject : Notice of Dispute and Request for Debt Validation** Account Number : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my formal Notice of Dispute regarding the alleged debt associated with the above-referenced account number. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting that you provide full validation of this debt.

Please note that I do not acknowledge or admit responsibility for this alleged debt. As you have purchased this debt from Credit One Bank, you are bound by the original agreement, including any arbitration clauses contained therein. If we are unable to resolve this matter amicably, I am prepared to pursue arbitration and seek all available remedies. I am fully aware that arbitration will cost you an estimated {$2500.00} or more per day in fees, far exceeding the value of this alleged debt. 

Furthermore, as established in XXXX XXXX LVNV Funding, LLC ( XXXX ), your company is required to comply strictly with the FDCPA. This includes accurately validating debts and ensuring that your collection practices do not violate consumer protection laws. In this case, the court underscored the legal responsibilities of debt collectors like yourself, and I will not hesitate to hold you accountable to the same standard. 

To resolve this matter amicably, all you need to do is remove all accounts associated with LVNV Funding LLC from my consumer reports with any and all credit reporting agencies. This is the simplest and most cost-effective way to resolve this dispute and avoid unnecessary arbitration costs. 

Additionally, to validate this debt, please provide the following : Proof of the original agreement : A copy of the signed contract or agreement between me and XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX that demonstrates I am obligated to pay this debt. 
Itemized account statement : A complete breakdown of the debt amount, including principal, interest, fees, and any other charges. 
Proof of assignment or ownership : Documentation showing that LVNV Funding LLC has legal standing to collect this debt, including the chain of custody if the debt was sold or transferred. 
Verification of compliance : Documentation showing that this debt complies with all state and federal statutes, including statutes of limitations.

Additionally, I request that you immediately cease any collection activities, including reporting this account to any consumer reporting agencies, until the debt has been fully validated. If you have already reported this alleged debt, please update any credit reporting agencies to reflect that the debt is under dispute.

You have 15 days from the date of this letter to respond and confirm your compliance with my request. Failure to do so will leave me no choice but to proceed with arbitration, where I will seek all available remedies under the law. 

This letter is not an admission of liability and does not authorize any additional collection activity. All communication regarding this matter should be made in writing to the address listed above or via email at XXXX. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative: For background, I have a number of CC that are mostly paid off every month if used at all and a perfect payment record on credit report and generally extremely good credit. I have had a Citi Bank Shop Your Way CC since XXXX  and it is one of my favorite cards to use for daily needs due to the bonus points and special rate offers they frequently send me. I happen to see the request for credit increase listed in the online portal and figured since I hadn't done that for this card in a long time I would request an increase. I normally do this for most of my CC periodically or the company automatically does it since I am an excellent customer. My request ( much to my surprise ) was immediately denied and then I got a message on XX/XX/XXXX saying it was due to " Unsatisfactory existing account payment history ''. This seemed odd. I called both the number on the paper and the number on the back of my card and talked to at least 3 people for over an hour and they couldn't give me much info, but they didn't see any late payments or anything in system. I was worried that someone had an unauthorized account under my name or something! Then next day on XX/XX/XXXX I get another message that the " system '' performed a review of my account and with no warning closed my account of 6+ years claiming " one or more occurrences of late or returned payments in the last 6 months ''. I immediately called and spent another hour on the phone trying to figure out where the heck they came up with that. Cycled through multiple unhelpful people ( probably more like a useless automated system that didn't let them do any customer service ) to a manager. She a least showed some concern but still said there was nothing they could do as it was an automated system review and the system rules did not have an override or any possible oversight. She concluded that 4 months ago I had 2 extra principle payments scheduled on the same day ( way over minimum required monthly payment that was already satisfied ) that got " returned ''. The only reason that happened is the scheduled payment account they were linked to had been shut down by XXXXXXXX XXXX fraud dept in an abundance of caution at the same time frame the payments were scheduled so the payments were " returned ''. Manager was nice enough to at least tell me she filed my complaint against the system, but I am not sure if she really did or if that helps anyone as there was no reference and she said it was internal use only. Really sucks to cut ties with a perfectly good customer and I find this to be a horrible business decision. And the fact that they can even do that with no human review from bank agent should be illegal, and who knows, maybe it is!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I WOULD LIKE CFBP TO ATTACH SAME ATTACHMENTS TO THIS COMPLAINT THAT I FILED WITH THE COMPLAINT AGAINST XXXX XXXX TODAY IN THE COMPLAINT XXXX JUST NOW. I WASNT ABLE TO INCLUDE MULTIPLE COMPANIES AS RESPONDENTS IN THAT COMPLAIN SO I AM SUBMITTING THIS ONE FOR DIAZ ANSELMO AND ASSOCIATES.

I have an urgent problem related to what I owe in federal and State of Florida taxes in connection to my mortgage debt, and to a lack of understanding what interest rates I was charged on my mortgage loan. I don't know what amount I owe and to which government agency, even though I am now in a second lawsuit regarding this matter. Please help me getting this information... I tried at least 12 times -using a variety of communication methods such as certified mail, phone conversation, email, and court- to obtain this information from : 1. The lender XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX. The servicer XXXX XXXX. XXXX. The debt collector Diaz Anselmo & Associates PA ( XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX ). XXXX. IRS. XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Florida Department of Revenue. All of these attempts were unsuccessful. I have been trying for a whole year. If I do not get this information in next couple weeks, I can be accused of a federal bankruptcy fraud crime. Here is what happened : 1. I wanted to sell my condo when I became ill and was 6 weeks behind in my mortgage payments. I asked my ex-husband to help. 2. My ex looked at my loan applications which were submitted on my behalf by my landlord at a time ( who has been a long time condo board member and licensed realtor ). He discovered that my condo address was changed during the loan origination by the seller entering a new building number for my condo. My title report was forged and it was not shown that there is a mortgage on whole building and land, and open mortgage from the former owner on the condo unit which I was buying in the building. My ex told me that government can forfeit my condo because false info was submitted to bank. XXXX. I notified the mortgage servicer on XX/XX/XXXX about the fraud and sent evidence of fraudulent loan applications and changed property address. XXXX. Mortgage servicer, instead of putting me in a nonmonetary default for fraud in the borrower 's application, as it is required in my mortgage contract, waited until I am eligible for a monetary default for failure to make mortgage payments, and started the foreclosure proceedings then. 5. Three days after the foreclosure complaint was filed in XXXX XXXX XXXX court on XXXX XXXX, my condo was sold to the condominium XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Our condominium operates as a special purpose entity due to being a historic-contributing property in XXXX XXXX XXXX Every time there is a sale, it is first sold to condominium, and the condominium sells the condo to a new owner. This is a double escrow scheme where a separate deed with the county recorder is not recorded at a time the condo is sold to the condominium. Condominium doesn't pay state or federal taxes due to being part of conservation easement syndicate in XXXX XXXX and the sale taking place with the help of the infinite banking insurance entity XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX. XXXX XXXX secured the summary judgement from the court and scheduled the sale of my condo on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX. The summary judgement order was written by XXXX XXXX lawyers Diaz Anselmo & Associates as it was ordered by the judge for them to upload the order into the court system. The summary judgement order changed the contract terms where the interest rate was changed and times when those interest rates were charged were also changed. Diaz Anselmo & Associates filed three different summary judgement orders with different amounts showing as owed. 8. Under Florida law, both the lender and the borrower are liable for the unpaid taxes. I wrote to IRS and Florida Department of Revenue asking to clarify what I owe but have not heard back. 9. I didnt receive the tax forms from the mortgage servicer for the year of XXXX. So I am not sure if IRS was paid for the mortgage interest income. XXXX. I filed a bankruptcy petition with the XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Court. But I have no idea what I owe to XXXX XXXX and to IRS and the Department of Revenue because there are at least XXXX different versions filed by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in the public records. XXXX. I called and wrote to XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and Diaz Anselmo & Associates many many times, asking for - 1.Explanation on which dates which interest rate was charged. 2.Title Search Report. 3.Evidence that IRS taxes were paid for interest charged in XXXX. 4.Proof the documentary taxes were paid to Department of Revenue. 5.Proof the court cost taxes were paid. 6. Explanation why the lawyers filed another document in court for over XXXX dol in legal costs 2 months after the final judgement was entered when the case was closed and there were no legal actions being taken such as appeal or rehearing. I was a pro se litigant in my foreclosure case. Tomorrow is my first hearing in bankruptcy court and I am scared the judge will accuse me of bankruptcy crime when they see that my petition has inaccurate numbers on mortgage and taxes debt, and all because XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX ignored my begging to provide clarification... help...
